I'm not a 14 yo girl, and neither is my husband. I didn't sign up for a diet plan. I  signed up for a meal service. 500-700 calories is acceptable for dinner. Having to make side dishes on our own to feel satiated isn't making our life easier, which is the whole point of a meal service.    I use this dish as an example, and if it was only this dish, I'd get over it. However, if you pay attention, they do this to most of their dishes. Their shrimp risotto (now always without scallops, which I'm guessing is because we weren't the only ones to get food poisoning) is a joke. It's half the size it used to be.  Pay attention to dishes, and take photos every (and I mean every) time you order; you'll see what I'm talking about yourselves.  In the end, the only thing that saved them from cancelling our weekly 12 meal plan subscription is their customer service, which is nice, helpful and quick to offer credits for bad service. But, we've had it. The Freshly experiment is over. May it die a quick death. We've switched to the 6 meals for a few weeks, and then we're cancelling. We live in Chicago. There are plenty of other meal services to choose from.

VBmsxdHzjYVQgqDGUWa2dw.text: I found out about Freshly through the mail ad so I did a trial for $6 meals. However, I wan't able to eat any of the six meals because it tasted horrible. Like others have mentioned, the flavor is incredibly bland in almost every single meal I ordered. The food quality was worst than frozen dinners. The packaging was designed horribly so it was a pain to open the seal. I was hoping I can get a full refund because I wasn't satisfied, but I was told that I can only get 25% refunded. Definitely won't recommend this to others.

3X0kj7nEZUJgjWrT3bFCCQ.text: Excellent customer service.  The food is delicious.  My favs are the peppercorn steak, meatballs pasta, shrimp and the penne.  I love their service and the food.  I just cancelled my account because it's kind of spendy.   I will go back and order again.

FmHBzhz6brTxVOWt6eFhmQ.text: Horrible customer service. I signed up for weekly meal deliveries and not only was I not notified that I wasn't getting my meals this week no one followed up. I had to call them and they offered no reason as to why the delivery was delayed and told me if I should get the meals I would have to throw them away.

lekTjGn39OYn5-_jv7rhGA.text: Horrible experience. I was so excited to try this company to make my life easier during a hectic week. Instead I received a notice that said my order was "cancelled" the day it was supposed to be delivered. I called customer service and was assured that it was just a delay and my food would be there the next day and that the order had already left the warehouse and was on the way. Ok fine. I waited all day for the delivery and never got it. Called customer service again and was told that actually it had never left the warehouse and was never going to come. Sure, they gave me a full refund...but I was left without 6 days of dinner that I had been counting on. If they had just been honest in the beginning I could've planned accordingly. I'm seeing now that apparently this is a trend with them. Would not recommend

YHTodj9Vy6UX6h3sRjkpwQ.text: I can only give 2 stars as of now, I just started with Freshly and my first order was due to be delivered this week, but I get an email saying it will be late and to throw the meals out.  I guess after reading some of the other reviews it sounds like this is a consistent problem with them.  Disappointing as I was hoping they would actually work out, but I guess I will move on to another provider and see if they can deliver at least.

XevYuNs464bd24a8lAxlSg.text: Absolutely awesome food so far.  I just received my 1st order 2 days ago and have had 3 meals of my 6.  So far no complaints. Food stays fresh for 4 or 5 days after you receive it.  Can't wait to try the next item.

ehwphar19DihKxnjA2VLPw.text: I ordered this service weeks ago and was due for delivery this week finally (Friday) and was just told today I won't be getting it. Interesting other reviews say the same thing happened but they got plenty of notice and a next order on the house. I only got a $20 credit and was told only a couple days before. Seems like this cancellation of deliveries is a recurring issue as well. I will likely cancel my service   Due to this since I am not sure I trust I will even receive my next order now.

SsdixCKnutmmJW7222yVuA.text: The food tastes great (and is healthy!) and love that the meals are pre-cooked so that I don't have to worry about cooking or a mess afterwards. It really does make a difference if you cook it on a plate rather than the container that they come in. And shipping cost is included, unlike some other food meal delivery services out there. It's also nice getting 6 individual meals rather than 3 meals that feed 2 people, since I live alone. And can't forget to mention, the customer service is OUTSTANDING! I had a problem with the actual delivering company (whether it be USPS, FedEx, or UPS) not delivering my food on time and Freshly refunded my order and gave me credit for my next order, despite it not even being their fault. Very impressed by everything about the company and highly recommend!

MJejzLXf2C9mrqwhepC5xw.text: Delicious! I just got done eating the steak peppercorn with veggies! It was amazing. I can tell you - I am one of the people who HATE frozen foods or packaged meals. However, this was something different. It did not taste like a packaged meal. They arrive is well ventilated box with ice, but it is a chore to get rid of the packaging! The box is super heavy because of the ice as well. The food is always delicious and enjoyable. Many choices for meals and new recipes very often! Also, the meals are filling and healthy!   I did have a little hiccup where they sent me two incorrect meals (this was quickly taken care of by the customer service team). I enjoy it and I will definitely be ordering more when I know I will have a busy week ahead that won't allow me time to cook!

SyZWKUzg6PoXD6uy-Z8JGw.text: I got the $40 coupon in the mail like most folks in the western US recently to try this food service.  I got my first box of meals just fine.  However, the next two boxes never arrived.  I got full refunds on these two boxes.  The issue her is the shipper, On-trac.  They are the worst shipper in our area of the country.  I would give On-trac a 0.  Since, Freshly supports On-trac, we have cancelled the Freshly service, they would not entertain the possibility of a different shipper more reliable.

7NtHlQ6udcLWKZVoDGWavA.text: Three meals in and we are nothing but satisfied...yes our first order was cancelled due to growing pains...not a bad thing!  Awesome for them!  I received a heartfelt apology from the CEO and my first order received on their dime.  Think the food is too bland?  Add your own seasoning.  Can't peel the sleeve?  Seriously folks...its not rocket science.  Seems everyone cannot be pleased.  I am happy to have found them and wish them much success as they continue and grow.  Peace out.

blriI2ppXzHOhIc7wcIOHw.text: Ugh.  Unhealthy REALLY, REALLY salty cheap food.  Not fresh as advertised and it's no telling how old the meals are. Stouffer' s frozen meals 100 times better.

bAlaiDyuy7OMrFfCYrUGsA.text: Tried this for our dinners this week... Terrible ! We compared it to airplane food.  Their food is not fresh. I was so unhappy !  We have ordered tons of food subscriptions and this is the worst ! We cancelled .  Total wast of $$ !

PSXbiYx-wZijLH_S_klluw.text: I LOVE Freshly! When I started my subscription I got the 6 meals a week plan, and after the first week I upgraded to the 12 meals a week. This gives my husband and I dinner M-Th and my work lunches M-Th. My husband works very long hours and I work full time and go to school, so coming home at the end of each day and cooking dinner is sometimes fairly daunting and we end up eating less-healthy than we'd like. Freshly makes it a quick 3 minutes in the microwave for a delicious, perfectly portioned healthy meal. We have yet to try a meal we didn't like and the pork carnitas is our absolute favorite. I anticipate keeping my subscription for the foreseeable future!

B6reNKhgPEAKuVLmM5HWxg.text: This is the most "meh" I've felt about food in a very long time. I tried my subscription for the first time today and will be cancelling after my experience thus far. I started with the porridge for breakfast. Although I really loved the texture, the flavor was very blan. I didn't even eat 1/2 of it because it was just that boring. My taste buds were lulled to sleep and went limp. I broke off a corner of chocolate muffin and was disappointed but not discouraged. The grainy texture was edible, but I didn't enjoy the flavor so the muffin went into the trash with the majority of the boring porridge. I was excited give my taste buds a treat and tried the buffalo chicken for lunch. Once again I am underwhelmed with the taste. The chicken tastes like it is processed and it's appearance looks processed as well (see photo.) The mashed cauliflower has decent flavor but should have a more "whipped" and less dense consistency.  I promise I'm not a flavor snob. I also am quite certain my taste buds aren't asking for too much! Outside of the easy heating instructions and ease of using the Freshly app for ordering, this venture has been a complete bust. Guess I'll hit the vending machine for something to eat for lunch as I won't be finishing my 2nd Freshly meal of the day (sad face).  **Update 5/2/18. The app is very user friendly and the customer service agents are very competent. I had no problems cancelling my subscription and received a very welcome message regarding my Yelp review. Kudos to the customer service team. If only the recipes were as great!

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

f2Ck4qyv-4DfU8LFH3RNTQ.text: Too expensive for the food quantity/quality of each meal. The meals can be tasty (depending on which you order) but are inconsistent with the quality of each meal and seemed like the cooks cared less with each week. The quantity is under what I believe it should be for the price (an overall judgement, one or two seem barely justifiable for price), the main course is often overwhelmed by the sides in regards to the portion. The "main" sides that should count such as rice and potatoes are often lacking. Overall I think there is a good concept here but the value isn't there as advertised.  I do have to say that the chili has incredible flavor and I was impressed by that, however the meal being only be a few spoonfuls conjured up some major disappointment. Chili being rather inexpensive to make should have at the very least matched the size of the other meals.

yAhwLtJp_octK63EyQdB_g.text: Worst company ever :(. I joined and signed up for the first order. I got an email from FedEx that it was delivered. I go downstairs and I see nothing. I called and they didn't know what happened. They said that they would follow up but no guarantee that they would contact me WTF?  At this point, I wanted to cancel my subscription and I was given a link so I did that. Now, this week I get an email from FedEx that I have an order delivered. I called to let them know what happened but I still get charged. I am told again that yes the subscription is canceled. I guess they wanted their money so they purposely make another delivery.  Stay away form this company fraud is writen all over them.

gju4PczC0Q9naumSuXWWwA.text: I've been using Freshly for about two months and I'm a big fan. Yeah, it's kind of expensive, but the convenience is unbeatable. The quality and flavors of the food are great (everything is very fresh), the packaging is slick (and recyclable), the automated emails regarding my subscription and deliveries are helpful and informative, and the website is super simple and easy to use. My only gripe is that I wish the meals were bigger. All the meals are in the neighborhood of 500 calories, which I find to be a bit on the small side. There have been a few times when I've been really hungry and a single Freshly meal hasn't quite filled me up, but eating a second meal would have been way too much food. I would love to see an option for larger portions, maybe in the 700-800 calorie range.

FuEdQLJmGBP_VBoU2Vs8ug.text: Absolutely the best prepackaged food around. Be as skeptical as you want to be, this is the real deal. Portions are great, food tastes delicious, and delivery is quick. 5 out of 5 stars for me. American owned and American made. Feel proud to serve your family some of the finest meals available.

QONtBHbdVN70yg2FAQwn2A.text: I'm having a difficult time getting started.  Meals were ordered in December and first delivery date was supposed to be on Monday, January 7th.  Tracking information is never updated so I have to email the company each day.  So far, the package has not arrived for two promised past dates and now they are saying tomorrow or maybe Thursday it should arrive.  These meals are being given to a older family member.  I am considering cancelling and trying another service when the third promised delivery date is missed.  Disappointed.

i6kV5gQQgsMrF-7fhGiwJg.text: I cancelled my subscription a month ago and was surprised to get an e-mail notification that I'm getting a new delivery. I called customer service and was told that "someone activated my account last night." Hmmm, sounds dubious. Who would hack into my account and order for me? It sounds like bad business practice where you really can't cancel. Anyway, they cancelled the subscription and refunded me back. I'll just have to see if I get another delivery notification next month.

49d9OzN8TDMRtKgdYhdyig.text: The food is okay, not bad. Reminds me of a good tv dinner. My review may be biased as I just ended a subscription with an awesome meal prep service. I won't name them since that would be so rude lol. They were about two times the amount of freshly, but I definitely see why. You get what you pay for. I am looking for a healthy, fresh, flavorful meal plan...I didn't find it here.

bOntUunZeOGMLcgf-VVpGw.text: I normally work at home, so dinner isn't too much of a problem. But when I got word that I'd be on a 4-6 week project requiring a 90 minute commute in each direction, I started scrambling for solutions.   I'd done Blue Apron and Hello Fresh in the past, and the food was tasty. But the amount of time required to cook those meals was a nonstarter. (The effort to payoff ratio is way skewed with those services!) I needed something faster - without resorting to frozen dinners and takeout. Enter Freshly.   Pros:  - Freshly does solve my time problem very well. These dinners take minutes to cook.  - They taste good, too. They're not amazing, but you're not going to get fine dining in a box delivered to your front door. What you get for the price is a solid meal. I haven't had a dud yet.  - The calorie counts are reasonable. This was another problem with Blue Apron - one meal would be 750 calories. And you'd be so darn hungry by the time you finished the epic journey to get the thing cooked that you'd eat it all. My Freshly meals have been closer to 400 calories. This fits into my life much better. I'm 40, I unfortunately can't scarf down 750 calories for dinner and expect my pants to fit the next day. - It's only been two weeks, but my deliveries have been reliable and on time.  - Because the meals are not frozen, you can take them out of the plastic tray for reheating. And all the meals come with instructions for doing so. I don't like to heat plastic around my food, so this is a big plus.  Cons: - Variety. This is the biggest drawback for me. My husband and I are pescatarian - meaning we eat fish, but not poultry or land animals. The selection of Freshly meals that fit into our diet is very small. Each week we order, we get the same things. Not because we're so attached to those meals, but because there are literally no other options we can eat. This is fine for the 4 or 5 weeks I expect to use this service, but it rules out using it for the long haul. On week four, one of our usual meals is retired and replaced with a new one - the cod cakes becomes salmon cakes. I mean, technically that's a change, but barely. I do feel for the company - meeting everyone's dietary restrictions is hard. But that doesn't change the result for people like me. - Packaging. The meals come in a box full of these giant ice packs. They're not really practical to keep and re-use, and the company doesn't want them back. So you've got to throw them out. My city only gives me a tiny garbage cart and these ice packs, along with the other packing material (recycled denim) take up half the room in there. Yes, I'm glad you can recycle the plastic bags and plastic trays, and it's good that the ice pack gel is water soluable. I do think they are really trying. But it's still too much waste. I can live with it for a few weeks but again, the long haul would be a problem. Can't all the brilliant minds in the world come up with a better solution than these ice packs? - Delivery. I have gotten my meals on time so far, which is great. But the first week, Freshly sent me an email apologizing that the carrier didn't deliver my meals. Since I did get the meals it wasn't an inconvenience - but it did suggest there are significant communication problems between Freshly and the carrier (in my case, FedEx.)   All in all, Freshly meets my needs and the time saved cooking has absolutely been worth the price they charge. It's a good service. With a few tweaks and some operational upgrades, it could be a great service. I'd recommend it on the whole.

7ySHduC8W5xIgdnyDamtUw.text: I had high hopes for this company but the food was very disappointing. The "slow cooked beef chili" had ZERO flavor (might as well have come from a can), and the "braised rosemary pork" was also bland... with no hint of rosemary oddly enough. Honestly, they could improve everything dramatically by just adding herbs and spices. The problem is there is no flavor, no complexity - no pop.  Yes, the idea is good and the marketing savvy... also the website and customer service seem well-managed. But the bottom line is - it's food. Food has to taste good. Unless they integrate good recipes, they'll never survive.

2-Nhj-Xkg1nGHNZC_NvNFA.text: You would think that with all of these poor reviews complaining about delivery issues they would have sorted it out by now and found a new vendor.   We've tried probably every meal delivery service and have never had a delivery issue with any other company.  Not sure why they are so challenged yet the others are not. Completely unreliable which is the entire point of paying for a meal service.  As fast as they're losing customers and as bad as their reputation has become, it won't be a surprise if they soon become the next 'Munchery'

SJkermsR6zY0Z7npcI6k7Q.text: I really wanted to try your service, but no food ever came. It took long than expected for the first order to ship, but I was ok to wait. That order never came and I was refunded. The second week also never came and I called to see why. The woman on the phone was very nice and apologized for the poor experience and even gave me a $20 credit and promised that the order would arrive the next day - it never came. I called again and this experience was much different. This woman didn't seem to care or think there was anything wrong with the service and asked if I'd like to cancel the service. 100% after this. I guess I will never know how good the food is.   Yours truly,  A very hungry lost customer

NAYubCMWDEPKbCDwBudY8Q.text: Used to love them and consistently used them for over a year but they started becoming inconsistent in deliveries/meal qualities. It's a pity because the concept is wonderful but the execution can be a lot better. The customer service has been great though and they do their best to fix their mistakes. I may try them in the future again but stopped my subscription for now.

LncsRystFHSXgj5Lys8ocw.text: Freshly is worth a try! I refrained from reading reviews until after I had tried it and I am glad I did. I have been using the Freshly service for the past 4 weeks. So far there has been one week that the meals were not delivered; I was notified in advance that this was to be the case. I would rather be informed that the meals were unable to be sent than to receive subpar meals. I have yet to eat a meal I was not pleased with. The food is flavorful and all the meat is juicy and not dry in the least. It is worth not listening to the reviews and giving it a try.  Especially since you can cancel anytime. Chicken risotto, homestyle chicken and bbq shredded beef has been my favorites thus far. The rest are close seconds. Will post new review after longer term trial.

aBRHxeQ1v74YYCeO36D7NQ.text: I love Freshly.  I've had no issues whatsoever with delivery.  They arrive exactly when they're supposed to and are in great shape every delivery. The cost is good compared to other delivery services and the food is pretty good.   My only complaint is that there's not enough variety so I have to "skip" deliveries often to avoid getting tired of the same foods. But overall, I have enjoyed Freshly very much. P.S.  Miss the "turkey shepherd pie".  Please bring it back!

EyuNXEC_gL7qzRH-bTcHUg.text: I've used Freshly before and it was awesome.  I resubscribed and had  the "wild-caught mahi".  It sent me to the ER with scombroid poisoning.  Which, though rare, can be fatal.

l0D6b3FzWJNFDxp5_chaPA.text: I was so excited to find this company and that they had healthy and delicious meals served right to your door and the only prep was to microwave for 3 minutes unfortunately it turned out to be a flop. The 1st few times I received my meals just fine and I really enjoyed them and I thought wow I have found a gold mine this is gonna be so easy to stay on our diet and watch your calorie count with these healthy meals that are quite tasty for quick fix meals. Then it all went bad! week after week I would order my meals and then receive an email saying that there was a delivery problem and I would not receive my meals this week this happened 4 weeks in a row I called several times to complain and yes I received my money back but they never seemed to fix the problem I would just continually get emails that said your meals are no longer fresh please dispose of them if you receive them as they are not safe to eat this is frightening and discouraging. After several attempts to get this rectified through the company to no Avail I canceled my membership I'm sorry to say I cannot recommend this company as they cannot seem to get their deliveries correct especially when you are paying over $8 per meal for small portions.

obfbqUphsRonPkSDyUno_w.text: Freshly is a FANTASTIC service! Their website is easy to use and the food actually tastes pretty good-not great but better than some other services I've tried. I have tried to get almost every item on their menu including the vegetarian ones and even those were good. They're packaging is great and I have never had an issue with my order being wrong. The ONLY complaint that I can give would be a suggestion that they add more low-carb keto options to their menu. Their menu is more calorie focused and I have figured out my body just responds better to the keto lifestyle that I was doing before. I hope they try to incorporate that food option more in the future as I would love to continue ordering from them.

YKhtOGNYfAavQQHM8leB5Q.text: I've been enjoying Freshly for a few months now and have to say they have exceeded my expectations. The meals arrive fully cooked and are kept cool in a well insulated box with earth friendly gel packs to keep them at a refrigerated temperature. They can go right into your fridge for later or pop one in the microwave for about 3 minuets and your dinner is ready. If you don't think you'll be eating them within the designated time listed on the package you can just freeze them and eat them when you're ready. This service is perfect for anyone who would enjoy ~ reasonable portioned, restaurant style meals at home that are ready in minuets ~ skipping the grocery shopping, meal prep, clean up and storage of leftover ingredients (that often go to waste) ~ and having it all hand delivered to your doorstep by a very nice person. If you're on the fence about trying Freshly use coupon link refer.freshly.com/s/Jodi... to get $20 off your first week AND another $20 off your second week AND free shipping forever. A truly great deal to see if you like the service. On a side note, Freshly pairs so well with another company called Daily Harvest. They specialize in "super foods" smoothies, chilled coffees, soups and "fits in a cup" sized meals. An entree from Freshly paired with a smoothie from Daily Harvest makes for a deliciously healthy, fruits and veggies packed, filling meal. Don't pay full price though ~ use code RE-D4LY7L4 to get yourself 3 free cups on your first order AND free shipping forever at daily-harvest.com

vauJkCTyA_pQCV4qqWLvXA.text: Food is decent but lacking in variety week to week. Delivery on saturdays which is the main reason I use it. $10 per meal is ok. The 1st week however, my delivery was lost. And the 2nd week freshly "ran out of food" so I didnt get my order. But i stuck around because i wanted to see if it was any good. Going to try other services now to get some more variety bc Im already kinda sick of the food. PS website is easy to use

pRFy_F63UHn3XS4vRx0uQA.text: The food isn't tasty. Its mostly under seasoned and not many ingredients. Its not bad tasting, but definitely boring. Others' description of this as a TV dinner are on point.   Its also not a good value at $10 a meal for a very small portion (compare that with a can of Amy's brand chili at about 3 bucks). I can leave my office building for a minute and grab something fresher (and maybe even cheaper), and definitely yummier, so its hard to think of the advantage here.   There is also a lot of packaging. Its very difficult to not feel guilty buying a week of food this way.   I ordered one week worth and cancelled -- am slogging through the meals now and am actually excited to return to normal food again.

XpoKfxemYHsVoUvxhl9Ihw.text: I just finished reading at least a dozen reviews. They mostly address delivery issues. I've never had a delivery problem, and I've been ordering off and on (I skip many weeks) for several months. Most of the meals are very bland/tasteless. I've only had a few that I liked. The meal that I had the other day was the turkey shepherds pie. It was disgusting! I ate a few bites and gave the rest to my dog. I went hungry that night. The chicken tikka masala didn't taste like an Indian dish at all. No flavor! At ~$12.50 per meal, I can get much better from my grocer's frozen dinners or in the prepared food section of my great market. I'm done with Freshly.

k86yMuZM9hKhapO18eVX-Q.text: I ordered the service back in mid-December. My first order, scheduled for January 11 was canceled for whatever reason, but I had plenty of notice and I received my next delivery on-the-house, so this totally made up for it.   I thought the food was excellent. It did not taste like a frozen dinner (from what I can remember. It's been a while). Everything was fresh and had plenty of flavor. The portions were appropriate - not too small and not too large (I'm 5'11, 215 lbs. btw). The peppercorn steak and turkey meatballs and linguini are my favorite so far.

ahfIfQw7TYxFhIN89n1cbA.text: I've been using the service for a few months. So far my delivery has arrived on time every Monday like clock work to Greater Los Angeles.   The meals are great and perfect for me because I just don't have time to cook.  The menu rotates, so you must log in every week to check your order and make changes.   The crab cakes and a shrimp paella dishes were the best ever. There is a lot of good stuff, you just have to find what is right for you.   I must say, I had tried another meal prep service and it was disgusting. One I had these meals I was shocked that fresh delivered food could be so delicious. I read some reviews prior to writing this and I don't see how you compare fresh unfrozen food to TV dinners. That makes zero sense.   Try it for yourself.

jijBFgT5MEUsxqPDLhjDzA.text: BUYER BEWARE: If I could give 0 stars for this review I would.   My first Freshly meal, the Peach Balsamic chop, turned out alright - except for the carrots which tasted an awful lot like burned plastic. If you've ever had a bad TV dinner, this was like that, x10. Wound up tossing the whole thing, because why flirt with fate?   Little did I know that a few days later I would get taken down by another meal which I finished in full, the Buffalo Chicken entree. Within a few hours of consumption I started to feel ill, and wound up with food poisoning, which till today is still acting up.  I ordered Freshly as I'm going through a particularly busy period at work right now, and to be felled by food poisoning as a result of my hoping for some convenience now seems completely moot. I cancelled my subscription today, and won't be looking back.

x_MQ8VtLPS_yzaWSaVBAIA.text: It is a great service and very convenient for sure. The dinners are on the small side, but honestly most people shouldn't be eating more than 500 calories per meal anyway. The size of these meals is more of a wake-up call to how ridiculously huge American restaurants' meals have become over the years. By the forth meal I was becoming satisfied with the reduced portions. These are higher quality than the vast majority of even the ~$5+ top frozen diners but not quite up to restaurant level, this is a bit disappointing as the price is in fact up to restaurant level after shipping. At the introductory price it is well worth the small extra cost for fresh meat, the beef dishes in particular taste noticeably better not having been frozen. At the regular Freshly price, I would probably stick with entrees from Evol and Trader Joes. It is a close call and to be fair, convenience isn't worthless. For someone very busy it might be worth it to you to not have to go shopping.

vxx72OEWa-JbXU1GN1fE4w.text: Just canceled my subscription. I really want to love Freshly -- I cannot eat gluten and I also have a busy lifestyle so I was happy to support a gluten-free meal delivery service. The meals I tried were cauliflower & sausage and the beef chili. They are delicious enough for the price and convenience.  The problem is that two out of three weeks of service have required me to contact customer service twice because of delivery issues. The first issue was my box had five meals but they charged me for six. How do you just forget to pack a meal? I worried a bit about attention to detail and quality control, but no matter.  The following week, my shipment never arrived, but they charged my credit card anyway. When I finally called, they apologized and said that it would arrive three days late and the food would need to be thrown out, as it had expired. That's when I canceled.   I tried this service to save time. I need reliability. I don't have time to chase down refunds every week for their mistakes. And I don't like that I never got any communication from them about the late delivery. Do they just charge your card and hope nobody notices?  They get an extra star for 1) trying. Gluten-free kitchen is great. I did not get cross contaminated from this service. 2) Refunding my money without argument and offering a 50% discount on my next delivery. 3) Recyclable packaging.  Anyway, if you do try it, try the beef chili. It's really good.

R7UU_Y7CsGOuwRS-0gK5uw.text: I'm afraid I tried the 6 meals with the $39 intro deal and I just cancelled.  Delivery was fine. There's a ton of packaging to deal with though. Bit of a pain.  Mostly it's the taste. All are overcooked already so when I reheat them the vegetables are dead.  And SO BLAND! Every one is bland, bland, bland.  I have to add a ton of seasonings to be make them edible.   I won't be reordering. Sadness. I really wanted this to work.

AIgWBR_AYEclAx3ut-gvVA.text: FRESHLY IS SO GOOD YOU WANT MORE!  When I finish my plate it's clean, not a drop left. It's easy to order. It's easy to change your meals. I get three meals a day. I have two subscription so I can. They don't have breakfast but I just eat one of there meal in the morning. Like Risotto or the Turkey Shepherds Pie. It's portioned out, which I need...bad. The food is awesome, and it's a great price. Thank you Freshly and Sean for making my healthy journey easy  :) I know that sounds corny but it's True. Bon appetit

Love the meals, they are healthy, balanced and taste great. The first time I ordered one of each (well almost since there a LOT of choices) from there I figured out real quick which ones I liked and which I didn't care for.  I have been ordering these every week for 3 months and love it!!

tCfO4NROFlJIBm50HpISIA.text: These meals are not edible. They are truly disgusting and a waste of money. Avoid this place at all cost.  They will not give you a full refund either, even though their websites states that they will.  The terms are vaguely written so they will only give you partial refund.  You are better off just buying a frozen meal from the grocery store because those cardboard meals actually taste better.

qu119KRjolDDaZihgrN0eQ.text: The first subscription arrived on time. Food tasted okay, I wouldn't say something great. I realized I could probably cook the same type if not better meals at home. But anyways, the whole idea of having Freshly is to cut down time on cooking when you're having busy weeks. The second delivery on the day before Thanksgiving never showed up, they emailed me it would be delivered the next day. Nothing, no emails and I understand it's holiday, so why commit something you know you can't deliver? I am cancelling my subscription and will probably check out other options for ad hoc needs.

A0JkNk5DuwGIchmri6hRZg.text: I've only gotten a few boxes so far but for someone like me, who doesn't want to cook, these meals are great.  The $10 per meal seems to be kind of an industry standard--well, same price as Blue Apron--but I don't have to cook anything so the labor alone is worth the $10.  The portions are good, the flavors are great.  I prefer low-carb and they have a good number of options.  I can see it getting a bit monotonous after awhile but they seem to add new meals fairly often.  Like Blue Apron, the packaging is crazy, but I'm not sure how you fix that.  The big frozen gel packs are a hassle to dispose of.  But I've enjoyed the meals, and the ability to eat healthy and not have to cook.  I'm amazed they always come out of the microwave evenly heated up.  No cold spots.  Didn't have any delivery issues. Their website is really simple to use--easy to pick out meals. I'll keep it up as long as I can afford it and the food tastes good.  I would imagine one of the biggest challenges of these subscription food services is to keep people interested in the long term by changing things up.  I hope they can find a way to do that.

VEzThsBXNfve7bvsSCp9Qg.text: Tis is a great service, items arrive beautifully packaged in the delivery box. I was quite impressed after comparing to blue apron.  The food taste great, and it is as easy as warming up in the microwave for 2 minutes. No clean up, no cooking no mess. I wish they had more options as they only change one item per week, I can see myself getting tired of it, but hey, if I can feed my family with natural ingredients and preservatives as easy as I am able to do so with Freshly, then hey.. its great in my book!

D-zeVve96jOm4PybLSwLVw.text: I absolutely LOVE freshly!!  Honestly, I am shocked at all of the poor reviews (seriously, ignore those complainers)- you're receiving a refrigerated meal through the mail that you microwave, of course it's not going to taste 5-star restaurant fresh, but honestly, it's pretty damn close!  Aside from the turkey (I advise not starting with that one), my husband and I have loved all of the meals we've tried.  His favorite is the pork carnitas, and my staples are the buffalo chicken and the chicken parm.  They're both under 500 calories and under 20 carbs (great for a low carb, calorie diet).  I wish they'd offer more low carb dishes for around 400 calories though. Most of the time the chicken is juicy, although sometimes you will get a dry piece here and there (oh well).  The mashed cauliflower is AMAZING and healthy - it's a win, win!  I wish I could order this in bulk... I would serve it on the reg for dinner. The peppercorn steak was surprisingly good and juicy - again, you just microwaved a steak, so not the best steak you've ever consumed, but wonderful considering you prepped for under 5 minutes... and you're getting to eat guilt free steak. My husband and I both work crazy hours and want to avoid going out to eat for lunch and meal prepping lunches - $10 for lunch isn't ideal, but it's cheaper and healthier than going out.  We both eat three per week for lunch.  If we don't use one before the expiration date, we throw it in the freezer for the weekend or following week.  If you crave simple, healthy and tasty meals, and you don't mind shelling out $10 each, this is the service for you!  Highly recommend!!

r8FOF_ZkpPs4I_Lb8ncJBQ.text: Freshley was new to my area and was offering a $20 discount for the first 2 weeks of meals. I signed up on January 1st and saw that the first available Saturday delivery date was Jan. 26, which I chose. It seemed a long time to wait but I figured it was more of a pre-order situation since they were just starting to deliver in the region. On 1/18 I received an email that due to an "upcoming winter storm" they had to cancel my order (which was confusing as there was no winter storm in my area at the time). They refunded me and gave me a $20 credit, which was nice. I figured it was a fluke and rescheduled my first delivery for 2/2. Two days prior to my delivery date, I got an email that my order had shipped. However, mid- day on Feb 2nd, they emailed me saying that my order could not be delivered due to an "unexpected delay". After two undelivered boxes, I cancelled my membership. I was willing to give them a pass the first time, but it's clear they are not reliable and have a lot of logistical work to do.

4v9YykqdY7LreSn4jD8NHQ.text: I ordered Freshly last week and was excited for it to arrive yesterday. Tracked the package all day and it said delivered at 6:14pm at the Front Door. I go out at 6:30 to get the package, and its nowhere to be found. I was hoping a neighbor may have received it by accident, however they did not. Customer service immediately credited my account, and they were very prompt. However, this review is based on purchasing, yet unable try the food. I have skipped next week's delivery as I will be out of town. So it will be two weeks until I can finally try the food, and hopefully update the review.

VFQGvjIu3JRgSuHdO_rFwg.text: Horrible service.  I did not know it was a recurring service.  Then email.  Your next meal is shipping.  I'm like, "wait did I order this one?"  I never made meal selection either.  I cannot cancel the order because this is already shipped etc.  meals were expensive and not worth buying either.  Not much better than the freezer section.  watch out.

d8GoUPxNhiOHH3de-PELGA.text: The menu is very limited with mostly chicken options. We got the veggie pasta which was good. The steak with pepper sauce not so much. The beef had that stewed flavor. The pork with rosemary was really tasteless. If their was rosemary it was undetectable. Dumped bbq sauce on it . Veggies with this no flavor either. Will not be ordering from them again!

ChnN7oFro9p_CBH5YSs_qw.text: I've tried my share of food delivery services, so when Freshly had a promotion on Facebook I decided to give them a try. Someone below compared this to food served on an airplane, and I think that's accurate if a bit forgiving. Oily, poorly flavored, overcooked. You'd be doing yourself a favor by purchasing canned or frozen foods from a more reputable source. Competitors at the same price range in my area are of such a better quality that it would be silly to compare. That there are reviews claiming their food is 'delicious' seems highly suspect to me, but I suppose taste is subjective.   Further, you will be given precisely one day to cancel your subscription after delivery. Freshly will not offer you a confirmation code to keep for your records. When I was concerned that something was amiss with my cancelation (they sent an email asking if I wanted to adjust my meals), I was told there was no record I had stopped the service and that I should be pleased that they could cancel the next. That was five days before the delivery date. For the first time ever, I had to contact my bank to intercede on my behalf.   TLDR: I would not recommend the food or the customer service.

G13DjKETo3GtVXfADRHwJg.text: I used this service for a very unique reason. I had 2 friends in different states who both "just lost their husbands." In deciding what I could do to help them while they were so down, knowing they won't feel like cooking just for themselves; I decided to send each of them meals from Freshky.com for a few weeks. First and foremost both of these friends raved about the "quality and freshness of the meals received." For me, setting up the two accounts and organizing different meal variety for each week for both friends was "very easy to do" - just be careful because if you don't switch out the meals yourself for each week, the system will default to your latest order. Anyway, it was easy to skip weeks, change up the meals, and cancel once I felt my friends had some time to adjust a little better from their losses. Prices are reasonable, with high quality fresh ready made meals delivered to their doors, this was a good choice and I am thankful for their services.

WGvITFSBIuR2-xeswLUnOA.text: so I read a bunch of the reviews before trying freshly out, and did read a couple that scared me a bit about getting sick from the food. but, I decided to try it anyway (maybe it was a fluke). lo and behold, I received my first box last night. I was a little nervous of the idea of shipping a box of cooked meals overnight. when I received the food, it felt somewhat like a cold room temperature. I had the chicken risotto first. after I finished the meal, I did start to have a slight allergic reaction (sometimes food that's processed with soy and corn trigger a skin allergy where I get itchy). that happened with my meal last night. however, the worst part was this morning - I literally had pretty terrible diarrhea right when I got to work at 8:30...and I'm 99% sure it was attributed to the freshly meal I had. maybe it was an allergic reaction to the food, or maybe it was a cooked meal being shipped overnight in less than ideal conditions, but whatever it was, I'm not taking the risk to have another. the good thing is that freshly is refunding me the cost of the meals, but it is rather disappointing since I was hoping this could be a good meal service to use.

aURhkeEOnv1dzdgsn94crw.text: I just started receiving my meals these past two weeks.  I cannot say enough good things about this service.  Dinner is cooked in 3 minutes and the meals are delicious.  The ingredients are fresh, and the best part is when I come home from work, dinner is already cooked and there is no mess to clean up!  Thank you Freshly!

rw9FdAWmUbR0C7Bn89P_5g.text: I really wanted to love Freshly and gave it a good three month run but am pretty sure I'll be cancelling in the next few weeks. It still would serve a purpose for some people, so I'll layout some PROS and CONS.  PROS:  - Very convenient and truly solves the after work dinner insanity problem, particularly for families with young kids. 3ish minutes in the microwave and you're done. We started subscribing after my husband and I went back to work after maternity and paternity leave with our second kid. It was incredibly helpful during the first couple months with a new baby and struggling to adjust with going back to work full time. For scenarios like this, I would for sure recommend Freshly as a temporary solution to get your through a hectic time period.  - Again, so much easier than any of the subscription 'make it yourself' meal box services like Hello Fresh, Plated, Blue Apron, etc. - Better taste wise than many frozen meals.  - Reasonable calories for a meal, would be great if you were trying to lose weight.  - Our toddler actually ate many of the meals without much fuss. (He and I would split a meal and my husband would eat a full meal, portions are good.) - Only had one issue with delivery (wrong meal arrived) and customer service promptly gave us a credit on the next shipment.  CONS: - Small selection of meals and it seems like many meals we like aren't available all the time.  - In an average sample of 5 meal options, I'd say 2 were great, 2 were just OK and 1 we would throw out because it would be plain old gross. That's a decent ratio but at the end of the day we were snacking heavily after the mediocre meals and having to find a replacement (hello boxed mac and cheese) for the really gross meals we paid $10 each for, I just don't see the long term value in the service. They let you rate meals online and I've never once got a customer service response after giving meals 1 star. Would be nice if they acknowledged duds and gave you some credits for future meals.  - Delivery is only available on Saturday, and meals go bad on Wednesday. Since we wanted these to solve our dinner after work problem, that meant no flexibility for Mon-Wed meals, and we still had to cook or find other options for Thursday and Friday. Sunday or Monday delivery would be much preferred.   - It sort of assumes everyone is gluten free. I like gluten. Gimme that gluten. Please let me have some real pasta instead of rice pasta. :)

-TqAOdcuuj5vF3C9zQXd4A.text: So, we ordered freshly early December because we had a baby in late November. What they didn't tell us was that two weeks into our subscription they decided to go on a two week holiday! No email, no communication.. they just updated our food plan and basically said, freshly will be closed due to the holiday so your next shipment will be Jan 8th... ok, well we still have to eat and we had no warning and no heads up as to that happening when we signed up or we would have used a different delivery service which is exactly why I'm sure they didn't tell anyone! So January comes and I'm trying to pick new meals and I notice there are no new meals. On their website it states they update their meals weekly so you get a few new choices. I chatted with the company and they told me that for the next month or so there would be no new choices because they were opening a second kitchen and it was a lot of work for them. I just like!!! But the reason we signed up is to have an array of fresh meals and you guaranteed that we would get new options weekly as stated on your website. She responded with, well we don't actually guarantee that!!! I'm so confused by the lack of communication with this company and frankly how disrespectful it is to take peoples money and promise something and not deliver. My mother in law got a notice that they just started to charge her account and send her food WITHOUT her permission and she had an account over a year ago. She hasn't even logged in in a year! They refunded her but what the hec?? They ended up giving us a one time discount and we paid for one more week after that and decided to cancel. Freshly, if you want people to use your service, COMMUNICATE and be honest.

awzKP9VJ_AKn7ucawhpyKg.text: This meal service worked for me . . . until they didn't deliver on the fourth delivery cycle!  I have never had a meal service fail to deliver as scheduled.  When I contacted Freshly about the missed delivery, which meant food sitting in transit in the summer for days and having to pay for another food option that day, they just told me that it would stay fresh when it got there and they would credit me $12 (less than another food option) on the next order.  I still don't have the food and will likely be disputing the full charge with my credit card.  Certainly canceling this service.  There are too many reliable meal delivery services out there for a company to be so nonchalant about a delivery failure.

VZK3yeN4MW7NTFrlxx2J0A.text: Went down hill, food practically went in the trash will not order again.  Ordered it a few months ago decided to try it again and wow food was not the same.

C2aNXnhdbdbfKAcNpWSg9w.text: Very unhappy with delivery. Tracked meals all day,, were supposed to be delivered today,, never came,, so now I'm waiting an additional day where they will be sitting all day long in the sun. Called and they were not helpful, stated I was still within the transit time of 48 hours and 12 hours to sit on your doorstep. I have always received them late on the following day from being shipped, however,  3 days is a long time for food to get shipped, get it in the fridge and then try and eat 6 meals before they go bad?? I end up freezing a lot of them.  Not for me,, had it for about 5 weeks but I have cancelled. Food is ok tasting but not that great.  Easy decision to cancel. Would not recommend.  UPDATE Megan reached out to me and we have resolved the issue. I appreciated the quick response. She truly cared about my issue and I am updating my review to reflect the excellent customer service.

6NyNK5XPO5n93_jB2Pob_g.text: Most of the meals are delicious. I like not having to do any prep, instead just microwaving them. They're healthy and are a good portion size.

iEROCtDPJnzt-Pldptracg.text: I originally liked Freshly but they messed up my order more than once. When I moved, I changed my address, their website and app said it would take effect on Jan 9th (a month after I submitted the change of address). They delivered to the wrong address and would not refund my credit card. To me that is very serious. They essentially stole from me. They lost the product and expected me to pay for it. Don't work with this terrible company.

ZZTBSnoXQKv2tdCYH2cCRw.text: my brother hooked me up with this ....so I opened up an account got 20 dollars off my first order ..lo AND BEHOLD NEVER GOT MY FOOD .first got an email saying my delivery will be the next day..then the morning of my next day delivery they told me ,there will be no delivery.and if I do get the delivery to throw it out . I could get sick if I eat it...bc it thawed out...the email stated a full refund on my credit card...I better get the refund or i'll be making some phone calls.......

UcDVjCFTkV1NVrCuYi1DvQ.text: Garbage.  Why would I order this when I could walk to the local grocery store and buy the same product from the frozen food section?!?  Quality is horrible, smells like poop, I should be refunded

-UysCGgLICnLiZAY1dT6oQ.text: I wish I would have tried Freshly earlier! I am a first time mom of a 6 month old little boy. I returned back to work full time about a month ago and Freshly has been a life saver!  I don't have the energy to cook at all. When I first started back to work I would just stop and get fast food or something quick like junky snacks to keep me going throughout the day but that was not helping get the baby weight off!! Now I can just pop one of these into the microwave and I am good to go.They're packaged nicely and are easy to take to work for lunch too.  I have only tried the entrees and not the breakfast but so far I've really liked the majority of what I've tried. The steak peppercorn is my favorite.  Some of the meals are higher in fat but it's not excessive and if you track correctly you can lose weight with these. I've had at least 1 meal a day and while using myfitnesspal I've been within my calorie/fat/sodium/protein goals A lot of the meals are lower in sugar and are gluten free too.   Overall, the meals I've had feel hearty and healthy and I am very happy! I am now doing 12 meals a week for $108/week or $9/meal. For what you get I think it's great, especially being in the bay area. I can't go out and get a meal like this for that price. The only reason for 4 stars is because the plastic film on the tray is hard to peel off and I think there could be some more food options to choose from each week.

E-sMxIOp48wRwijsZ0n_Cg.text: I work and commute to/from the city and by the time I get off the subway the last thing I want to do is go to the supermarket and figure out what to make for dinner for me & my husband.  I've tried the popular meal subscription kits but they would take too long to prepare and expensive especially since the meals were hit or miss.   When I saw Freshly on Instagram I decided to give it a try.  I have to say I am pleasantly surprised at the quality and taste considering it is cooked in the microwave.  The chicken dishes come out tender and delicious not rubbery as one might imagine.  It just takes 3 minutes and dinner is done plus it's made with clean and natural ingredients.   I use their app to mange my account and it's really user friendly. Freshly makes my life easier and I'm so thankful for that!

FAjjYOxkqRqrWDhZvU768Q.text: Really wanted the food to be at least be somewhat good, but unfortunately, it is not. I've had airplane food that tasted better. Most of the meals are a watery mess and WAY under seasoned. So disappointed. If these are chef prepared meals, I have an igloo in the Sahara to sell you. I'm giving it 2 stars for convenience and on-time delivery. If the review was just based on the food, it would be 1 star.

4i2PogEA_ZtKsUcQE9rk_Q.text: Do not order from this company. I ordered my food and when I went to check where it was it was sent to the wrong place. Customer service said there was nothing they could do besides give me a refund and no food. That was the first and last order I will ever make at this company. If you actually want food, don't order it from here. They can't even handle shipping it to the right place. Subscription cancelled.

Cddr5FD9B6NMwjBQfefIBA.text: Update: After a rough first week, the service has been reliable since, and I am satisfied.  I do give credit to the Freshly customer service (Megan) who contacted me after my initial review and made the situation right.  Since then, my meals have been delivered on time, and I have enjoyed most of the meals (especially the chicken ones).  I've even lost weight at the same time, which wasn't my intention, but will take it.  Will continue using.

6RBgDp_NnHHAzFXi-XxWZQ.text: The food is better quality than frozen dinners, and my first two deliveries arrived on time. I was pretty pleased with it, so I increased my subscription level. Unfortunately I'd come to rely on it too quickly, because the day the third order was supposed to arrive, I received notification that it was canceled. They automatically refunded my money and provided a $30 discount, but since they didn't offer to ship a replacement sooner to cover at least part of the week, I've canceled. Now I have to make other plans. Not that this all happened after I had already received a shipment confirmation notification. Clearly it was an automated mass email with no basis in fact. I get the feeling this is a fly by the seat of the pants operation. If you sign up, be aware that you might not get your order.

zJQlq_CQ7djs-EmleJ-OfA.text: I was looking for portion controlled meals with healthier options that were conveniently delivered to me and I didn't have to spend time cooking. My husband works nights most days of the week and I don't feel like cooking for one and since these are microwavable he can take them to work for himself also. Everything I tried tasted OK, but that's it just OK. I've enjoyed store bought frozen meals just as much if not better, although I do admit that Freshly's quality of food overall is better in comparison. I wasn't very impressed with the selection and expected to have different options available to me every week or at least every other week, but it's a lot of the same thing. I tried it for a month since I was able to use a discount for the first 4 weeks, but after the 5th week I cancelled. For the price it just really wasn't worth it. I've switched to getting prepared meals at my local grocery store that I enjoy better and for a fraction of the cost. I never had issues with deliveries, everything came as expected each week and was what I ordered. One thing that always kind of bothered me was that they seemed to really advertise about being 'earth friendly' and that you can recycle most of the packaging, but it's kind of pain. You have to thaw the freezer inserts and then cut them open to discard what's inside and then just the plastic itself was recyclable; same with the foam packaging, you have to cut it open and discard what's inside and then just recycle the plastic covering and then of course the box is recyclable. I'll admit by the 3rd delivery I was just throwing away everything inside and just recycling the box. Overall, I'd say if you truly hate to cook or just don't have the time and don't mind spending the money, this may be the food service for you.

qXPfaY1dttP88_o_28OAvw.text: Look at all the wonderful reviews! So we decided to try it. We put in for a Sunday delivery. We waited all day long for their product to be delivered. They were using some service called lift serve. We called Freshly after hours and were told it wasnt going to be delivered. However their delivery service assured us it was . It never came. We stayed home a whole day for nothing. Its now Monday and I don't see any reason to believe its coming today, either.  It might be wonderful food, but its useless if you don't actually get it! Ohh my imagination runs wild at how scrumptious it must have been. The mail carrier must have gorged themselves! My girlfriend is one of those that lets things go. I'm not, I believe people should see REAL REVIEWS, and not just the ones from owners and employees of a business. You know whose never failed to deliver my meals when I order them? Any of the 5000 resteraints I've at. Good or bad, at least I ACTUALLY GOT THE FOOD! And when it was bad, a simple word with the manager usually fixed thibgs instead of blaming it on the shlub who delivered it.

hNoPNQL0rVC53jbjDQUJZA.text: I've been ordering Freshly for over a year and some of the meals are hit or miss, but it's rare they are bad. The portions are pretty decent and consistent. I'm a busy person and work out daily, so it's important to me to eat clean and just know what i'm eating so i'm not thinking about it. Freshly is totally reliable. My delivery was late once and they refunded me, but other than at, my meals are always cold and packaged well... just wish all the packaging wasn't so wasteful.  Every meal does seem fresh though and clean ingredients.. I don't eat junk food, so Freshly hits the mark. I don't recommend their breakfast. The omelets are small and don't hold up well in the fridge and i just don't like the flavor and ingredients of them. They should had a side to the breakfasts to make it feel comparable to the dinners.  The food isn't over salty or seasoned, so I add salt to mine and usually steamed kale to make it feel a bit bigger. The chicken is sometimes really lean and sometimes very fatty... it used to always be great, but not sure if they changed their meat vendor. The gluten free pastas are the best and the pork quality is top notch.  I wish they'd stop discontinuing my favorite stuff like the Spagehtti Squash Meatballs.  Also they have promos for $39 all the time, so they should just make your meals $39 and no promos. I cancel my subscription all the time until i get a new promo because $39 is the price point for me.  I really like Freshly, you won't be disappointed!

DAr-5jvZ5R1FHO_boVXVKA.text: I don't understand the people giving 1 star reviews. Lol.  Where does it say you HAVE to consume the food in 3 days? I get my delivery on Mondays and I have until Friday/Saturday to finish my 6th meal. Each meal has a "use by" date and I haven't seen one that suggests 3 days - it's usually 5 (maybe they're getting their shipments late).   I've had 12 different meals so far and they have been surprisingly good, although some are better than others. Pretty fortunate I haven't had any stomach issues, but I also make sure there isn't anything I'm allergic to in my orders. I've also had my share of Hungry-Man's and Lean Cuisines and Freshly is a definitely better than that for those people comparing it to TV dinners (it doesn't even come frozen, so how is it a TV dinner).

m_5vvqiz9RNAoBq7Xlb8CA.text: I wanted to try Freshly because of the convenience. I get blue apron every other month but you still have to prep and cook. I wanted this to work since I don't always have time. The meals are not good. They are tasteless and underwhelming. The rice is always undercooked, the potatoes way oversalted and the broccoli and spaghetti squash had a weird dayglo green color. The only positive I can see is the the proteins are always tender borderline weirdly soft. I had a trial subscription but I am going to cancel. I am still struggling to eat the meals I have. There isn't much variety either.

sYG9YEPY_G30JAWngwKIBw.text: The deliveries have been fine.  No issues there. However the meals are very small portions and are very bland. You can't taste any salt, spices or any taste. They are lacking that extra touch of seasoning which would make them special. The pasta meals are ok if you add your own spices but the portions are tiny. The chicken is always very tender but tasteless. I liked the macaroni and cheese once I added salt. The chicken that came with it was so bland I couldn't eat it. I will stick to meal prepping and cooking my own fresh food from scratch. If you need easy microwave meals then get some frozen meals at the grocery store like Stouffer's. At least those have flavor and are much cheaper. My recommendations are to create meals with spices and flavor and have larger portions.

gXaauLWVMD04qkvLkcJcog.text: Food was pretty good but they sucker you.  I originally had one week worth of meals coming and skipped my next week.  I received my meals and for whatever reason it undid my skip. So now I get to have the exact same meals for two weeks in a row.  The customer service rep couldn't care less.  I wouldn't be as mad if they at least changed the meals up, but I got the same ones and they didn't even try to help remedy the situation.  In no way was I looking for a hand out, but I wanted them to do something. I don't know, the food is pretty good, low calorie stuff. But apparently you have to log in right after delivery in order to not receive the next auto order

_j2ewk0aHdvbqFHZziGoxQ.text: I really wanted to like Freshly for a number of reason but my primary reason for trying Freshly was for my 88yr old mother whom we have been trying to get out of the kitchen due to safety risks.  I thought if I could find her quality, nutritious prepared dishes she can just warm-up, she could spend more time playing Bingo rather than banging pots-n-pans together to put a meal together.   My mother is 88 and eats fairly healthy and has no health issues or diet restrictions at all so after doing my research on these Prepared meal providers, I settled for Freshly because they were one of the few if not only that offer already prepared dishes unlike some of them that send you all the ingredients and you put it together, that would defeat the purpose of what my intentions were.   Freshly delivered on everything they offer and we never had any problem with their service, food quality or anything.  This is week 4 that we have had deliveries of meals under the 6 meals a week subscription which I have been ordering her 2 breakfast and 4 dinner meals.  When the meals arrive, I go over and unpack them for her because the deliver box is too heavy for her to lift. I turn each one over and arrange them by the "Best when used by date" with the most recent on top and the older ones at the bottom.   The trend that I have noticed has been that 4 out of the 6 meals have a best when used by date on the same day and the other 2 soon after or before.  This is an issue because my 88yr old mother doesn't eat that much and has been eating half at lunch and half at dinner because she cannot consume the entire portion in one sitting.   All-in-all, I don't recommend this service for seniors because of 2 reasons.  The best before dates are too close together (4 on the same day is a lot) and the portions are too big for most seniors her age.  Outside of what my personal experience has been, Freshly does a great job, they just don't work for my situation so I am going to cancel my subscription and look for something more local who can better meet our needs.

V839CVh0s79PHfzmNvKsqg.text: We decided to try Freshly after testing Blue Apron. It's turns out that we're too lazy and/or busy to actually cook our food. So I was hoping that fully cooked delivery meals would save us both time and money.  Freshly is super convenient. The food shows up once a week. It's packed in a really nice, insulated box with recyclable insulation that can survive a couple hours on the porch in Phoenix heat. The price per meal is super affordable. Cool beans.  BUT the food just doesn't taste that good  The meals are loaded with sodium, and, somehow, they still taste like nothing. Certain dishes are better than others (we found that the chicken dishes were the best meat dishes; all of the steak meals came out like rubber), but overall I just can't live my life eating this stuff. It's not the time-saving solution I was hoping for.

RZgy96twEFew1zGDlHX2_g.text: I did Freshly last year as a healthy alternative. I am starting WW after the new year and I believe that this will be a Godsend for teacher lunch meals. Most of the meals I tried, I loved!  The only ones I didn't care for were the ones with sausage. The texture seemed super fake and too crunchy (maybe remove the skins?). I loved the Steak Peppercorn the most (just try not to get a whole peppercorn in a bite because you will be overwhelmed with taste. I love spices and it had a lot of flavor. I also likes the chicken dishes and pasta (without sausage). I am a picky eater which makes things more complicated. I was able to find meals I liked!  I received 8 weeks off Freshly for Christmas so I am pumped to see what they have now and hope they come out with new things more often!

QO08xky384kI0j7uakdrRw.text: Meals never arrived today as they were supposed to.  I chatted with the company and they were entirely unsympathetic and refused to give a full refund.  They state the package will arrive tomorrow and despite me saying I will be gone for two days and not able to put the package into a fridge, they don't care.  I have reported them for fraud to my credit card company and have put a sign on my porch refusing delivery.  This company is AWFUL!  Avoid at all costs!!!!  EDIT: Benito from Freshly reached out to me.  He was the THIRD employee I had talked to.  He finally made it right and issued a full refund, so I have revised my review from one to two stars.  It never should have come to this but hey I'm glad they at least have Benito who seems to care about the company's reputation.

-jBGZCpLQEi0onyOkyAdKA.text: BEWARE!!!! DO NOT subscribe to this food delivery service.  The quality is terrible and the meals are not appetizing at all.  The customer service is the worst I have ever seen. They will not and would not do anything to accomodate you if you need to change anything.   If you need pre-made food go to your local provider for these services.  Buy local and organic! This company is the worst.  Don't waste your time and money. You will be dissapointed!!

m7dpyUC9G4RrL5PrH4YPJg.text: This is a subscription service. That charges you well before anything is made or shipped. I did not like this at all. (the forced subscription) I have canceled and will not return. Its ok food, barley above a frozen dinner at walmart. And its 4x the price. If they let you order when you like, and not force you into a subscription it might be ok and I would consider continuing. But, as it stands. I am done with this service, I rather cook and use one of the other ones that send you fresh ingredients instead of something that was cooked no sooner than 2 days before you receive it...... Nothing fresh about that whatsoever......

VQN8mHw_z4qv9w6xp6EVyg.text: Just got my order that was half priced, $30 for 6 meals. I think that is high enough and would never pay $10 per meal. Especially after tasting them. Tried the pork sausage with pasta and peppers. It looked impressive but was very bland and the sausage dry. Like I've never had such a dry sausage.  The pasta was gluten free, all the meals are, and these were made of red lentils I believe. Tasted like mush, didn't eat more than a couple. Red, green and yellow bell peppers were the best part. Had sun dried tomatoes and I didn't know that until I ate some. Don't like sun dried tomatoes at all, disappointed I didn't know they were in there. Clearly on the inredient list but I missed it.  Tuscan chicken soup was hearty, bland and bland. Not sure why there was no flavor but I was disappointed. Plus there are over 700 calories so this was a downer. Still have 4 more meals to try, not hopeful about the taste.  Forgot to take pictures of the soup. Whoops. Food arrived as expected with a tracking number. Dry ice and a few ice packs made the food pretty frozen. Not just a light frost but solidish. At least it wasn't spoiled but the website says it's not made to be frozen.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looked promising
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Front of package with ingredients but no calories or other nutrition info.

HvBCcw_PhLGZw2jRNKVhRQ.text: Started out with the Flex 6 and recently upgraded to Flex 9 because the food portions are just right. Seriously, the hardest part about eating healthy is not really the cost, it's getting the portion size just right and I have to say that after eating a Freshly meal, I'm never hungry. I love the different choices of healthy carbs, and the food doesn't taste too salty or spicy, but just right. I really like the steak with green beans, and am starting to experiment with different things I wish they would add an easy option to upgrade; as it stands, I had to cancel my Flex 6 and the add the Flex 9, but there should be something to click on when you want to upgrade to make it easy.

3gl9X-N4O2UQDnyf1DNntQ.text: I must say first of all I really want to like this company. They have the right idea! It just totally misses the mark.  I have tried the turkey Shepard's pie, and the turkey dinner with Brussels sprouts, and the chicken parmigiana. The three meals did one good thing for me by taking me back to my childhood when I was forced to eat this kind of food in my school's cafeteria. Everyday!!!  BTW I want to taste the flavors of the food instead of sodium. The strangest part is that the name of your company "Freshly" is s contradiction to what I feel we are getting. I do believe that the food is fresh, but how in the world did you make it so taste like a frozen TV dinner without ever freezing it is really disturbing to me!!  Honestly, I have had better meals on an airplane.  Come on Freshly, you can do this!! Stop being a Keurig and start being a Nespresso!!

gcWiVWZisTUzd-VfSDoh7Q.text: Very disappointed. My meals were apparently tnrown on the porch sideways and ruined. Sent email complaint and awaiting response. The food I received looked disgusting due to their carelessnessnesd. Never again.

2cQDi99jyBrshldjKdKNLA.text: This is a second rating.  After earing most of the meals delivered, I must change my rating.  This food is nothing but glorified frozen  (not frozen) dinners.  Don't waste your money, unless you like very substandard food.

40avt7S9VmEuAIPLyXqlRw.text: They just lowered prices to $8.99/meal!  I'm on my 7th week with Freshly and love it so much that I increased to 12 meals a week and eat it 2 times day on average.   Taste amazing, surprisingly filling  I'm not interested in cooking so it actually saves me money and time not going going out to eat or ordering delivery.  No cooking, dishes or messes to clean up.  They have great meal options for those counting calories and macros and it's all made with good fresh ingredients.  Their variety is excellent and I'm yet to eat one of their meals that I disliked.

03enTfuBsmEr2U-iiaczGA.text: Horrible customer service and they suck you into a subscription for simply wanting to try their product.  Meals aren't that tasty only positive is the convenience.

8UUNtLQQhbPEIgcOCnW19A.text: I have ordered Freshly for about 3 weeks now and I have to say that I am extremely satisfied. In the past I have tried both Nutrisystem and BistroMD and they aren't nearly as good as Freshly in terms of the quality of food. I purchase the 12 meal delivery for all of my lunches and dinners so I can't give you any input on the breakfast meals but I can say that all of the lunches and dinners are pretty darn good. I figure there is no point to buying breakfasts because they are just too easy to prepare on my own.  I have seen some reviewers talk about how they had some pieces of fat in their meat and I have experienced that as well, but it isn't the case will all of the meat dishes all of the time. This sort of thing is bound to happen but there is still plenty of food to eat. Also I saw some mention of the meals having too much pepper. There is a dish of Pepper steak where they use whole peppers in the sauce which I happen to really like.  The greatest part of Freshly (at least for me) is that I don't have to cook, or shop for food and clean up the kitchen, and deal with tupperware containers. When I am sitting down eating a Freshly meal I think to myself how much time and effort it would take me to make a similar meal and it's so worth it! It's worth it to spend approx 10 dollars a meal and have more time to live my life.  Tip: If your ordering the 12 meal program (6 days lunch/Dinner) and you want to make your meals last 7 days a week. Skip one day (make it a cheat day) and every time your order comes in you will have an extra day.  I highly recommend Freshly!

ltRQKm2DjgEthjmDfb26Vw.text: I have been a prepared foodie for several food companies.  I like healthy, no GMO's, additives, etc and Freshly has met all the criteria plus they are priced exceptionally well.  The food is VERY tasty; even the salmon.  Having lived in the Pacific Northwest, I am very picky about my salmon; most tastes fishy.  Only very fresh salmon does not.  Theirs exceeded my expectations!!  Recommend highly!!

5GEL_xN_i2UIf1xhe8htsQ.text: The packaging was well done. The dry ice froze some of the food. Other meal service companies that provide a better product. The  zucchini pasta was good. Turkey meatballs were salty. Hoping they step up the food quality. All and all below average.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is exactly how the food looked when I opened the package.

fgs-jD2B5XKk-OkwA25T9Q.text: Stay away if you are accustomed to eating healthy!   I weight lift 4 times a week and was hoping Freshly could provide clean post-workout meals to make sure I meet my protein and calorie needs. I was disappointed.  Freshly covers their meat and vegetables in extremely thick sauces and marinades. Everything tastes "heavy" and thick. Which is sad because the chicken is of high quality and would be great without the sauce. I actually rinsed it in the sink and ate it plain :/ As someone who generally only eats fresh store-bought produce/meats with minimal sauces and ingredients, almost all of the Freshly meals tasted unhealthy.   It reminds me of Fresh and Easy.... which I used to love but after eating extremely clean for the last 2 years, now tastes like nothing but sodium and sugar to me. In all honesty, Freshly meals would probably taste "healthy" to most modern Americans  The steak had potential but had an unacceptable amount of fat for over a $10 a meal. Ended up giving 1/3 of it to my dog.

8CHyIQyevBlUTPj_E8740w.text: Freshly meals are meant for the microwave.  So they are microwave dinners you are ordering.  It does seem the ingredients are all for the most part paleo accepted so thats a great thing.  Didn't realize it was a subscription service and they charged my card without warning for the next meals of shipments.  When I asked to cancel the meals and receive a refund, they refused.  Not cool.

56pVFd697hanQflR-f2q5A.text: Used the Facebook discount for $49.00  Food was to be delivered July 29th.  It is now August 1st, and it has not been received.  if this was candy, shoes, or even a book, I would not be worried.  But it is perishable food.  YUK!  No ice packs are going to keep this cold for that long.   Also, when I go in and look at my order, there are several items that were changed.  I did not order salmon.  I cannot eat salmon.  Again, I did not order Salmon.  There is a salmon dish on my order.   Called CS and was told that someone had changed my subscription to a "free" 1 weeks delivery, so yay for me.  Well, my card was charged, so there was nothing free about it.   Was also told that it was the delivery people's problem that it was late.  May be, but I never even received an email from Freshly saying that it had shipped, and providing me with a tracking number.   Only offer was to change the date to 2 weeks from now (this was food we were going to use on our vacation) or to refund my money.  I asked for a refund.  I will let y'all know if I receive it.   I am afraid now I am going to get home from vacation with a box of spoiled food on my front porch that has been opened and enjoyed by raccoons.   There is also no way to cancel your subscription once they have you.  You can only pause it, or skip weeks.  I would really like to cancel and have proof that they no longer have my credit card number.

M3rWhRjLpI6o6LSi5efXuQ.text: The food is ok & I for the most enjoy the meals, but the customer service leaves much to be desired and most recently, completely awful! - my account was charged 3 times because it said it was declined but my bank saw three times that it was approved and therefore money wasn't available to pay a bill that was due to another vendor because freshly took money that wasn't theirs and held it and never contacted me about it. I've been a long time customer I am completely livid about this whole situation the way that it was handled, the way that it was unprofessionally managed, the way that I wouldn't be reimbursed, and I am no more going to be a customer of theirs nor am I ever going to refer anybody to them ever again because of how I was treated. This is unacceptable customer service!! I am completely done with freshly and I hate the fact of how I've been treated!! Anybody want to contact me to discuss this further feel free to do so but until then, these guys have a lot to learn about customer service and how to treat others. I have nothing more to say.

497pF-Rwn0UqlxGGPZVBxw.text: Do NOT order from Freshly - the food never arrives.  The customer service is awful as well.  Worst experience.

TL0Flq1qu-CfeyugBurO2w.text: Disgusting.   Not only the food, but also the atrocious amount of waste.    I weighed the packaging after I removed my meals from the box.  18 POUNDS OF WASTE.
