About 2 pounds of food. It is the most ridiculous thing to see. This HUGE box holding cardboard and insulation and enormous ice packs ... And then, these little packages of food (in plastics trays with a cardboard cover wrapped around it to make sure they are being as environmentally repugnant as possible)  The food is quite awful.  But, hey, it could be a great weight loss method. Buy food that you will only eat a few bites of, and do overhead presses and squats with the 20 pound box of garbage.    Totally makes sense.

nRueQ1gxZG5Cl-Ktbq3U1w.text: Freshly is amazing. Great price, value, delicious food and choices!!!! Super easy and for me that and great taste is what I am looking for!

so6YZ2g6BWoYcoFJpy4xHw.text: TERRIBLE FOOD and HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE... Unethical company.. I ordered 6 items on a trial subscription. They got the order wrong and 3 of the 6 fish dishes were inedible. Fish smelled so bad we ended up throwing them away. The other 3 were bland and like any frozen food you can get at a supermarket, at 4x the cost.  Within 24 hours of receiving the first shipment, before I even had a chance to taste the food, I was charged $62 for the second shipment. They were also supposed to send an email notifying me of upcoming charges but I never received it. Immediately went online to cancel my subscription and contacted the company.   Told the rep how bad the food was, not receiving an email notification of the charge, and that I do not want to continue the service. The rep rudely said "you do realize we are a subscription based company" and that they will not refund the 2nd shipment because I 'should've' received an email. I asked to speak to a manager to which she said "fine, but the manager is not going to refund your money either." After a 10 minute hold for the manager, she came back and said they're having internet problems so she is not able to transfer the call. Could this be why I never received the email from them??? If the manager ever calls back and doesn't correct the situation, I will be disputing the charge with my cc company.   ======== Update:  1 1/2 day later - received a call from a supervisor. She actually stated that she also did not receive email notification of charges from the company when she first signed up for subscription... but that the problem had been resolved... obviously not. Bottom line, she refused any refund. Spoke to Toby, cust svc manager who was rude and arrogant. He also said he is not going to do anything about the problem... he's not going to issue a refund and that's that.... and that there's no one above him that I would be able to speak to. Let's see how long this company stays in business.   Will be contacting the state consumer protection and BBB. May contact the health department because obviously they're not handling fish properly.

2TjVfUTr2QlgRChwMyLt2A.text: Friends don't let Friends Freshly  We wanted to enjoy Freshly based on its description of the service. We were doing the Home Chef, and this sounded like Home Chef already made.  We attempted 5 separate dinners  Skirt steak- Had zero seasoning of any salt or pepper and tougher than a shoe. Who microwaves a piece of Steak normally, why put that in one of the meals?  Chicken parm- Not bad but, not great same as stouffers TV dinner  Slow pulled pork- I never got to try, my girlfriend tried and wouldn't offer it to the dog. #dumpsterfood  Farmhouse chicken- once you microwave a breaded food, there is no crispy, why bread it? Tried to crisp it in the oven resulted in #dumpsterfood  Chicken teriyaki....or teri-yucky.... I gagged and my girlfriend laughed because she already tasted it while I spat it on the plate.  I'm sorry Freshly, you are trying, everyone may want to try it once as I'm not a food snob but I wish you luck, it may be for you, but not for us.   We are going back to the give me the ingredients and I'll take the 20-40 minutes to make vs the 20-40 minutes in the restroom after eating.

15dViQ-1K-324ewsJtXWHQ.text: So last week my Freshly went to a Tucson zip code (I live in Scottsdale). I guess my auto fill in Google must have filled in with my old Tucson zip even though it pulled my Scottsdale street address/City. I went in and updated my zip code and double checked it was good before delivery.  When I saw my delivery was again sent to Tucson this week, I sent them a chat. Apparently, there are two different places to change your address on the website. That seems like a pretty poor user experience. How would I know I need to change it in two different places?  This experience has kind of soured me on Freshly for now. The whole point of it for me is to save time. The last two weeks it's been more of a headache than a time saver.

lmDbQY8Dmin7VX933iBhiw.text: We have tried pretty much every meal delivery service on the market and this is by far the worst one.  The concept is nice with the meals all being prepared ahead of time and you just heat them up, but the execution doesn't work.  The meals taste horrible and I am not a picky eater.   I threw away 2 out of the 3 meals I tried after just one bite.  Healthy Choice meals taste better and are 1/3 of the cost.

7SxL4bWvpx_nH6fSmwU2RA.text: Love freshly. Delivers (literally) what it promises... Fresh delicious meals in a ny minute for busy people.  I heat up for a fancy lunch or freeze and heat up for 30 minutes in the oven for dinner.

ekzRhaQ-JPwG0WFGnZnqyA.text: This was the first time I've ever tried out a meal delivery service and Freshly managed to make this first experience a disappointing one. Just as another reviewer described, one of my orders was also delivered late and I received an email not to eat it and to discard the meals. I do understand that things like that can happen and didn't make a big deal out of it at all.  However, the main beef I have with them is that out of four orders, two were incorrect and were missing some meals but contained others twice instead. I double-checked my orders placed on my account to make sure it wasn't my own mistake, but what I ordered definitely did not match what I received. While speaking to their customer service, the issue was basically ignored and I was advised they won't do anything 7 days after the order. So apparently if you don't call and complain right away, you're SOL and they won't stand behind their products. This service seemed like a convenient idea at first but with these types of disappointments after just a few orders and at over $10 a meal, it's really not worth it. There are too many other meal service options out there to put up with this kind of BS. Cheers to a customer lost and this well-deserved word of mouth "advertising," Freshly.

K4YIMfjY9KK2qWOEE5PqWw.text: While the dishes I've had so far have been delicious and the boxes arrived on time, the con for me outweighs the pros. I thought this was a healthy meal service but most meals are between 450-600 calories and so high in sodium and cholesterol it's crazy. The photo I attached was for grilled buffalo chicken and a side of loaded cauliflower. The cholesterol, sodium, and saturated fat is absurd! I'll have to cancel and look for something that's a bit more easy on the weight and heart.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Label for buffalo chicken

kmeZ0UZSrsmQcD3VDtP2WQ.text: I *LOVE* Freshly!    I am married to a celiac who reacts to even the slightest gluten cross contamination... and cooking is NOT my forte! Freshly has been like a godsend to my family! Not only is my husband able to eat delicious healthy meals again, but he also hasn't been sick once since starting our Freshly deliveries.  It's also a nice perk just having a meal ready in a few minutes and not having to grocery shop as often.  Pros - The meals are seriously delicious - The cost is reasonable $8-10/dish - They really ARE gluten free! - The convenience of having dinner figured out each week is unbeatable  Cons: - Slightly smaller than I would like portion wise  We've been having these delivered for three months now and I still can't wait for my next delivery!

KWPJAJPE39jkQBiJCTOXxQ.text: I have seen many meal thing offers and used a few. After a good promotion 6 meals for $39 Delivered We decided to try Freshly.  It took a little over 2 weeks to get our first order.  Once you sign up they schedule you for a weekly delivery with options to skip the week or change your meals easily.  The food itself was well beyond my expectations both in serving size and taste.  Really great flavors and quality ingredients.  Outside of the promotion my price for 6 meals is $59.  This is about average and I feel that Freshly gives you a bit more and is better on the taste.   The packaging is great and all recyclable.    I would recommend to sure try this meal service.  Really great!

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and Rice Pilaf
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Livorno
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l47HTMWdnWWk3ecEBR80pQ.text: Used Freshly for a couple months It's fine... really - it's ok. It might even be good - except for the price.   The meals arrived on time and because the meal is self contained there's no missed or damaged ingredient like you regularly get with meal kits (tried them all and they all have this problem to varying degrees). Obviously the prep is just wonderful - a few minutes in the microwave and you're ready to go. The food, for the most part, has been delicious. One meal that was almost inedible but otherwise everyone in the house has enjoyed them.  Downside 1: $10+ per "meal". Often these meals are under 500 calories, so as far as dinner is concerned, this is almost half a meal. I suppose they're fine for a light lunch, but you could have spent that $10 at Panera Bread for something heartier and much more fresh - or heck, prepared/frozen food from Trader Joe's or even Whole Foods will be cheaper and more substantive. For $30 for 3 people I can just order delivery if I'm too pressed to cook.   Downside 2: Limited menu rotation; especially for specific diets. Over the course of 6 weeks I saw NO changes to the vegetarian options. Basically the same 3 dishes every single week, week after week after week. Gobble, Home Chef, and others ensure 3+ new vegetarian options every week (sometimes 4 or 5 new options in a week).   Hopefully someday they'll switch from the wasteful plastic trays to cheaper, more efficient vacuum sealing. They could fit 3x more food in each package and make the meal cost more reasonable.

6NnADuUwrfNPUpnanao8EA.text: So I'm 23, single, and hate to cook. I'm a busy guy and usually am worn out by the time I get home from work and the gym. When I ordered Freshly I was worried I was paying for overpriced Hungry Man frozen dinners. I was wrong. The food not only looks good and is packaged well, but it tastes great and is actually nutritious. My package arrived right on time and I could tell as soon as I opened the package I had a quality product. My food was wrapped tightly in recyclable cold packs and cushion. Each meal has a detailed nutrition lable and ingredients list. With the first bite I was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was. You can tell it's made by hand and isn't the frozen garbage I was expecting. At about $10 a meal, I can honestly say I believe it to be worth it, and I will definitely extend my subscription.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QB7HiMGfQqe6yA4iqsGweQ.text: What's the point of ordering food to be delivered when delivery is not reliable and you aren't even alerted?  Super busy and wanted to find healthy pre made meals that had no prep. Ordered in December for meals to start being delivered in January. On the day I was expecting my delivery, I noticed that on my online account, it said no delivery was scheduled but I got no email in advance. Me: Huh? Spoke to someone via live chat and they said that due to high demand, they couldn't keep up and they had to cancel my order and would refund me. Immediately asked them to cancel my subscription because I'm not only paying for food, but also dependability and if you can't promise that when someone orders well in advance, what's the point of your business?

ilGInNmwiJ-Vtcx_w0jGmw.text: At first freshly was five star.  Then, with very little variety everything started to feel like prison food.  I figured I would wait until the kinks were worked out to come back.  Until then, this is only good for a limited time because there are very little options.  And you get tired of every option.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

l68_S_qvUjyAeYuWllpkUA.text: How disappointing. We saw an opportunity to have our busy lives supplemented through the simplicity of freshly cooked meals at the convenience of it waiting on your porch after a long day at work, only to have those plans dashed by an email stating "we experienced an unexpected cooking delay"  Not a good first impression, considering we ordered this weeks ago and seeing that I am not the only one going hungry tonight by other disgruntled customers, previous customers.   I am with many of the others, won't be keeping my account, which is too bad due to the convenance this had promised.

7PVBMo6tpScm2y5b44sFEQ.text: Our first delivery was a bit disappointing.  Having planned to use Freshly for the week, the order did not arrive until near 10PM.    I'm hoping for a better experience if we use them again.  Just plan accordingly that the Monday meal may not arrive in time for dinner.   After the first customer service rep seemed a little indifferent, the company actually reached out and made things right.    Looking forward to trying what is left for the week.

01oQtYq_2Y-MhNzyz_XQKA.text: While I will say that customer service is great, this service overall is not worth it. After not receiving my meals the first time, I ordered again giving the company the benefit of the doubt. Again, the same thing happened. I received an e-mail that the delivery had a "shipping label created via FedEx." However, there was never any activity beyond that. The next e-mail I received was that there was a delay and that my delivery would be refunded. They do offer a discount every time that they miss meals, but again, not worth it since you never actually receive the meals. I spoke with a customer service representative to ensure that I was getting refunded and to cancel my subscription. I asked the status of the order and she stated, "The package is out for delivery for the time frame of 8am-9pm but that time frame cannot be determined due to the driver's route etc." I had to let her know (since clearly this was not the case) that there was no shipping activity what-so-ever. She stated that perhaps the driver hasn't had a chance to scan it in yet. Considering the delivery would be coming from Ohio to Minnesota and it's FED-EX, there is always shipping activity if it's actually en route.  I've never experienced errors like this with Fed-Ex, ever. Like other reviews, the blame completely went on Fed-Ex which I don't think is the case. The idea of the service is great if the company could actually correct it's errors and produce the product. Obviously from reviews, this is a major issue that needs to be fixed. It just seems like there's an over abundance of orders and under production because the company hasn't figured out yet how to handle a high volume of orders, etc.   I do not recommend this service which is sad because I was excited to give this a try and make it a weekly thing.

y1N4oJOjixL6tOGEzAgHYA.text: Count me as yet another customer who had her order canceled last minute with no explanation.  I placed my order on January 2 and the first delivery date available was January 30. Today, January 26, I received an email from Paypal informing me that my payment was refunded.  As I had not received an email from Freshly, I went on their site to see if I could suss out what had happened. All it said was 'order canceled'.   I went on Live Chat and was told sorry, we sold out for January 30th but my delivery for next week, February 6 would be coming.  Really annoyed and disappointed by this horrible customer service. And please, Megan M., don't bother replying. I won't be returning, and am hopeful that many prospective customers will read all the reviews on here about how your company totally flaked on us.

caq89RoQkHZsu8byFzUUEw.text: I was very skeptical at first of a meal delivery service where you microwave your meal and it's "fresh" but man I absolutely love their food! Sometimes the chicken is a little dry but nothing a little sauce can't fix and it's still good. Meals like the Teriyaki Salmon Cakes and the Low Country Boil have literally made me say out loud "wow this is really good". As someone who is trying to eat healthier and eat less fast food, I've found it hard to find healthy food that tastes good, but Freshly is healthy food that is prepared quick and tastes great, all at a pretty good price! A four hit combo that is hard to achieve.

AfUfPI2hVgTzHKz4yy9oVw.text: UPDATE: I'd like to thank Ms. Megan from Freshly by sorting out my awful start with the company. She was very helpful and got on my case right away.  Now on to the actual review: After a week of trying out the meals, I can actually say that I like all of them and I'll be continuing business with them. The meals comes in a prepacked box together with some gel used to keep it chilled. Every meal that I tried so far is great in taste. My friends had a blast in trying some of them out (not that I would willingly share it then now). The best thing is that it does satisfy my cravings. I don't feel that I'm hungry for more after I eat but I'm also trying to be conscious on what I eat. Nonetheless, the meals taste great, and it's low in calorie.   Like I said, I'll continue doing business with them.

xHnkyM4rSFEn9QdvU9RS8w.text: So I just signed up for my first delivery, but haven't received my package and can't comment on the quality.  However, I'm cancelling the service because of selection, delivery and customer service issues.    1.  When I signed up, I selected some meals just to see how the process worked.  However, once I completed the sign up, I wasn't permitted to change the meals and had to go through their customer service folks who did indeed help, but forcing me to do that was ridiculous.  Supposedly, that only happens on the first delivery setup, but it's just dumb that it happens at all.  2.  More importantly, as soon as I signed up and tried to set up future weeks, I saw a message saying that my next delivery can't be completed because it falls on a holiday (4th of July).  I contacted the company (twice, because they ignored my first email), assuming that there must be a way to work around the problem.  Nope.  Their excuse is that their office is closed on the 4th and 5th and delivery slots for the 3rd are already "full".  So basically, every time there's a holiday, there's a chance that you won't get any meals that week.  Terrible processes.  Terrible customer service.  ***  Received a follow up email from their customer service folks saying that because my delivery day is a Thursday and most holidays fall on Mondays, I shouldn't have a problem in the future.  Really?  So what if I had chosen Mondays as my delivery day?  And why didn't they offer an alternative delivery day for that week rather than telling me I'm just out of luck?  Freshly is not ready for prime time.  This is Customer Service 101-type stuff.  Think twice.

YgbfnWKpTUDlAFlJ3nCPmg.text: I realllly wanted to like Freshly, unlike most of the 1 star reviews, my order came on time, as expected except they ignored the note to not leave the package in the front room of my apartment complex as it's open to the public and boxes constantly get stolen.   I have only tried 2 of the meals: Chicken Teriyaki and Pulled Pork with Kale Salad and Carrots. The Chicken Teriyaki rice and veggies were bland (the chicken was OK). I needed to add soy sauce. The pulled pork was tastier but I noticed that both meals left a strange unpleasant aftertaste in my mouth that I just cannot get past. I needed to brush my teeth right away.   I have 4 meals remaining but really do not want to experience that aftertaste again so I'm thinking I'll just throw them out - which is hard for me to do because I hate being wasteful.   Again, I reallyyyy wanted to like the service because I thought the recipes were thoughtful and healthy :(.

zOBdx9npyck2QtdLzYpSHQ.text: They claim to be a meal delivery service but they don't actually deliver every week. More than half of the weeks, they just put "We can't deliver for this week." on the meal planning page on their website. It's literally pointless to subscribe to a meal delivery service if they only deliver intermittently.

62zMDA0Ln7BkzGC0fMX6oA.text: The variety is very limited and hasn't changed since I signed up.  I've contacted them twice only to be told that they will be adding new options but they never do.  Also, it would be nice to have more options under 400 calories.

6SwBrVnAj2c-qX0qeJgzkA.text: Really great service and excellent pricing. Would recommend to anyone who wants consistent, high protein meals. Menu could use more frequent changes and vegetarian options, but I was generally very pleased.

t8MRZYLQD_nI1wmm4kw5yA.text: The food is very good surprisingly- not a large enough portion for a man, but very fresh and tasty. Sadly just too expensive for my budget- customer service on line not very user friendly- tried to skip delivery till September 14, but company charged me anyway for next delivery for August 29 the day after I received first delivery! Don't really like subscription style ordering- wouldn't mind using them here and there when I'm too busy to cook. Bottom line, great meals just too pricey.

R56OD2ITJIVYhrfRDCe_PA.text: I first have to address some reviews I've read about the expiration dates on the meals: Freshly is constantly telling everyone you can FREEZE their meals and eat them beyond the expiration date...problem solved! Also, I keep hearing about portion sizes being too small...this is the portion size we should be eating, especially if you want to lose weight. I snack a lot less with these meals, and I am losing weight. The main thing I love about Freshly, is they are now a certified gluten free facility! This is so nice and convenient for those of us with Celiac disease! I can just grab their meals and go! People with gluten issues or Celiac can't just grab food without knowing what's in it. I feel special with Freshly because I don't think there are any other meal services that are certified gluten free. With the other companies, I would have to go through all their meals and figure out if they're safe for me to eat. Not with Freshly! Their meals are ALL gluten free and taste home-cooked in my opinion. If the food is too bland for you: add some spices! I am now ordering 12 meals a week for $8.99/meal. McDonald's meals are around the same price, if not more and they are not healthy at all. I can't go there anyway...just comparing the cost.  I am happy with Freshly, overall they are saving me time and money!

0VrTG1mNcXAOqaqukyXbjg.text: Just got my first Freshly order yesterday. I never intended on using the service consistently. Only during really busy times. However, most of the meals are bland. My shrimp was over cooked. And the sodium content is outrageous. I cancelled my subscription because I can't pay for a service that doesn't cook better than I do.

v58as75fyqk3KTw1LXtWOw.text: I have been ordering freshly for a few months. Meals usually had good portion servings, decent taste and reasonably priced. However, off late there were too many wrong orders been sent. The excuse always given was that they ran out of ingredients. This is when I placed my orders in time and a week in advance. There was no communication or emails in advance to let me know about it. I would only know about the wrong orders once I received my meals!  Sometimes, the wrong orders were refunded for but other times had to contact the suppport for refund. I cancelled my subscription for good when the wrong orders became frequent. I would rather have the right meals than get refunds.

SpFSqzjAUrOI-L8gg-8tvQ.text: Freshly food was so inedible not even my dog would eat it! My four meals arrived and the protein and sides are not kept separated so it gets all jumbled together in shipping and looks like upchuck when you open it. The food all had a weird tainted taste and something gave me diarrhea. Stay far, far away from Freshly.

mekN0h0USTPlI3kFQIDvQA.text: Guys, you get fresh food that is healthy and you don't have to prep, cook or clean. The online interface is easy to use on my phone, tablet, and computer. I have to add extra salt, pepper, hot sauce, and lemon but I understand they are making these meals with the idea that users who want more can always add more. It takes 15 seconds to season to my liking and doesn't really add any significant time or cost to my meal. Food arrives well packed and very cold.  My only gripe is that I wish they used coconut oil instead of canola. I think that would make it absolute perfection in my book, but if that's the worst thing I have to say, they are doing an excellent job.  I wish I found these sooner. I lost 5 pounds the first week without really trying. A+.

sAVcuJ66avKxaOPc8CQplw.text: I started getting meals on 1/16/19 and for the most part i liked very much all my choices so far except 2. I now bumped up to 9 meals per week as my daughter now is stealing a few to take back to college as college food isn't all the best. My only complaint would be the selection. You have enough choices for a new subscriber but now that I've been getting meals for past 4 weeks I need new choices. I don't mind repeats after 3-4 weeks but I read before starting subscription that you add meals weekly and that isn't the case. Including my next delivery coming on 2/18/19 you have only added 1 new meal since I started and that's over 6 weeks of delivery's. You finally have a 2nd new meal added for the last week of February so that will make it 2 new meals over 7 weeks of food. You need to step this up big time you you have any plan on keeping people more than a few weeks. I also see you dropped breakfast items which i'm bummed about and wish they could come back. Just would need something more than skimpy omelet for $10 though if you do. Hope to see more choices faster ( like 2 per week) so i can stay a happy full customer.

q3mYiIQDPxjnL_J8IxsEpQ.text: Can't comment on the quality of the food but can say their website needs work.  If you attach payment to PayPal you cannot change the form of payment through the Freshly subscription site.  I was told by customer service I must first cancel the subscription and sign up again using a DIFFERENT EMIAL.  Are you kidding me?  Come on Freshly; that's ridiculous.  I ended up going into my PayPal account and attaching a different card to the ongoing subscription...but still.

uYwGajcvvgmbWpZht88M3w.text: Ultra convenience and a diverse array of meals for those that want to give up cooking! Freshly has been a game changer for me - allowing me to eat a variety of different dishes in a quick and easy way. I usually dress up the meals with plating, side salads and additional spices but this is a breeze compared to the chopping, baking, frying and mashing needed with other meal kits.  This is a dream for busy singles that want a nice meal, certainly not home cooking, but a light year beyond TV dinners in freshness, taste and nutritional value.  Steak Peppercorn seems to be the most consistent winner but I also like the many chicken and meat-based pasta options. My only concern is that the shipping does have hiccups now and again but so far that has been rare and Freshly provided credits, which are appreciated.  The app is also well done and provides accurate tracking of the meals so I am able to collect them quickly and securely.  I also like how the app is quick, easy to navigate and it is easy to skip weeks or look ahead in time to plan meals.

B98k0iXA6mvvmk7Z6lIYJQ.text: I have to say I found the food disgusting. Could not finish a single meal that I tried, and the thought of taking another bite would make me shudder. I cancelled my membership, but that wasn't enough to express my displeasure. I'm very disappointed; was really hoping this service would work for me.

KmhnGFm22K_yaPKs8XjdNg.text: My coworker was raving about Freshly and sent me a promo code, so I decided to give it a try. For background, I have a hectic job, live within walking distance to way too many restaurants, and thus eat out a lot. So that's my best, realistic alternative to Freshly: eating at a restaurant.   If you compare Freshly to restaurant food, it's great--much less calorically dense, higher fiber, fewer suspect ingredients. You'll also be hard-pressed to beat $10/meal outside of fast food. So that's good.   However, if you compare Freshly to a homecooked meal... well, of course it's going to fall short. Nothing is as good as a steak right off the grill or perfectly al dente pasta coated in a luscious sauce and sprinkled with fresh herbs. You have to be realistic. Most meals have one really good part and one mediocre part (fantastic side but ho-hum main, or marvelous main and middling side).   So how do I rate Freshly overall? It's extremely convenient. It's healthier than eating out. I wish they had more low-carb options (because really, if you watch carbs, under 35 grams of carbs per meal isn't actually that low--it's actually... kind of high). I wish the portions were slightly smaller and that the ice packs weren't so wasteful (let the ice packs thaw and dump them in a fresh plastic trash bag so that I can recycle the original plastic bag? Really?) Overall, I'll probably keep ordering for the convenience factor, but I don't know that I'm an acolyte.

8vrtfucrTUUurlNyrJ7VhQ.text: I tried this service for the first time.  My order was not delivered on the day that was choosen. For that inconvenience, I was issued a credit on my next order. The food wasn't bad at all. There were one dish I will pass on next time, the meatloaf.  I just didn't care for it. I plan to use the service in the future.  It was one less meal a day that I didn't have to prep for.

d7yD_-8JerdoUAojgzy8yA.text: I never received my delivery from Freshly so I can't say if the food was good or not. They need to work on this. I give them an extra star because they had good customer service and refunded and cancelled my subscription immediately without hassle.

AQH1CK1rU06HwMbGy8fpTQ.text: I had been eyeballing Freshly for quite a while when I decided to show the service to my boyfriend. We looked it over together and we both decided to sign up and try it out. We figured worst case scenario is the food is hideous, cancel, and move on with life. BEST case scenario would be that we love it, and say goodbye to constantly trying to figure out what to do for dinner, shop, spend the $40 on ONE night's meal, cook, clean, etc.   Good news people, it was best case scenario. I got delivery scheduled for Friday and had it delivered to my work rather than let it sit outside my apartment. It came in about an 18 pound box, really nicely packaged and with ice packets in the box keeping everything cold.   I did not actually try one of my meals until Monday. I ordered (2) steak peppercorns (I love steak), chicken pilaf, beef chili, southwest chicken bowl, and the chicken pilaf. I have to say I was genuinely impressed with all the meals with exception of the chili. There wasn't really anything wrong with it, just wasn't my cup of tea. The other meals, however, were great! I was impressed with the quality of the proteins, sauces, and fresh sides. I would also like to comment on the portion sizes. I have not been able to finish one full meal, they completely fill me up!  I have to say I feel great about this decision. I no longer have to come up with dinner or lunch ideas, I am provided with healthy and very filling options, and it keeps me from eating a bunch of fast food options out of convenience needs.

kLRVNwfHqieS9hWFtvPHkw.text: I had to create a Yelp acct just so I could review this business.  I'm not sure what more anyone could want from a meal delivery service, honestly some people just like to complain.  I think most people don't review unless they are unhappy for whatever reason, so more need to get on board with supporting a business they love. Fantastic food and great customer service! We've had several dinners and not one complaint! I was actually amazed at the amount of flavors they have all had! I was hooked after the cod cakes, I couldn't believe how much flavor was packed into the entire dinner! My husband is a huge flavor guy and even he was shocked at the flavors in these meals! Love love love your company!!! I wish I could do a 10 star to help with the silly reviews from others.

aRCK8gj0_VkQ5_8m7UWE3g.text: I really wanted to like Freshly due to the convenience of having pre-cooked "healthy" food delivered at your doorstep, but the taste and value just isn't there. After a few times eating the same meals, you just get kind of tired of it and at over $10/meal, you just would rather go eat at a fast food joint. Here are the meals I tried and my scores:  Grilled Flat Iron Steak: 4- tender and juicy, steak is somewhat slim but it was enough for me.   Baked Penne Marinara: 3 - a little bland, but a generous portion.   Chimichurri Salmon: 2.5 - to me, there's something wrong with eating a precooked salmon and microwaving it later. It's dry and doesn't taste fresh.   Grilled herb chicken: 1 - I do not recommend. It was bland, boring and I threw most of it away.   Garlic & Herb Shrimp: 2 - the shrimp is really small and the flavor wasn't that great. It looks better than it tastes.  Peruvian style stuffed peppers: 2 - I wasn't a big fan of this one either. I didn't like the taste and I only ate half of one pepper. The package comes with 2.   Sweet & Spicy chicken: 3 - the flavor wasn't bad but the chicken was small!   Overall, convenient but pricey. I cancelled my weekly delivery and don't plan to sign up again. I'd rather eat out or make my own paleo/gluten free meals.

orQY-dle7aRZPuiJ4RnGDg.text: The meals are just ok. I'm giving it 3 stars just for the convince of the service alone. I was hoping to have more options every month but month after month I see the same meals. So far we have our two go to meals and try different meals for the third one. We get a total of 6 and I double the dish for myself and my husband. They have all been fail other than our two go to meals  So I was really looking forward to the newly added meals. With only having two options that we really like, it makes it hard to stick with the service. I am a first time mom and work 9hrs a day. So that's 12 hrs I spend away from my little one. I was hoping to not be able to cook as much so that I can enjoy my son after work. Instead I have to search on Pinterest for quick meals that taste better than the other was provided by freshly. I'm not sure how much longer I will be staying with them. I've been with them now for three months. I maybe leaving them in 2018. Since grocery stores not deliver as well. Just will have to start meal prepping and cooking quick meals sigh.

lFraJmMoWl1t9iihMt6EVw.text: I was pretty pleased with the food and have ordered 4 times from them.  I still question the freshness of it but if they say it's and healthy I trust them.  Their Facebook page posts promo codes, which I recently used.  Every time I do it I confirm the price and the delivery date before I submit my order.  They did not honor it when I got my credit card statement.  I'm very skeptical since you can't review past orders online receipts.  The customer service rep I dealt with online would not credit my money.  I kept sending screenshots on how the flaw was with the promo code and they kept coming back with excuses.  I sent 3 screen shots confirming all the error on their end.  They would rather keep the $35 and lose me as an unhappy customer than continuing.  Honestly had they resolved it I would have continued making orders. Michael Wystrach, if you're ready this please enjoy the $35 you got to pull over me!

L5f_HuWFzyH3JJlwMg8Yug.text: Food quality is poor, nutritional value is worse and customer service, non existent. Frozen dinners at any local supermarket are superior to Freshly.com, and 1/2 the cost!

DEeAqFaDDl5cjpGXYjJs6w.text: I didn't realize these were microwave meals, it wasn't very clearly announced anywhere before I signed up, and they don't taste very good. I have tried 3 and haven't eaten more than a few bites of any of them before tossing them out.

annAaVB8Z92cb4FTsSDaWg.text: I don't usually write reviews because I work 80 hours per week and don't generally like the standards of decorum of such online social spaces, however I feel inclined to speak up when it comes to this company. I have very high standards for everything in my life and when I ordered these meals it was more for the convenience as I did not think they would really measure up to what I am used to eating in terms of taste and quality. But I must say I was wrong in that regard. Not only did it exceed my expectations as far as convenience, simplicity, and service, but the food is exceptional to taste. Every meal is amazingly prepared and tastes great. With my busy schedule, this is the company I have been waiting for!  Bravo!

9aX-akPoNFkuzfvkkw6Siw.text: I will have to concur with most of the latest reviews.  Freshly is very deceiving when you think your trying out their meal service you are actually signing up for a SUBSCRIPTION.  I ended up with 6 glorified TV dinners. After I tried them there was no way I would have ordered any of them again.  When I got a email saying that my NEXT delivery was a WEEK later (with the exact same food that I didn't like the week prior) I informed them that I was out if town for work and they wouldn't budge.  They wouldn't postpone, cancel or even change the horrible selections to something even more horrible.  Now I will have 6 glorified TV dinners rotting in my front door while I'm away.  I wanted to cancel the order but they gave me some story about it being sent to production.  How can it be fresh it you cook 3 days prior to shipping me?  I will steer everyone I know away from Freshly.  Bad customer service!!!!

-btjBGkNknCpZDVBlf9uiw.text: This concept may sound nice and convenient, but PLEASE think about what you are doing and why.   First of all, the food is in plastic packaging just like any frozen dinner.   Second, it tastes no better than a standard frozen dinner.   Yes, the ingredients may be healthier, but look at the next point.   I ordered SIX meals.   They came in a huge 2' x 2' x 2' box filled with cold packs and an enormous amount of insulation.   The packaging alone is about 15 pounds.  AND THAT WAS ONLY FOR 6 MEALS!!!   Think of all the waste that would be generated if everyone used this service.  Are people really that lazy that they need to have sub-par food delivered to their door in packaging that would overfill their curbside garbage can?   Ridiculous.   I'm appalled by this company.  I hope there are people who are more concerned about limiting landfill overcrowding than they are about a small bit of "convenience."

nJn6rLyACBfFJllX5BdLQA.text: if you like eating handfuls of pepper it's not that bad i guess. i was really teetering between rating this a 2 or a 1. the reason why i decided on a 1 was because giving it a 2 means that it's not absolutely all bad....which i'm sorry to say it is. The food is marketed as being healthy fresh eating. There is nothing healthy about it. some of the items have over 700 calories. The food sounds like it should be delicious but everything has MASSIVE amounts of pepper on it. I don't know if it's because the food is lacking flavor or something and they decided that massive amounts of pepper was a good idea, but there is WAY to much pepper on every dish i had. i could go into the details of how some of the dishes resemble baby food, but will leave it with this....if you want to eat the same type of food. buy a 99 cent frozen meal, pour a bunch of pepper on it and boom...pretty much the same thing.

fzXhDepZFdDxhxapjPEFGg.text: I have tried several home delivery food companies and I absolutely love Sunbasket for the quality, flavor, creativity, recipes,etc. When I saw the opportunity to "try""some of the meals for $39  on a facebook promo, I opted to do so with great excitement and anticipation because these were already prepared.  I was absolutely shocked when I tasted two of their recents offerings. The penne pasta was mediocre at best. The BBQ like chicken with broccoli and potatoes I literally spit out!!! It was absolutely vile! Flavorless, soggy, worse than any third rate TV dinner ever tried. I was so taken a back I requested a refund for my "trial" which they denied. Not surprising! This company won't last and will get many people "trying" for $39 and never have repeat customers again. I was so excited to have prepared food of quality that I could just heat up  and was just blown away that someone could put out such a poor product in this day and age. Please beware and don't waste your money! You will be sorely disappointed. I cancelled immediately and requested a refund because it was that bad. I almost never give negative reviews but felt so strongly that I wanted to protect others from going through this. This is truly a consumer rip off.

VpD0I2vlVZpna6Ve2KCzrQ.text: After the first lost delivery and absolute immediate and fantastic customer service the order arrived Saturday, Sept 24, 2016 about 9:30 in the morning. I had ordered the deal for first timers of 9 meals for $49. - Had to give it a shot. It's okay the first meal. Notes of herbs in the potato hash, the creamed spinach is pretty okay with the Flat Iron Steak dinner and the steak itself seems okay... until you hit meal number 2 or 3. -- Then I found it difficult to work eat my way through meal 3... not because of the size, these are very, very small portions: 3 brussel sprouts cut in half making 6 pieces as a serving of veg with about 2 tablespoons of chopped bacon tossed in - but because - it's - just - icky. It feels wrong... And after meal 3 you might have digestive issues - I did. The first day after only 2 meals I definitely had so much sodium on deck it made my eyeballs pop. Do not order these meals. They are in no way worth the price - even if they were free. - Horrible. - As a barometer -  I'm not a processed food eater. No frozen Stoffer's or anything like that is ever in my normal food intake. No fast-food. Not much sugar except a few super good quality delicious things once in a while. - I am a foodie and love wholesome well made food: not all organic, not vegan or veggie - though not a mandatory meat at every meal person, or even every day. -- This food is Sh-t. - Threw away 5 out of 9 meals.

hXRRkuD51E01QA3tXptKMg.text: These are glorified microwave dinners, plain and simple. And extremely False advertising for being "healthy". $70 for 6 one-serving meals, that have as much sodium, cholesterol, and saturated fat as eating out at a restaurant. My husband and I signed up for this after comparing costs to Blue Apron, Hello Fresh, etc. This one was the cheapest, even with having the meals already made. So we thought, why not? Meals were still cold when delivered to us, but looking at the nutritional facts compared to the freezer one-serving meals we have for those just-in-case days when we didn't have time to pack a lunch for work, they were worse!!! The Freshly meals were higher in every aspect of health of the frozen microwave dinners. Calories, saturated fat, cholesterol, and sodium....no where near being healthy. If you know even the basics of health, anything processed and made to be kept as edible for longer than 1 or 2 days on a shelf is going to have things added to it to make it that way, which ups the bad parts of nutritional content. I have no complaints on the taste of the meals, the meat didn't taste rubbery or fake, but it is an over-priced, glorified microwave meal.

AGtC4Vvv4yLFAw2Y-GB2SA.text: This service has so greatly surpassed my expectations I had to write. If you want a calorie-controlled, convenient, tasty and extremely healthy program, this is your best bet. I had looked at other sites since I got very busy and wanted a solution to help manage calories but eat well. All of those programs use loads of white flour in their meals or are frozen, dehydrated, etc. Yuck. Freshly cooks fresh food and seals it up (no freezing) and then you just treat it like leftovers (heat it up and way you want - I hate microwaves so I don't use one). The presentation is great and the food tastes so wonderful and has a lot of variety. I haven't seen anything with white flour (I had a noodle dish and didn't realize until the end that I wasn't eating noodles but zucchini in perfect noodle form). The package you receive is well-packed and kept cool (and I am so thankful they don't use UPS) I can't say enough good things about this service...absolutely love it.

s2GjBQo1VZ4zX9FT4QuAuw.text: Absolutely AMAZING!!!!!! I am so impressed by everything that I haven't stopped talking about it to everyone I know. Customer service EXCEEDS any I have encountered. I found a Groupon for Freshly & had many questions. First I emailed & had a response in 24 hrs. As a result placed my first order. Despite a minor error in my order I am still giving 5 stars for the customer service. I called & spoke to Sunny (sp?) She was a sheer delight & not only did she apologize & accept responsibility on behalf of the company she credited my account.. Talk about SATISFACTION!!!. But the kicker, the food is 5 star quality. The meals look just like the website, were packed in dry ice & more ice blocks than I could hope for, we live in the desert. I was blown away, I mean blown away by the food itself. Never had vegetables so delectable & perfect the flavor was phenomenal. I look forward to every meal. The portions are hefty & filling and my favorite EVERYTHING is blanket across the board GLUTEN FREE. This can't be beat. My life just became so much more manageable thanks to FRESHLY!!!!! Thank You FRESHLY!!! Sincerely a beyond satisfied, happy customer

mtFT64VoV3hZvCBF27-nBQ.text: I think that this is a quality company. I originally tried a 1/2 price order for 9 meals in a 1 week period. The food was packed beautifully and was indeed fresh. The taste of the food was good, the vegetable sides were not as tasty as if I cooked them fresh but then that defeats the purpose of the convenience. I had a family situation and had to use the "skip a week" option for my next order. Unfortunately, it slipped through the cracks and I received the order. I called and my complaint was heard, my money refunded and all was handled very professionally. I am unable to continue using their service on a regular basis but I will use them for periods that I need the extra help and I am using meal prep time for other things. Great concept, I wish them the very best!

wZ9s_7w46oAw3AVUB0mNWg.text: We signed up to the sample ($40), figuring we could cancel if we didn't like it. Meals arrived Saturday. Tried them Saturday night and Sunday. Meals were marginal for our tastes. Tried to cancel on Monday.... too late. We're getting another shipment probably this Saturday of food we don't like for $60. I recommend if you sign up, immediately pause or cancel since you won't have enough time to decide if you like the groceries. The vegis are okay, but all the meat and fish products we have had are tasteless or taste bad or are tough or chewy (in a bad way). Trader Joe's frozen meals, if you pick the right ones, are a better deal. I would recommend to freshly that meal number 2 be two weeks after meal number one and weekly thereafter. You might keep a few more customers.

yDyX6FCly9AC0x_5EEWd8A.text: Bought the groupon, and then the second week for regular price-6 meals in a week. I liked the food, especially the Salmon and Cod meals. Super easy to order, easier to prepare. I recommend freshly to anyone that wants to have healthy options to eating fast food on the go-or anyone with food sensitivities.

tNs-SEv-VGfcs0iIflXlQg.text: False advertising is written all over this service. Freshly advertises their food as a healthy alternative to meal-prep, but it is loaded with sodium and cholesterol. There are much better options out there.

zVZzI-CsiEgYAUiZykWrMg.text: Loved all the dinner choices we made. The food was fresh, well seasoned, lots of variety. It was wonderful to have 4 dinners and 1 lunch that I didn't have to make. Only drawback is that I used a Living Social coupon and only bought one. The $99 is a little high for us. However if I can find any coupon offer, I will jump on it.

Am43PSs2XD8POpJovz3C_Q.text: @freshly had the worst customer service experience with Jashana (Supervisor Customer Experience). Anyone thinking about trying this company should steer clear.  I signed up a trial using a special promo code and when requesting to terminate the service and a refund I meet resistance. Jashana lead me to believe one thing and then tried to switch things up mid conversation. The issue has escalated to the point of having to contact my credit card company to investigate charges. Again steer clear of this company.

0T3TFOAzaaigyQ_Mfd8M3w.text: I can barely give this business a 1 star. I was attempting to send my 85 year old grandmother a birthday present and my experience was horrendous to say the least. I put in the correct zip code and was told that it would be delivered on the 23rd. My grandmother said she never got it though. I called the company and spoke to customer service to ask what happened and they read to me the incorrect zip code saying I input it wrong. I then found my confirmation email with the correct zip code I gave. I then asked if I could change my zip code and they said they don't deliver to that one. My question is why didn't they tell me that when I put in the zip code? Overall my grandmother and I were terribly displeased with the experience.

dQxdC5ziq1jRtMbq4idpVA.text: Subscribed for a few months. Meals are okay. I feel like they were better when I first started, then the portions started getting smaller, the taste more bland and the delivery late. I was recently double billed and that was my straw with this company and I cancelled. The meals look very gourmet on the website, but this is not the case. I recommend if you want to try, only do this with a promo code.

5nuM0NEGeI0ydvX3iXKaMw.text: Five stars for customer service alone... I have used the service for a few months now and they are SUPER on top of communication, whether I had a question or there was a problem (only once, the food went bad bc the box got delayed, due to FedEx, not Freshly, and they credited my account right away when I alerted them).  I always felt like there was a real, friendly person there, even though we were communicating via email.  The food is very tasty and consistent, and you choose all your meals.  I feel secure that everything they make is absolutely gluten-free (not all meal delivery services can say that, even if they offer gluten-free options).  I'm a fan of this company!

3zvsRhJ-wkLdPN_lpvChsg.text: My husband and I just finished our first 6 plate trial, and loved it! We will be reordering! This time we'll include some of the lunches.

jqVPBQxgdWrMh0_qU-Oa_A.text: Let's be honest here and review this company and food for what it is.  It is a super convenient option for those of us that work long hours, want better food options than McDonald's, but don't have the time or energy to cook at home.  Can I buy a $4 frozen meal at the store, well sure I can, but that is not what I want.  I want something fresher, healthier, and a better portion.  Freshly accomplishes that. Every meal is gluten free, high protein, low carb, and all natural.  If you want restaurant quality meals for $5, good luck to you.  For the convenience and price, these meals are quick and tasty.  Had the flat iron steak meal last night, personally I couldn't finish it all, and the steak was super tender, which surprised me considering we heat it up in the microwave.  I'm excited to try the other meals received.  My husband loved it too, and while he could probably eat more, we are looking to lose weight and have portion control.  I would say the ONLY thing I've noticed was that the meals have high sodium content, but that is expected with convenience meals.   For what this service provides-I love it.  I have not had any customer service issues, but will update if I ever do.

l8SRWpwoOUSXzkIvmKWD8Q.text: I'm kind of sad to see the bad reviews. I've ordered from them several times and I've liked the majority of the food I've gotten. I love that it's low-carb, high protein, and gluten-free. Every delivery I've gotten has been on time, packaged well and very fresh. There is a good variety of entrees to choose from as well as the option to get some entrees without cheese which is great for me bc I can't do dairy. The food is really healthy with whole, simple ingredients, no preservatives and nothing artificial. My only concern would be the salt content but I'm not parched like I am say, after a pizza or a burger so it can't be too bad. There is nutrition info available in case you wanna be sure of what ur eating. There are a few plans to choose from in terms of number of entrees delivered. You can also skip weeks and pause or cancel your subscription with ease.  They usually have deals or offers so definitely be on the look out for them in your email. I took away one star bc any way you look at it, it can be a lil pricey.

Q-vcM-F9pGoaK0SXVUvOEw.text: Buyer BEWARE. READ THE FINE PRINT. Bought this deal off of Groupon hoping this would be a perfect answer for a single that doesn't like to cook anymore. Beginning this review with a positive--it was nicely packaged - when it arrived food was still frozen. BUT I found the food very disappointing then lo and behold here came another package that I wasn't expecting. Turns out once you have ordered, they keep sending. YIKES. So called them right away cancelling , asked for a refund and to pick up the delivery, but they refused. So the package sits in my patio and rots because it's not worth taking up space in my small freezer.

VjDJ68u66DxFVNlQlW9lJw.text: The food was tasty and I would still be eating them if I had not realized the excessive amounts of Sodium and Cholesterol that they contain, in order to preserve the meals....I did like the fact that the calorie count is low and that they are Gluten free but the Sod and Chol levels scared me away...

sw8o2DlI-PtXWzuVAxDSEg.text: I was excited when I saw the meal descriptions online. First disappointment was I had to wait a week for the meal service to get started. Come on. A company should be able to move faster than that. I then loved the meal arrival - simple packaging. Gel cold packs are a bit bulky and wasteful, but the rest is streamlined. My first salmon meal was okay -- because you have to reheat it, the salmon gets overcooked. The peppers meal was also okay but made me question if I would like the rest. Next meal of pecan pork was awful - weird texture to the pork; definitely not high quality meat. Final meal of herb chicken was very good. After the pork I canceled my service. I couldn't tell if it canceled the next week's delivery but assumed it did since not message came up saying it didn't. But they sent another set of meals, saying I had to cancel by 5 pm on Thursday - the day after I received my first shipment on Weds afternoon. Ridiculous. They could have easily canceled my service (I canceled on Friday for meals that wouldn't even be packed or shipped before Monday). Don't use this company, especially if you have high expectations for good-tasting meals.

PeF_7SMbAED3jdfprACTSQ.text: The food was alright for the $49 promo price but not for $99! I could go out to eat everyday for that price! More importantly, their subscription system sucks. I skipped the second week since we had only just received the food and then I was out of town camping the next weekend and got back just after the 5pm Sunday deadline. I was already charged for the next week and while I could still change the meals for another day, they refused to cancel the week's shipment because I missed the deadline by one hour. They claimed it was because the food was already purchased but then how is it I could still change meals? They even told me they sent two emails saying the deadline was Saturday when they really sent one saying it was Sunday. And you can't completely cancel your subscription, only pause it! It's the same system as loot crate or a food coop, except with either of those, if you miss the deadline, you're only out $50/month rather than $100/week. Plus, you get a lot more from those services than this one.

x_dobd37ykQhy8YygB3YfQ.text: I got my first order on Tuesday this week (I decided to try it since they had a $50 off promotion).  I cancelled the subscription on Wednesday due to the following reasons (that I have already sent to them):  1. Every single meal has grapeseed oil and my son is allergic to grapeseed oil, so I have to make a separate meal for him anyway.  It's not necessary to use grapeseed oil for all meals, and others may be allergic as well.  There should be some choices that use safer oils like canola or vegetable oil. 2. The meals are packaged in a way that they look like frozen entrees/TV dinners.  That has turned me and my husband off even though it says it's fresh.  Different packaging would help. 3. So far, the meals are okay, nothing spectacular.  Some have a lot of flavor and others are very bland and definitely not worth the full $11 price. 4. Some containers have the plastic wrap so strongly glued to the box that I can't peel it off, I have to cut it with scissors or a knife.  This is fine, except it makes it difficult at work and when I'm in a hurry. 5. 2 minutes is not enough time to heat all of the products. When I heated chicken dishes such as Chicken Rustica or Chicken Livorno or even the Grilled Iron Steak, for 2 minutes, the meat was cold on the inside.  And I have a very powerful microwave.  All in all, I would love to try this again once the above issues have been resolved.  It's great for full-time working mothers, although on the expensive side.

zwWfVy1et9sYunvAsXTDTw.text: I can't even describe how horrible this company is!  They simply don't understand customer service!  I forgo to cancel my subscription due to a busy life and I sent them an email requesting that the ext shipment of meals not to be sent to me and to refund me $65.  They refused and shipped me their nasty food anyways.  I asked for a refund and told them I didn't want their food and they REFUSED to refund me!  I couldn't believe it.  This is a great example of a company stuck in the dark ages.  If your corporate sees this reviews, i expect a manager or someone higher up to email me and provide me with a proper refund.  Your food is atrocious and will never use your service again.

xIp6Tmpjj1Gz0avgNE4NMQ.text: God send! I'm definitely health conscious and don't have time to cook. Price point is good, taste is good and most of all it's FRESH AND THE FOOD HAS PHENOMENAL MACRONUTRIENTS!

o6m4Akpn1TJTtIfQgllJqQ.text: I wanted to like it. I really really did. And I tried. I hate cooking and meal planning, and was desperate for this type of system- low cal, healthy food, already made, and delivered to my door. In the end though, I just couldn't keep lying to myself.  The other comments about the meals being no different from frozen tv dinners were unfortunately pretty True in my opinion. One big and important difference (for me anyway) is that the chicken seems to be real chicken and not that weird gross chicken composite substitute you find in Lean Cuisines and Smart Ones. That's pretty important, and why I gave an extra star.  Other than that though, yes the meal portions are small. This didn't immediately bother me because I'm intentionally trying to eat small portions. I was still pretty freaking hungry after eating though. I feel like they need to be supplemented with a salad and LOTS of water to make you feel satisfied.  Taste wise, I noticed the same things I notice with regular frozen meals from the grocery store. Sometimes there's a burnt plastic sort of taste. There's pretty much always a nasty aftertaste. And they way overuse the garlic, I think to compensate. No flavor? Throw on some garlic! For example, the Chicken Parmesan comes with steamed broccoli mixed with garlic chunks. And I do mean chunks. I feel like this meal could have been vastly improved by roasting the broccoli and using a seasoning, like Italian herbs. The Rustic Chicken tasted fine, but I swear the 'mashed potatoes' were scooped directly out of a Weight Watchers Smart Ones meal. They were identical and in no way reminded me of real mashed potatoes. The Butternut Squash Risotto tasted fine while eating but I brushed my teeth three times and still couldn't get rid of the chemical aftertaste. Added note: the meals are small, but forget about it if you're eating something without protein. You'll be more satisfied after eating a granola bar.   One last observation... I think some of the meals could be improved with better packaging. The meals come in one disposable plastic container and are microwaved all together. This often results in a soggy or mushy mess. Maybe separate the sauces? Allow the consumer to put the meal together? Just a thought.  Final verdict: these are most certainly not "chef prepared" meals and if they are, the "chef" needs to go back to school. I didn't find them to be any better than what I find in the frozen aisle at a quarter of the cost. If I hadn't employed a coupon on my order, I'd be much less forgiving, but I'm glad I got the curiosity out of the way. Save your money and do either one of the meal kits like Home Chef for real home cooked food, or hit up aisle 17 at your local PigglyWiggly.

iUTtuQ8PfqwykCgRSPP_WQ.text: I ordered a package because I work from home and cannot leave my place. I did not receive my package today(as I was supposed to based on the order). Once I contacted the support, they said I will get it tomorrow from 8:00 am to 9:00 pm. the funny part is that the package is out for delivery and has been stayed in the transit, God knows for how long. They also refused to cancel my order at the beginning. Imagine you receive a (FRESH) food which has been out of the fridge or kitchen for about 36 hours.  Thanks to the good service of Freshly, now I have to get off from my work and go out or find someone to help me get food before I starve to death.  Thank you Freshly.

xbFwdTABRSBuqzT60IG-UQ.text: I have been subscribing to Freshly for a couple of months. I have not tried any of the breakfast because I really don't like to spend dollars at breakfast every day and I'm very basic or over the top on breakfast. My big concern was lunch. I get a per diem every day for lunch. So it was very easy to go out everyday for an hour lunch break. Spend $10 or more plus tip or think your saving money on fast food. My concern was I noticed a huge Spike in my blood sugars because I test them 4 time a day.   I started with the 4 meals per week and it was delivered on time and packaged very professional. Also was included was a starters kit to let me know everything is recyclable and if your into saving our environment that's another topic. I enjoyed the reading material and still keep it around if I can get anyone else interested because you can earn free meals if you do. The meals were fine only a couple I keep in rotation for every other week. You don't want to eat the same meal over and over like every one does from time to time. And I have skipped a week Thanksgiving time. That's a big plus you can schedule when you want.  Deliveries  I prefer to have Wednesday but it you decide I think every one would love Monday but its because of logistics of course. Maybe some day it will happen. But for this I'm ok with being my delivery day. I also like Saturday delivery but during football season I was never home so. The reason I make this point if you look at when your meal arrive look for the  USE BY DATE. Very important because you want to make sure you eat that meal before that date. It's NOT like it will go BAD and I have eaten more than a few meals before the USE BY DATE. Why I make this point because you want to eat it for the best taste and fresh don't be lazy and pick a couple of days after like me. I think you have 5 maybe 4 days after the deliver date before the best by date kicks in. And you can freeze it if you have to. But what's the point in that???  Meals I like that they have changed from the standard 2 minutes and Done. Your packaging tells you if you want to microwave the in package or put your meal on a plate. And now that changes the old standard 2 minutes and done. Every meal is different on cook time and I'm fine with that. I'm a big fan of this it just goes to show you they are always changing or looking for better tasting meals. I always try the new menu choice when it changes only one was a disaster but hey I tried it. I would write it down but I think it will go into the vault soon as a failure recipe. My advice is to try everything in rotation once but as I say that there was couple I stayed away from and it's because it's something a little to unique for my taste buds.    FYI My blood sugars are back to normal after my standard 2 hours and check. And I think that is wonderful. Happy Eating

47CsTwdZNHvop_oib7fAVw.text: I'm not buying these one star review folks! I've been ordering Freshly for almost a year, and sure sometimes you may get a meal that's not quite up to snuff, but this fantastic company ALWAYS makes it right. Think very fresh, never frozen, TV dinners, sounds strange right? If you go to the grocery store and buy a Stoffers individual meal it will run you around five bucks, for five bucks more you get a fresh complete meal delivered to your home! No driving to the store, no shopping, no cooking, no hassle.   Now about the food, I've pretty much tried most of the meals, and with the exception of one meal all of them have been truly fantastic. One time I received chicken risotto and it had a burnt taste. I contacted customer service and they immediately gave me credit towards a free meal. If you're busy and you really don't have time to drive to the store, shop, cook, and serve then this is a dream come True.

CfR2J5e5ZS7ZCSsFIAb00w.text: TLDR: an easy and relatively low-priced option for paleo/GF meal service with low calorie counts. I don't see myself being a regular customer, and I wasn't thrilled with the lack of contact with customer service, but flavors and portions are better than they appear.  Issue #1: my order arrived 24 hours late. Scheduled for 12/15, not received by 10PM, no email notifications and no way to track. I confirmed that they took money out of my account and that I had the delivery date correct. There's no way to contact anyone directly, but if there's a delay with your order, the FAQ page says to email their support department the following day (implying that this is fairly common?). Convenience of preordering is irrelevant if they can't keep to stated delivery time and I end up without lunch/dinner, waiting an extra day. So far no one from the company has acknowledged the delay or even reached out with a form letter or link for feedback.  Issue #2: Full disclosure: I ordered with their half off promo. I can't imagine anyone paying $10/meal for this. It's essentially TV dinners, one step removed from the Atkins line. The food doesn't look appetizing and it literally arrives frozen solid, further lending the comparisons to your grocery-store aisle food. Fresh =/= frozen. The cook times are not accurate- all of meals needed at least an additional minute, if not double the listed time just to get heated through. I'm aware that there can be cooking variations with microwave wattage and elevation, but this is ridiculous. Food is icy inside when following directions.  THE POSITIVES:They offer large menus of over 40 breakfast, lunch, and dinner meals each week, and I like that you can fully customize each meal instead of just in pairs like with other services. But the food is not exciting and service so nonexistent, it's not worth the price or arguable "convenience". Note that you have to join, order, and check a specific page, then download a PDF simply to view calorie counts or additional nutrition info. Not sure why this isn't just printed on the label. However, counts are very reasonable for portion size.  TIP: After placing your first order, immediately put a hold on all additional weeks until you try and decide if you want to continue. Freshly one requires NINETY-SIX hours (four whole days) notice in order to change or cancel any service, which is barely enough time to even eat what they ship before another one is on it's way.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Over 1000 calories in this meal as packaged, ridiculous
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cod in fire roasted tomato sauce
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poorly printed label, tastiest dish

rKjnMpiBt2lbCL31TlCs6g.text: wish i read some reviews before i decided to give freshly a try. the only good experience was they delivered as promised, on schedule, although i had to sign up 1 month prior to delivery date, but i get it. the food quality and taste is comparable to tv dinners, loaded with sodium and not great nutritional values. definitely not for me or anyone who is looking to eat healthy, fresh and tasty meals. i recommend meal services you have to prep instead. to anyone reading this, there's way better meal delivery services out there.

RoGqSdVj2j6fsMOF9jxz6g.text: Absolutely love Freshly! My husband and are both teacher and work late many nights! We were looking for a way to eat healthy, fresh foods! This has been a game changer! No more grocery shopping and meal prepping all day on Sunday. It is reasonable priced as well!

_wFzI9v9KlIjOia7FZUZtw.text: Decent food. Not sure if worth the price. Good concept but the auto-subscriptions really pissed me off and left bad taste in my mouth. No pun intended. Would never use it again just for that in itself. Otherwise likely would have. That's company ethics 101 and it shows that company doesn't think win win or self reviews would be better.

NDtBtmOFD3gWPJAbSlT7Ig.text: The food was fine but they kept messing up my delivery dates, skipped weeks without telling me and were could not turn around quickly to get a box out to me even when they made the mistake

kO3E9_dDSSNCJVS2zm6_gg.text: I found some of the meals to taste salty, and some of the veggie mixes were too tough to chew. I did like the convenience, and the portion sizes were good, but overall, I did not care for the meals. Some were good, but there weren't enough off them to give me an assortment to choose from.

HOAAv1zY7NcTtMWlKuLSFQ.text: Excellent Customer Service.  Delicious gourmet food. All fresh with great ingredients. To answer to people complaining about: Not Enough Rosemary. For me personally, it is more than I would like of rosemary, but I would never bash a chef for it. Everyone's perception of spices is different. To the person who complained about food going bad in 5 days. Maybe you should stick to Campbell. It lasts for 5 years. To people who complain about portion size: this is what a portion should be. It is not a restaurant portion you plan on taking a to-go box after you finish your meal. We are too spoiled to appreciate good things these days.

p5UzIwsIkucN34xkeS52IQ.text: I work full-time and it is really convenient to come home, pop a refrigerated meal in the microwave, and 3 minutes later you have dinner. I get 6 meals/week (I'm on week 3) and it costs $60 which is $10 a meal and certainly less than what I'd spend if I pick something up at a restaurant. (And nowadays I feel like I have to tip the person who hands me the takeout meal.)  A fairly large box is delivered to my front door, I take the 6 meals out of the box, put them in the fridge, and I've got food for the week. I no longer have to spend my drive home figuring out which restaurant I'm going to stop at to pick up dinner. I hate any vegetable that is green (not counting lettuce) and wish I could get rid of the peas and string beans but I realize that not having to personalize meals probably keeps the price down. Some of my favorites include: Penne bolognese, steak peppercorn, turkey meatballs and linguine, turkey shepherd's pie, and slow cooked beef chili. I think there was maybe one or two meals that I wasn't thrilled with but there has been nothing that I had to throw out because I thought it was gross.  And the meals are a good portion size, at least for me; a big guy might think differently. All in all, no complaints.

hp8gue4YZRAPT3P2tETIlQ.text: Update: I have freshlys email stating they were charging me $75 and the credit card bill where they charged me $ 108 so I am disputing this with.  There is no way that I won't win. That will be step one. This is not over.

PYpH9lmdg_TL4_UzRU70Aw.text: I can get better meals at the grocer's freezer case, particularly since the delivery was late AND delivered to the wrong apartment.  All the meals were quite bland except the shrimp paella, which was SPICEY HOT!  Also, I've never had lasagna I didn't like before.  Yuck.  Perhaps this is a new business that has not yet quite found it's way?

fUZqfJF6sDpBCsPkCW5mOg.text: Absolutely, the BEST meal Delivery service around and we have tried most all of them. Freshly meals are just that FRESH! We have been using Freshly for over a year now and they are quick and convenient. Some people seem to think that $10 a meal is a lot but don't consider that it includes FREE shipping! I would challenge anyone to take the meal and place it on a regular plate and be able to taste that it is anything but homemade. My only request would be, Bring Back the Meatloaf! It has been gone for a while and is greatly missed!

dHQkxx6D_Vo3kbEpbU6yxw.text: Very rude customer service, hung up without letting me even finish the sentence. The food is not tasty at all. Not very nice presentation. Be notified if you bought them once they will charge you every week until you cancel.

_fIR2Vy6IM1HpnpatK-X_w.text: I had high hopes for this as compared to other meal delivery services because of the price, but the quality is just not there. They have a good two-order discount, so I did two weeks of this and when the food shows up, it is just really undesirable. Had a Bibimbop bowl that was basically a mushy stir fry. The Chicken Tikka Masala was OK, but the Trader Joe's frozen CTM is 100x better for 1/3rd of the price. I also order from Cooked, which is slightly more expensive, but the quality is outstanding compared to Freshly and the Cooked meals are much larger so I've been able to split them into 2-3 meals making it cheaper in the long run. I hope they work on the quality of their food because this is an important concept for a lot of busy people.

nlL7d5qC6k4DrI_06GchXg.text: The food is good, but as a pescatarian, the options are just too limited. Why would you replace the cod cakes with salmon cakes? Why not have both? I'd order both. TWO fish options is ridiculous.

uIU7EJCJZQXlfOtqeF2OPw.text: Three times in a row this company delivered more than 2 days late and I had to throw everything out. Never again. Yes the refund is nice to get back and the credits but the actual food in time is what I wanted. I can't even use the credits because each time I try the box is late and the credits keep compounding. Would never recommend to anyone. I will be returning to the company I was using prior to this one.

KkhSqgJhtCUSiF6cRXyJ2A.text: The food is good to great. Obviously some dishes are better than others. My personal favorites are the lasagna, Mexican omelette, and Buffalo Chicken. I do wish that they had more variety (especially for Keto diets, I think there's only a few on the menu now.) Otherwise I've been very happy with the meals. My girlfriend and I have been ordering for over a year. Also, Megan on their social media support team is excellent - five stars for her!

u62mJlsOVnDjrkWz6tTGPg.text: So after my last review, customer service contacted me and gave me two weeks free for not delivering my meals so many times. Thank you! So now we're 5 weeks past that point and we've gotten 5 weeks of delivery. Awesome! Oops NOT SO FAST. Week number 6 and NO delivery. They keep blaming FedEx. I don't believe it's FedEx's fault. Again, I was using 2 other food delivery services and they never missed a delivery. Their only problem was cost. I think that Freshly does not plan that well and doesn't buy enough supplies to make all of the meals needed. If you are going to order from Freshly, order extra and put them in the freezer for when Freshly fails you.   Bottom line:  Good Food Good Customer Service Bad Reliability- Can't trust them to get the food to me  Looking back at all transactions with Freshly, there were 15 food orders paid for and 6 refunded. That's about a 60% delivery rate. NOT too good. Gonna start looking fo alternatives to Freshly.

GIA152_WeQvCOwwhx2v6ug.text: I admire what Freshly is trying to do here.  I have no complaints about their customer service, their meal selection, or really anything the company did.  In fact, I'm giving two stars here because I genuinely like the company.  The problem is that the food just isn't very good.  I subscribed for two weeks, ordering six meals at a time.  The first shipment arrived on a Monday.  That's a big deal for me, as the whole reason I'm ordering a "prepared meal kit" is so that I can have healthy food to eat during the work week when I have less time to cook.  My first meal was a chicken breast cooked with some other stuff.  I can't remember exactly what it was, but it doesn't matter much.  The chicken breasts in all of their meals taste the same:  Like cardboard.  Over half of the dishes I ordered were chicken.  I quickly learned that chicken was not a viable option, and without the chicken, there really isn't much variety left on their menu.  I was able to cancel my subscription with no problem.  Kudos to them for making that process easy.  EDIT:  I did have a very good conversation with some of the Freshly representatives after posting my review here on Yelp.  They offered monetary compensation for my dissatisfaction which is something I appreciate.  I declined their offer simply because of the fact that I believe I got exactly what I paid for.  However, I did log in to add another star to my review.  This is a great company that is working on getting their legs underneath them.  As time goes by, I hope to see their product get better.  I will give them another try a year or so down the road because they have earned my business.

YGjsFDYhYxAeXvIReAX4lQ.text: It sure is fresh. But very expensive for the skimpy quantity. I found it very bland and hence expensive for having food with no taste.
