OhJHDOw8XkuyW2-PncZALg.text: Everything is very well-thought-out: the packaging, the marketing, the advertisement, the design, the great customer service, the app, the timing, even the cute little tip on the box saying "I look great on a plate"...  ... except for the main important thing: FOOD. It was so poorly done, I will never believe they hired real chefs to cook it. Tasted like cheap frozen food sold in a dollar store.  I think they paid too much attention to things of secondary importance and completely forgot to take care of the main product. Without good food, all this cute masquerade means NOTHING.

EXxOc718wdA20lZKW84u3g.text: Simply point, I liked Freshly a lot. I work overnight and the meals helped me eat healthier. But, there's no point in having a meal service if you constantly need to buy a backup lunch in case your meals don't show up on time  My order is still in New Jersey even though it's supposed to arrive today (05/09). In the last month and a half, 2 out of 6 meals were late. It may not seem like much, but when you are paying $60 a week to have your packages regularly forgotten by Lasership enough's enough.   Please switch your shipping company and I will gladly come back. No other company has this much trouble delivering packages.  My only regret is no more Steak Peppercorn

hPYJilq5TDj_zQRz6YVCMA.text: I guess a lot of other people have either had poor experience with the food or shipping.  I personally have had good success with both.  Some meals I automatically avoid - if it's steak-based, my experience has been that it is chewy/tough and taste weird.  But some of the others like the buffalo chicken with loaded cauliflower has been delicious and tender.  The chicken with Mac and cheese is delicious.  Chicken Livorno was great.  Pulled pork, pork carnitas, etc all very good.  Shipping has been right on time every time.  Maybe it depends where you live?  I hope that Freshly can work out the kinks for those who have not been happy so they remain in business!

BWWHPd7AEPk6iP9hhfEi0w.text: Comparison between Freshly and Factor75  I've ordered a few times from Factor75 and Freshly in my opinion these are the top two Companies in the already made food delivered to your door. One thing I don't like about Factor75 is they take 2 days in shipping to deliver while Freshly is next day. Factor75 is also more expensive and more calories but I think some of the meals have more flavor than Freshly but can't go wrong with either. Average cost per meal for Factor75 is around $13 while Freshly average cost is around $10 however coupons are much easier to find so I've ordered from Freshly about 5 times, each time average around $7/meal so almost half the cost which makes up for the slightly less flavor (which I can easily fix by adding some seasoning or sauces). Factor75 also tends to rotate meals more than Freshly. Which has its pros (variety) and cons (sometimes you can't reorder your favorites). Overall you can't go wrong with either. Both companies offer flexibility in cancelling weeks or restarting (within reason, obviously you can't cancel the day of after they already started making or shipped it). Factor75 I did enjoy the free bag it was a nice surprise.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Us9T3TzVP0rJ6N0q5-6E_Q.text: The food is basic, bland and has continually arrived late, I mean what is the point of having a delivery date of Monday if you constantly deliver on Thursday. I have used them for 7 weeks, 1 time I didn't receive my food at all. Another time I got something different than what I ordered. Only 1 time has the food come on a Monday. If I am lucky it comes on Tuesday around 5-6 p.m. which for someone using them for lunch means either waiting 5 hours or getting something to eat locally, which I thought was the idea behind getting prepped food, to avoid that.....When my food arrives on Wednesday I get a nice "Well, we have 48 hours to deliver from your set delivery date" So after my meals were "delivered" on a Thursday I decided the food is nowhere worth the hassle.

_4h_npRQ2p1exVV_lD2-jw.text: The food is extremely sub-par. I threw most of them away before finishing them. Support does nothing to resolve your issues except store credit, Which I do not intend to use seeing as the quality is just non existent.   The foods are haphazardly thrown together. QC is nonexistent. Most frozen dinners taste better than this garbage.  Freshly has a great idea. But implementation is severely flawed.

h5oKSnJvaZfXFkcUuPnRGw.text: Our first delivery was pretty good--my husband and I are both pretty picky with the quality of foods, and we were both impressed.  We have a 9 month old baby boy, so I thought this would be pretty convenient. After that though, it all went downhill.  My next delivery got lost, and never arrived so I got a credit.  They were so apologetic and told me they would look into why this happened with the delivery service and I would get my scheduled meals the next week--they couldn't send a replacement for that week.  So I ran out and bought groceries for the week.   The next week, my package got damaged at the shipping facility, so I never got it.  Two weeks in a row?  That's bad luck.    The next week, the my package went to the wrong shipping facility.  Now I'm mad.  I call them up and tell them I want to cancel, but they convince me that I would get my next shipment, and was offered credits for my next two shipments.    The next week, the package got lost AGAIN!  Enough is enough now!  I called and cancelled and told them I understood they were a new company, but maybe they should think about getting another delivery service.  The rep said "we hope you come back" and I was like DOUBTFUL BYE.  I'm so disappointed because the food was pretty good and super easy, but what are you gonna do.

om4sJpZztnIRtbHWLwj0HQ.text: I've been chronically ill for a while now and so I decided to try this company which makes it easier to just pop some freshly chef made food into my microwave and eat. No cooking, no washing pots and pans. I had read the reviews which were mainly good.   I tried the 6 meals for $39.00 plan and when it arrived it was in a nicely insulated cold box, everything was icy cold so I was not worried about the quality or safety of the meals.   I ordered:   Sicilian Chicken Parmesan Meatloaf w/ Cauliflower Mash Chicken Fajitas w/ roasted corn (no tortillas) Breakfast platter of eggs, potato hash, and a sausage patty Denver Omelet with cheese BLT Omelet with cheese  I thoroughly enjoyed each meal although I am not a fan of uncured pork, it tastes too gamey for me so that made the omelets not really edible for my taste. The bacon and the ham were baked into the omelet so I could not pick it out and there was not much cheese inside at all. The omelets do not come with sides, a little veggie would be nice.   They use greek yogurt in a lot of their sauces, in the cauliflower mash and in the roasted corn and I'm not a huge fan of yogurt but again, just personal preference.   I canceled my subscription simply because there aren't yet enough vegetarian options on the menu, I only saw one and it was a penne pasta, that is something not hard to make on my own even when I am ill. If they ever offer a lot more vegetarian options and switch to a cured bacon I'll try it again.   If those things don't matter to you, you will likely find the dishes fast and fresh and very easy to make. I would recommend this to a friend with fewer food issues.  I will definitely keep checking back weekly to see if they add new items and more vegetarian fare, even though I'm not a vegetarian I like to opt for those non meat items especially for food delivery.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Denver Omelette
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XueWpQcY74TxSH9VOIHJeQ.text: The food is ok. I really loved the fact that it was never frozen. Also, I loved the convenience. The food was similar to TV dinners in taste. The meatballs and spaghetti squash were my favorite out of the 6 meals I ordered. The protein tends to be far superior to the sides. The green beans were pretty much inedible in my chicken with butternut mac and cheese. At $12.50 a meal, the quality just wasn't good enough. I might pay $7 a meal, for the convenience,  but the food still is not good. The portions were fine for me. I had no problems with delivery. I've tried at least 5 food delivery services which are approximately the same price per meal, and this is my least favorite.  I canceled my subscription after one delivery.  Update:  their customer service gets a 5 star review from me. I really believe they're going to try to improve their product, and if I hear that they do in the future, I'll give them a try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Freshly meals

3KrUNIHHCf5hrdqFp6qiVA.text: Have had freshly for two weeks and I'm canceling. Food is not good and the cooking instructions are never right. Out of the eight meals I've had so far every single meal has been semi cold or so watery it is inedible until u take a paper towel to it. The cooking instructions always require at least three-four minutes of additional cooking time on top of the recommended amount. I follow the exact instructions for storage and cooking and the results are always terrible. Reached out to customer service and got a generic response to cook it longer if it's still frozen. Food is terrible unless you typically pour about a cup of water onto your meals prior to eating them. Look elsewhere if you want meal delivery.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pesto Turkey Meatballs

kW70WjcK_-Af48EjJoGdtg.text: I tried freshly and after giving my six meals a try, only one tasted good.  The others either smelled weird or just didnt taste good to me, no matter if I tried to dress them up.  I really wanted to like them because it seemed like a great option for lunch during the week for me.  I just dont think for the price the taste of these are worth dealing with.  Honestly, there's frozen dinners that I like ALOT more than what I tried this week.  I updated my review because Freshly reached out to discuss my complaint and that was actually very nice of them. I'd be willing to try them again if they change some of the meals in the future based solely on this great customer service.

pnQjKNvDuJ8G6lx9v9MJOA.text: Over priced TV dinners!!! They break it down that each meal is ten dollars. I thought well ten bucks for a meal isn't that much since I live in Cali and everything expensive and I'm taking care of a baby with no energy to cook! Perfect! My food was delivered today and it looks very pathetic. I'm so disappointed with the size and quality. It looks like a TV dinner and it tastes like one too. So far I have tried the veggie baked penne. Loaded with fat for such a small portion size. I canceled immediately. Don't waste your money. Go to the grocery store and buy frozen TV dinners, they last longer and are way cheaper. Edit: I bumped it up to three stars because the peppercorn steak is really delicious. But I still feel these are overpriced TV dinners.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6_fW3AEXX3MamwKfEphieg.text: Truly Awesome  Okay, I will start this with saying I have never had an issue with Freshly not getting me my boxes on time, but I can see how that would be frustrating for sure. I have always gotten my boxes when I ordered them, I suppose I'm lucky there!  But besides that, I am genuinely having a hard time understanding the negative reviews for Freshly. In fact, I decided to leave a review because I know they deserve it and there were too many bad ones floating around.   Freshly is, simply, awesome. I have used it when I lived alone, and it fed me for a full week (lunches and dinners). And I have used it when I lived with others for dinners for us all. It is a life-saver. While I admire and wish I was like those people who meal-prep religiously, I'm just not there right now. These meals are all so great. I have recommended it to everyone I know, and my sister has since signed up.   The meals are fresh, delicious, and so so easy. Of course, there are some meals I like better than others, but... that is how normal human everything works. It's a taste preference.   On nights we haven't cooked, we get to come home to a real meal. On days I haven't packed lunch, I get to bring in a healthy meal to work (although it is a big lunch portion, cards on the table). I have not had a single meal that was an upsetting portion size. I love having a serving of veggies with the meals, I love putting something in the microwave and being done. They do expire relatively quickly (4-6 days, ish), but honestly that made me feel better since they are made with real fresh ingredients. And real fresh ingredients don't last forever.   This is an awesome service for people who lead busy lives. I'm sure the people with negative reviews have their own reasons, but seriously -- I cannot recommend this service enough. I am all in, no questions.

9MduHbrd16IzKh5-wto6YA.text: I've used them for 3 weeks now and honestly I think the food is pretty good coming from someone who really hates to cook.  I like the variety though after 3 weeks I like to change the order a bit.  The issue is really the sodium level of each entree which can be in the 500-600 range.  It seems high for most people.  I just canceled my subscription due to the fact that once I get the order there is only 3 days left before the 'use by' date.  The advice is to just freeze them but honestly if it takes 3 days to get them delivered having a $10 frozen dinner doesn't seem to be the best plan of attack.  I got my friday delivery on sat so don't have the ability to eat 6 meals in 3 days.  I love the concept but think if they can't deliver quicker its not a good option unless you live in Az or NY.

HD9Il7NHbRdhPvZpoIJ0jw.text: I missed two weeks of my meals. Instead of crediting me or updating me with options I get their automated messages. This is an NYC HQ company. I live in NYC, how can they not deliver on time? Not once, but twice!   A fundamental part of your business is to deliver food on time and you failed at that.   Absolutely horrible.

s_BMmnDNYj824oUoPvcLtQ.text: I've been keep coming back to Freshly ever since they started the business, it's good food, quality is quite decent, and judging by the delivery cost, material cost and actual ingredients value, I believe the price is reasonable IF AND IF it's under 8 dollars per meal.  I would give five stars, but the price is a bit high. But I do appreciate a lot on the fully recyclable packaging instead of styrofoam packaging cooler that all the meat delivery companies use. Especially for me doing A5 BMS 12 Japanese Wagyu premium steak delivery service from time to time, I can re-use the Freshly cooler packaging every time I got the Freshly delivery! Nothing goes into waste!

Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PudI-W2ecsKjM6Gj5FTqqQ.text: The food is definitely the same as a frozen dinner from the grocery store, which would cost much less than $10+. I didn't taste anything gourmet, it did taste healthy but nuking it probably removes any actual nutrients. I didn't have any issues with delivery. I cancelled my subscription after my first try because the quality of the food just isn't that great.

asLywtp_YhBCZhQoU9VglQ.text: I've been ordering freshly on and off for a few years. Overall the pros are the high quality and very convenient food. Yes you microwave it, but it is nothing like a microwave meal! I don't order it as often as I use to because I would like more variety. They did add a few new meals over the 2017 holiday season but now I've tried those too. A few meals I don't mind having every week - the chicken livorno is my favorite, and my husband loves the baked penne marinara. If you haven't tried freshly yet, it is definitely worth a go. On the rare occasions I haven't been able to finish the meals before their best by date (about 5 days from the day they are delivered) I've found that some meals freeze and reheat well. You can use my coupon code for $20 off the first and second weeks of freshly. Enjoy! refer.freshly.com/s/Jess...

kETYEuUmgTWgcfehGzHWOg.text: They say "all natural" on their site but when I contacted them to ask if they have GMOs in their food or if there are antibiotics in their meat, they said yes. GMO stands for genetically modified organism and antibiotics are man made chemicals. There's nothing "natural" about either of these.  This company is pretending to be something they aren't and are misleading the public into thinking there's nothing bad in their food.  It's a shame because their food looks good.

T5Kz1wXZychmEA8YK8VsUA.text: Convenient, healthy, delicious, affordable.  We went from eating fast food for lunch every day to healthy meals that only take 3 mins to heat up.  I'm honestly surprised these aren't more mainstream yet.  LOVE this company.

3Xl6j6Kvn4xH3XvmXTcBtw.text: Selection good; shipping and packaging great; reminder system great; Food: vegetables lack seasoning or flavor; meat is prepared well and flavorful.  Food heating instructions simple and easy. Be careful about expiration of food.  Most it expires within 3-5 days, so you may not be able to eat the "weeks" worth of food.

w9jqlg61pCRWssRkwLqHIg.text: The absolute worst "meal" service I have tried.  Tasted like burnt/bland TV dinners. At over $10 a meal I could have purchased much fresher food or even gone out to most restaurants and ate a real sized meal.  The portions were small and the selection was limited.  Cancelled after 1 box. If you want to stay healthy and eat frozen food eat any Amy's or Udi's frozen meal.  If you want fresh food boxes , try Green Chef or Plated.  What a waste of $60.

DlaGD02ojmEnwDPfBvT19w.text: I'm surprised at the negative reviews as my experience has been nothing but exceptional. The food I've received is pretty darn good considering it's a prepared/shipped meal.  The chicken dishes are excellent and some of the most tender chicken I've had including restaurants.  The portions are ample. The packaging is a bit cumbersome but isn't that a good thing to insure the meals get to you in good shape?   The price is as low or lower than most other companies and I've had absolutely no delivery issues whatsoever.  They arrive the same day and about the same time to the hour each week. Their website is fantastic and very user-friendly!   The only suggestion I have is that they create new meals on a regular basis.  I'm beginning to eat the same meals over and over again.  But I still love this service.

vyeUACwtDYXJV-g6O3fumQ.text: Freshly has been a much welcomed addition to my life. After seeing their promotion on Instagram, I decided to give them a try and I am certainly glad I did. Not only do the meals arrive cold in their ice packed box, but the food and customer service are outstanding! I have tried home meal kits such as Blue Apron in the past, that required a lot of prep time chopping and preparing the food. Freshly takes care of that all for you with perfectly portioned ready to go meals. The food is incredibly delicious, healthy, and makes me feel warm and fuzzy inside. The two times I have had to contact customer service (to change my delivery date and a billing error) they were quick to resolve my concerns. A quality product means nothing without quality customer service. Freshly has set the bar high with both.

ze1sSFnFCghNwI9RJvFglw.text: We just finished the 2 week sample of 6 meals a week. While most of the dishes are flavorful, the portion size is way too small. My husband and I always have to eat another meal or snack after since we are still very hungry after finishing the meals. I wish these meals were filling enough to keep ordering.

18Nh58O_Vr0I7gJ78u8mEg.text: Another unhappy customer. I can take the blandness in the food. But the frequent delivery issues is crippling the experience. Another one today.

aSiw5hfpdqtxcdyni5KAlg.text: I should have just listened to the reviews. Received my order, but literally not one item is what I ordered.  I went ahead and tried two, they were lacking in flavor. Just not what I would want to spend $53 on for 4 meals. It might work for some, definitely not for me though.

843Z2YfPdKMb0gDG-QZFGg.text: So, here we are all these months later.  I continue to love the comedy writing here from the disgruntled people: "It didn't have enough pepper or salt."  Here's a crazy idea - go to your cupboard and get out those little shakers that say salt and pepper.  Shake them onto your food.  I know this requires some effort but the exercise is good for you.  Same with any other seasoning you may want to use to perk things up.  Then there are the "three days to eat everything" folks.  Not quite - I eat them over four days and have never had an incident in doing so, plus they can be frozen, rather like some people's brains.    Here's the thing about Freshly and probably any of these services - learn.  Learn what you like and don't like, when it's best to receive, how to parse them out.  I frequently eat one for lunch, jog, then later eat one for dinner - easy to lose weight that way.  Another thing to learn: You can cancel a week anytime you like - very easy to do, you're always sent an e-mail and there you are.  I don't do it every week, and sometimes a month goes by, but I usually come back to it because it's just convenient.  The one time I either didn't get the e-mail or it went into the ether and I saw they charged me, I simply picked up this thing called the telephone, called their easy to locate phone number, and even though it was a day after the cancel time, they canceled anyway and immediately refunded that money.  Whether you end up loving this company or not, the one thing you cannot say is that they don't have great customer service, because if you say that I will come over to your house and conk you on the head with a Freshly meal or, maybe even a churro.    The meals: They switch 'em up every now and then, which is nice, but I tend to like the ones I like.  I've tried a lot of them - they're all well prepared but obviously not everyone is going to like everything.  For example, I would rather have a truck drive through my forehead than order anything called pork carnitas.  I'm very fond of the meatloaf (I do add ketchup, just because I do that), I like the sausage and peppers, the bolognese, the chicken risotto used to be better but it's still pretty good, the chilis are all good, so plenty to choose from.  And to the people who say there isn't enough variety - my guess is that the people saying that go to restaurants and always order the same thing, and when they cook at home they always make the same five dishes.  What's the difference, folks?  I haven't tried the breakfast stuff because I don't like eating in the morning.  I've recommended Freshly to any number of people - people on diets tell me they prefer it to Jenny Craig, for example.    And once again to the people who say these are like frozen dinners - go have a frozen dinner sometime, because these are nothing like any frozen dinner I've ever had.  Also, as they recommend I, too, would recommend plating the meal.  Good delivery date is important, too - Monday - Wednesday work really well - I do Wednesdays but the arrive very late in the afternoon thank to the always non-superior delivery skills of ONTRAC, so I usually eat one that evening, two on Thursday, two on Friday, and the final one on Saturday.  Works really well.  So, that is my update for Freshly, whether you want it or not.

aEU6Tx0tU7RUqAsSiMARuA.text: So disappointing. We end up eating too many microwave meals in our household so I thought this would be a better alternative to frozen meals from the supermarket. I was wrong. I tried a number of different meals but didn't find one that was better than a frozen meal, yet these cost $10 per one person meal! I ordered multiple of each particular meal for each of my four family members. After trying one of each different meal the other meals were usually thrown out because nobody would eat them. As I didn't want to waste meals that I had paid $10 each for, I forced myself to eat some of them. Most of them were thrown out though. Honestly, airline food is much better. Totally wasted my money. I cancelled my weekly subscription yet was still forced to pay for two more weeks of these meals. Be warned: you cannot cancel straight away

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oxuBOTKm764xZ9CCa3eQqQ.text: I was so excited to receive my first box of 6 meals!   I chose one that would expire the soonest.  It was  Jamaican Jerk Chicken.  I've had jerk chicken before.  The meal was so bland I didn't even finish it.  So disappointed. Tomorrow I'll try my second meal....if it is bland, I'll have to cancel my subscription.

Iqc5x96pXlE_3K10OJvwtQ.text: Single working mama here.....  My daughters are 3 and 4.  Once upon a time, I used to cook dinner every night.  Then I had kids and I cooked a few nights/week.  Then, my marriage fell apart, I started working full time with full custody and ended up in denial that the most I was cooking was Trader Joe's frozen meals and eggs.  I had become a Gilmore Girl!!!   Oooooh.... And my kids (that I thought would only eat healthy food ever) were having fast food on a regular basis.  I just couldn't get organized.  It was too much for me to balance, at this time in my life.  And.... It took me too long to try something like Freshly.  I felt sooooo much guilt!  My kids were growing up without home cooked food....  And then sometimes I would cook food and they would barely eat any (like typical 3 and 4 year olds).... and I would feel so defeated.  Anyways.... back to Freshly.  Now, Post-Freshly, I pick up my kids from preschool at 5pm ish, take them to the park or botanical gardens or pool for 1:1 time for about an hour.  We get home and dinner is ready in 5 minutes.  It is on the table in less than 10 minutes.  We eat together as a FAMILY!!  And it tastes like home cooked food (definitely a difference in freshness from Trader Joe's).  We get to practice setting a table, we say a prayer, we talk about our day and they are exposed to a variety of healthy foods. And there is no need for fast food.  My meals are planned. If my kids don't feel like eating it, it is no big deal because I didn't slave over a hot stove for 45 minutes.  There is no pressure.  It is also helpful in my dieting.  I have struggled with losing weight, mostly because of the difficulty cooking it, planning it, etc.  The calories are listed and there is no need to ever just grab dinner somewhere.    Really... a game changer!  I also love the frozen packs it comes with. And the lack of cleaning dishes from cooking. And if you are sharing food with a toddler or preschooler, (like me), there is usually enough to split, if they aren't big night time eaters.  And because we were eating out so much, it's not even costing more.  Win all around.  Thank you, Freshly!  **Oh and I see some pictures above of the food in the container it comes in.  I HIGHLY recommend plating it.  I bet it even tastes better plated (even if just psychological), it def. looks better and removes all feeling of TV dinners.

NNnJ6Qv_7iwKETrEmmFH9g.text: Definitely would not recommend if you are trying to lose weight, want to eat clean, care about the environment, or don't like feeling bloated. Decided to give Freshly a try after receiving countless emails about a discounted rate with a subscription. The price point was appealing, and since I knew the upcoming weekends would be busy (when I normally meal prep), I thought I would finally give it a try. I signed up for the flex12 meal plan, which included 12 meals per week. This would be enough for my husband and I to go through. We picked out a variety of meals (mostly chicken), and eagerly awaited our first delivery. My first meal, Morrocan Chicken was pretty good, however the plastic film covering the container is incredibly difficult to peel back. The meal had a good amount of flavor, left me full, but also left me incredibly bloated. The next few days I tried out a few more meals including: Steak Peppercorn (not a fan), Chicken Risotto (Disgustingly fatty), Chicken Fajita (probably my favorite) and Southwest Chicken Bowl (this was okay, but way too filling for me).   The portion sized are not for everyone. As a young woman who wants to maintain my weight, the macros don't fit. The majority of the meals have over 25g Fat and over 40g Carbs. Plus the sodium is comparable to eating Fast food. I felt bloated every day I ate one of these meals.  For what it claims to be - fresh, healthy,  and convenient, I feel slightly misled. Is does not taste fresh; just look at all of the random ingredients on the back. It is not "healthy" to most peoples standards, unless you want to eat something that sounds healthy but the macro nutrients are comparable to eating fast food. It is somewhat convenient but sacrifices the environment with the amount of packaging used to deliver and store the meals.   I would only recommend if you are in DESPERATE need of food and use the coupon.

-xpZxhZbX2BPe8Kvf3z2Gg.text: Today I received my package and the first meal I ate was the peppercorn steak.  The taste was better than I thought, and the steak was surprisingly juicy.  But I did noticed heavy amounts of sodium and fat, not just the peppercorn steak, but to the rest of the meals I ordered.  Maybe that's something freshly can work on.  But overall, not bad.

tkrINeV8FuUclhFKYw43hg.text: Saw a coupon on FB and gave it a whirl. Boy do I regret it.  Barely have the energy to rap out this review. Started feeling funny with the shrimp plate at lunch.  A lot of hiccups and tummy rumbling.  The chicken marsala is tearing me up nauseous sweating gassy and worse. Sorry freshly not very fresh after all. Awful product and I want a refund.  Definitely a learning experience. The concept is DOA. Get your fresh food from a kitchen at a trusted restaurant or store where the human element is there serving it to you. Delivery is definitely the point of failure for Freshly.  Sorry about it but people need to know what kind of risk they are taking with this service. I'm sorry for the entrepreneurs and investors responsible for Freshly. Guys this model isn't going to work.. unless your marketing team can convince people it's okay to get sick.  Freshly: A service so scary it inspired me to create a Yelp account just to warn everyone.

84138dk7DjZDlETfEkyYMw.text: Is Megan M. in customer service a "One Woman Show" ???? Small company ? We'll see how this 1st, 9 meal order goes coming from their Savage, Md. kitchen location !!!

h_e74XYGrRsI40SjrsteWw.text: I have subscribed for a month or so now, and I appreciate not having to deal with cooking in the evening. As much as I think there should be more in their rotation, I still get more variety than if I cooked for myself, and it tastes better when someone else cooks, even if it does come packaged. Some meals are a real hit for me, like the steak and the salmon cakes. Some are not so hot on my list, like some of the numerous chicken filet entries. The bibimbap was sort of okay, but I won't do it again. I guess one of the hard things I deal with is that while I eat a bit better, I also feel lazy, so it is a tossup. Maybe they can add a dessert once in a while to the box. In fact, they give up a real marketing opportunity by only putting in the receipt.

xDlBd5Yu8z76XFEWkKpbvA.text: I ordered Peppercorn Steak, Buffalo Chicken, and Sausage and Shrimp Paella. They were all very small portion and the quality was mediocre at best. I would spend much less for frozen food like Amy's that would taste better. I will not order from Freshly again.

Ww8z6_E8j_M53hgpUExGQw.text: We're on our fifth week of Freshly. We are doing 12 meals a week, which is enough for six dinners. I don't think we've had one bad meal. We've had a decent number that we wouldn't order again, but there have also been some really great meals. At this price point I set my expectations accordingly as we are paying $9 all in for the meal. I assume the price would be a decent amount lower if they didn't have to deliver the meals. What I really enjoy is the variety and the convenience. My wife really loves fish and I do not. So it's allowed us to some nights have different meals based on preference. You save a decent amount of time not having to cook and trips to the grocery store have been reduced.  I will say some meals that have sausage don't seem to have enough flavor in the meat. I assume Freshly is playing it safe to make sure it's acceptable to a wider base of their subscribers. We can easily add a little powered red cayenne pepper or salt for more flavor.  We've actually lost a decent amount of weight with these meals as it helps train your stomach to what a proper portion is and you don't get a chance to overeat.  Customer service is top notch. It's too bad they don't add some extra freebies or free samples (snacks).  Negatives: Some of the meals don't feel like a good value at $9 per meal. For example, the chilli and pasta (with meat) aren't on par with the fish or steak meals. If you went to Sprouts you'd be able to pick up a pasta dish twice as large with twice as much meat for $6.   You never know when in the day the delivery will come. It may come at 8am and sit in the sun or 6pm. I like that they send you a text letting you know when it has arrived. I've not had any meals spoil.  I wish they made it a bit easier to recycle the gel packs and that you could recycle the insulation for the delivery box. It's too bad they don't use re-usable packaging.   We do the 12 meal plan and wished they allowed for larger discount for 14 meals or more so we could get enough meals for the all our dinners each week.  Because you have to put your order in one week in advance it can be a bit difficult to know what you are in the mood for, what meals you are tired off, or if you trying a new meal you aren't sure if you should get it two weeks in a row since you don't know if you'll like it.

s8C1nsUavaellgbai2O_Gg.text: I am not feeling enamored with Freshly right now. My very first week with them, I see what is no doubt a not uncommon occurrence--I get an email warning me my food "might not arrive on time" and to throw it away when it gets here and "we will refund your money."   Freshly, this is your one and only chance. When this happens again, I will immediately cancel my subscription. What the hell good is it if you can't get my food to me on time? Now I have to re-plan an entire week of meals. I don't have time for this kind of headache and what is supposed to be a convenience with Freshly so far has been nothing but a hassle.   Also--that seems like a good way to eliminate one week of my twenty-dollar discount, so you will also give my my full forty dollar discount by extending the discounted price an extra week. If you don't, I'll be adding to this review. And yes, I WILL be sharing the hell out of this review on Facebook.  UPDATE  AUGUST 30, 2019.  For some reason, I decided to renew with Freshly, even though their food is just a step above a TV dinner. Lo and behold, the trouble with this company picked back up. I skipped August 31. Why? This is LSU's season opener and there will be 250K tailgating within a few blocks of me. Mail doesn't get through on game days. Even though I skipped, I get an email: "Hooray! Your food has shipped!"   I swear, this company is obtuse. They must get Walmart rejects to staff their distribution. And again, their food is just meh. I thought I'd try again after the first review mainly because I don't have time to cook for one. But hey, stay far away from this company.

ckDwZQ98qUKCwPF93DOrkQ.text: I tried the Freshly trial because the ads on Facebook made the options look great. Kudos to their marketing / branding team - they are doing something right. The online platform looks great, was easy, and worked well. But the positive comments will end here.  I tried the 6 meal plan, and ordered a mix of vegetarian and meat options. Every single one of the three options I tasted were *actively* inedible - and I certainly do not claim to have a difficult palate to satisfy. The Grilled Chicken Pesto Risotto, Super Pesto & Veggie Fusilli, and Almond-Ginger Chicken Bowl were not only "not delicious", they often left me feeling like I needed to cleanse my palate with something else in my fridge because of their aftertaste.   I have three meals left, and literally can't bring myself to finish them. My roommate had the same experience - she threw out three of her boxes.  For the purported value add (cost, convenience, price) - especially in comparison to similarly-priced meals and fast-casual veggie bowls at Sweetgreen, Cava, Chipotle or otherwise) - this was shockingly bad.   The business idea has potential - they just need to actually make the food taste good.

ZEhj1gt_B7bsYbUjgjXhzg.text: I've been using Freshly for several weeks now. At first I was happy with the ordering and delivery process, but recently, I've been receiving far too frequent notifications that my shipments are delayed, sometimes by an entire business day. The inconsistency is more than annoying--it's troubling for someone who plans their meals around their Freshly delivery. Essentially, no Freshly, no dinner. The greatest annoyance was returning from a trip over a holiday weekend to discover that my order was cancelled due to my delivery date falling on the holiday. I can understand limited delivery availability on holidays, but here's the issue: I was not notified of the cancellation--I found out by opening the app to see why the delivery hadn't been made. Why not notify the customer? And why not move the delivery date to the day following the holiday rather than cancelling the order. I reached out to Freshly through their app to share my feedback, but the response was that I should contact them two weeks ahead of upcoming holidays to see if alternate delivery dates are available. Something seems backward about this. Shouldn't Freshly be proactive about letting customers know of adjustments to the level of service they provide? I hope Freshly can use feedback like this to resolve service pain points as I do believe the meals are decent. Time will tell.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nhAx-LYX04xomUsDqSnOyQ.text: It's time for an HONEST update because Freshly (Megan) kindly reached out and tried to make it all right for me. I did get my order this time, Yay! Here's the deets:   The box showed up at my door nice and early, carefully packed up and colder than the abominable snowman's heart. Some folks have complained about the packaging and how the meals look like mush. Quite frankly, I think they are insane. I don't see how you can make food that's been shipped (and presumably thrown around by the carrier) any better than it was. It's fine! I took some tips from other reviewers and cooked 2 meals partially in a pan -- totally helps the texture!  Here are my thoughts from the last haul:  Pulled Pork - Mushy and a little watery. Microwaved and probably should have thrown in a pan. Pork needed a little more umami flavor. 6/10  Teriyaki Salmon Cakes - Pan fried the meal for better texture. Salty Salmon - presumably from the teriyaki. Vegetables were ok. 6.5/10  Chicken Tikka Masala - Sauce was seriously on point. More chickpeas than I would have thought were in it. Some pieces of chicken were burnt?  6/10  Buffalo Chicken - Sauce tasted like franks red hot (yum). Chicken was juicy. Potato side was also very flavorful. 7.5/10  Southwestern Chicken + The Vegetarian variant - Loved the colors, vegetables, the quinoa etc. My SO thought the lime sauce had TOO much cilantro, while I did not mind it at all! Veggie portion wasn't totally filling, maybe needed more protein, but I liked it a lot. 8.5/10   Overall, good but not great! I will be getting a second shipment with completely different food so I will update if necessary. One thing to note: despite being fresh, some dishes have more sodium than others so do look at the labels carefully and drink an extra glass of water if sensitive :)

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey meatballs with spicy sauce and siclician chicken  parm. Topped with pepper, red pepper flakes and parmesan.
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some of the chicken was a little burnt
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala ... and some wine from Tuscany ;)

DJ3VErUsKIQNMVmacQsFFQ.text: Freshly was a Godsend especially, when I traveled weekly for work. I was rarely home, in fact I think I spent more time up in the air than sleeping on my own bed! LMAO....  And since I did all of the cooking when I was home, I spoiled my Sweetheart who is culinary challenged (or maybe lazy?)  Hahaha.... The things we do for love!  Anyways, this review is long over due.  When I used Freshly's service, they have always been great. Not to mention very easy to reorder your meals. For those who are not familiar with Freshly, they can plan, prepare and cook your meals fresh, and ships them overnight to your home.  The meals are very fresh so they need to be consumed usually within a week's time, or follow the recommended expiration date stamped on the package.  Now just so you understand,  Freshly isn't for everybody. But, if you travel a lot like I did, or you know well ahead you're going to be busy,  or simply just want something ready to eat when you get home from a long day at work but you want your food fresh not frozen,  this is the perfect option. I think they are also perfect gifts for friends and family.   One of the cool service Freshly provides is that you can choose when you want your meals ship. For example, when I knew in advanced that I will be home for two weeks during a certain month, I only had my weekly meals sent twice a month. Those two shipments provided almost two weeks of dinner, or a week if you have them for lunch and dinner.  You can opt out completely and put your meal orders on hold, or choose specific dates well in advanced when you would like Freshly to ship your fresh meals again. You have full control.  Looking back, my personal favorite which I don't think they have it on their menu now was their "Grilled Flat Iron Skirt Steak with Spinach." It was so tasty and tender. Their "Southwest Chicken Bowl" was another favorite of mine.  Super moist and tasted very fresh.  Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled flat iron steak
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious chicken
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moist and juicy chicken

e8Cs7E0VNCefjKwztVVJxA.text: As a college student this is a lifesaver for me! Because I'm so short on time, but I love to eat fresh and healthy foods I'm kinda addicted to meal boxes, and i usually eat those throughout the week. For my breakfast and lunch I do smoothie boxes, Trader Joe's salad kits or make my own salads or soups. Sometimes I do crock pot meals too. But every now and then I have those days where I'm on the verge of a mental breakdown, and  I just don't have the energy to make something fresh. That's when freshly steps in.   Honestly, I don't know what people are complaining about and saying they taste like TV dinners...but maybe, just maybe,  I've hacked the Freshly code, and have become the king Midas of frozen meals? You see, I season my food thoroughly before I cook it,  and I also don't use the microwave. I have a toaster oven with a pressure cooker setting on it. So, I take the food out of the container, plate it on foil paper, and place it in the toaster oven on a pressure cooker setting. With that being said, take these tips, and use them to level the food up. I'm telling you, everything I've had has been bomb from them using these methods! I've tried the meatballs with spaghetti squash, and also the buffalo chicken. They both gave me life, and left me satisfied without feeling gross. I'll be ordering from Freshly monthly, freezing my meals, and heating them up.

ZyzDLIYncQOyVyk7Xx3GgA.text: My boyfriend surprised me with weekly Freshly deliveries while he is gone on business for a little over a month, since he usually cooks for us (he's a keeper I know). I'm kind of a food snob so I worried these meals would be bland or just meh, but I have to say I have been pleasantly surprised! I've had around 5 of the meals so far and liked every single one. I like the app - you can easily select/switch out meals and also update the quantity for future orders. My only compliant is the lack of portion size options. I wish I could opt for some smaller ones (in the 300-450 calorie range) for weight-loss or even a Paleo or other healthy option. I realize they have some meals marked as being under 500 calories, but there's not a convenient way to sort or filter those meals. Other than that, I'm a Freshly fan and would recommend.

gH77OIFWn90IF7pEL4H4yw.text: I'm not sure why all the bad reviews. Overall, I've had a positive experience with the two shipments I received from them. I had the $40 off promo ($20 off 2 deliveries). The meals were good. Some can be a little bland, but hey this is a healthy meal delivery service and most of them are under 500 calories. The portions are great and I finish up my lunch or dinner feeling completely satisfied, unlike a lot of other prepared meals that are less than 500 calories. A lot of the noodle dishes are gluten free and there are also vegetarian and keto options. It IS a tad on the pricier side (about $10 on average per meal) $60 for six. It's not something I can really afford every week (it ends up being $240 a month if you order each week for 24 meals...and you still have to figure out the other 66 (assuming you eat 3 meals a day) for the month) I do like it better than say Blue Apron or Hello Fresh, because with these, you're saving a lot of time otherwise spent in the kitchen prepping and cooking. Another note I'll make is on the selection of dishes. They have a decent selection, but they don't often rotate out items except for one here and there, so that can get a bit tiresome and repetitive after a while.

6MZJAiHuQlU7bWX2ufBSdg.text: Second update (4months later):   There are still delivery issues. Once every month or two the meals don't arrive, or arrive a day early (when no one is home so they sit in the sun all day and are unusable). There is never any contact to warn of the problem. You just have to wait and see if they'll actually show up or not.   They always refund the money. In the past they would also credit the amount of my typical order. This made it (sort of) worth putting up with the hassle of being surprised with no meals when it's too late to plan anything else. Today's meals did not arrive and they are "so sorry" and say it's a "carrier issue" (pass the buck much?) and are only offering a credit of $20. It's starting to look like I'll need to find something more reliable.   [first] Update: the order was credited and I got an additional credit for my next order to be free. So... I placed a new order. Today it's supposed to arrive. I checked the tracking and it's not coming. Called them and they can see the order, don't know what happened, it never shipped, apologies apologies. Supposedly they're sending out a new one to be delivered tomorrow.   Three of my last 4 orders (12 meals each)... ghosted. Possibly the single least reliable company I've ever dealt with. It would almost be funny if it wasn't such a pain. It's not like I'm ordering a set of throw pillows and delays are no big deal. These are supposed to be my meals for the week! And they just ... don't arrive. No warning. No message saying not able to fulfill your order.   I keep looking around to see if I'm secretly being filmed for an episode of candid camera or "What would you do?" because it's so absurd.

LKrjzal5GyzEFWMWVJIakw.text: I've been ordering Freshly for about a year and a half now and I can still say I'm a fan.  6 dinners per week.  The food is consistently good, and though I'd like a bit more variety....there is still enough that I enjoy my meals.    I started Freshly at the same time that I decided to lose weight, it has helped tremendously by ensuring the portions were reasonable, filling and healthy.  It also provides a detailed description of ingredients and calories etc, which allows me to keep track of my intake on my fitness app. (I've lost 70 lbs).     It's not always been perfect, deliveries were delayed by weather, or a poor delivery driver failed to deliver, but in all cases, Freshly made it right.   They couldn't magically make the food appear, but they did make it right financially.  In the scheme of things, I've had about 75 plus deliveries, and probably 5 had issues....that's better than Amazon....lol    So here's my take, if you need good tasty filling meals at a reasonable price,  to save time, eat healthy, or just to try something new, this could be a good service for you.  One final thing, if you're single or even a couple and always using the excuse that cooking for one or two is a pain....this could be your answer.

dMRxKcsUPQ1qCQjpbj_NQg.text: I'm a single professional guy living in Manhattan and Freshly has been really great with my lifestyle. The food has been at least 4/5 stars, with some standouts like the peppercorn steak and the beef lime chili bowl. Yummy stuff! I do the 12 meal plan so this basically takes care of lunch and dinner most days. It's so much more economical than doing a ton of takeout or overbuying groceries. I especially recommend it for people who do meal prep because this gives you a bigger variety of food while also keeping portions under control. My recommendations are to make it easier to recycle the frozen gel packs and to look into cardboard/paper trays instead of plastic. I also have an almond allergy, so maybe more non tree nut options. And have you considered breakfast? Anyway, I plan on sticking with Freshly for a long time to come and recommend anyone reading this to give them a try. :)

nRP9MXwPhkIVjDt6K0iAmQ.text: I've been using Freshly out here in Maryland. Before Freshly, I used TerritoryFoods for about 8 months so I am able to compare the two (they are competitors). Saw nutritionist who mentioned to use Territory to help lose weight.  So I used them first. I think that Freshly has better tasting food than Territory, in my opinion. Website is neat and organized and I haven't had any problems with delivery. They have good support (online chat). I have expanded my orders for other members of my household so I am giving them more business now.  Areas for improvement:  1. Add more meal types (Territory consistently has about 4 times the number of meals types that Freshly has and was always adding new meals every week). Freshly meal types don't seem to change at all or much.  2. Consider adding a 'breakfast' style meal. All of the meals seem geared towards either lunch or dinner.  3. Consider adding different meal portions (say regular, large). Territory offers small, medium, large. Large allows a person to stay full easier. Large would be around 700 calories versus 450 calories.  4. Consider changing your cellphane-tight-wrap -- I often have difficulty getting this off - its quite messy normally. Territory packaging was better.  Overall, I think that Freshly is better than Territory (just by a little bit, considering the above.. however, Freshly has the potential to be way better than Territory if they address the above)

zhDIYDzvBxusN7UYVW5zow.text: After getting food delivery from apps and local restaurants for quite some time, I was looking for a healthier alternative without compromising time and convenience.  I just finished my first week of Freshly. Overall I'm satisfied.  Delivery: no issues. I do find the package very large and heavy but unfortunately this is needed until someone comes up with a better solution.  Serving size: Smaller than most restaurant dishes. The portion is fulfilling for me but definitely too small for my boyfriend. I would say it's around 70% of what you get from a restaurant.  Taste: Homey, less flavorful than most restaurant dishes and overall gear towards the American palate. Out of the six dishes I tried, one was not good at all but I'd be interested in reordering the other five. For an average person, some Freshly foods might be a little bland. But after eating restaurant foods for a long time, I actually enjoy foods that don't have lots of spice in them.  Price: I'm currently getting the introductory offer. Each meal comes down to $8. Without the introductory offer, it would be $10 per meal. I'll probably stick with them if the ongoing price is $8. At $10, I would be more diligent into researching other options.  Overall, I like the convenience and transparency regarding the ingredients and nutritional facts.

SYLYGDamvQ3g48MNPXTrUQ.text: Second Update: no more shipping issues! Thanks so much Freshly for rectifying the problem and for caring about your customers.   Update: freshly reached out to me and comped my next order due to the ongoing shipping issue. I'm happy to report that my next order arrived on time. Please let this continue.

0x_TzWIiHn2HG4C06ID4bw.text: I've subscribed to Freshly for about 3 months, and receive 6 meals weekly. The meals tend to favor American "home cooking" flavors. My top 4 are the: steak peppercorn, teriyaki salmon cakes, homestyle chicken, and Lebanese-style beef meatballs. I genuinely look forward to eating those dishes, and the rest are passably good (except the bibimbop, which was terrible). I primarily use them for work lunches, as they're pre-packaged and easy to grab on my way out the door. Every time I eat one in the lounge, coworkers comment on how good they smell and ask about them.   That being said, I'll probably end my subscription soon. Why? 1) Lack of variety. They don't switch up the menu very often, and already a lot of the meals are based around a chicken breast and green beans. 2) Delivery date. My deliveries arrive on Thursday evening, which isn't ideal when I want these to take to work. Like others have mentioned, the meals are packaged about 2 days before you receive them, so if I wait 'til the the following work week, they're getting kind of old. 3) Plastic containers. All of my cups, plates, and food storage containers are glass. I'm a bit squeamish about microwaving my food in plastic for 3+ mins.

5D7ovGupTjxyH61waytRRw.text: Pro: Meals are shipped and require no thought for eating healthy.   Con: packaging is all plastic; ingredients are "natural" but no indication of whether they are organic (which I'd expect at $10 per meal); some meals were more like an appetizer than an actual meal; and I would eat 3 of them between lunch, early dinner, and late dinner.   My experience: they couldn't get the first box to me on time so it was scrapped. I don't want to go all "first world problems," but I rely heavily on meal kits for my food throughout the week, and that left me with no meals mid-week.   The billing was confusing, and they charge you when it's ordered, not delivered (box 1 was ordered on 1/6 And didn't ship until 1/28). I purchased 4 boxes, and all had a different price. The first box was refunded since it took 4 days to deliver and they instructed to discard. Box 1 was 87.99 and then refunded. Box 2 was 69.52. Box 3 was 89.97 and box 4 was 100.19 for a total of 259.68.   They offered a $20 inconvenience for the hassle from the first week. The second week, an item was replaced so they gave a $10 credit.   On balance, the other criticisms here are fair. For the money, you could go to Chipotle and get a veggie bowl for $8 and that could feed you for two meals based on comparable Freshly serving sizes, and is more eco friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Box 1 refunded due to non delivery Box 2 was 69.52
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Box 4 was 100.19
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qBCe6WdYkm6DogyboYx7eg.text: I canceled after about 3-4 months of subscribing to 6 meals per week for $60 shipped. It got monotonous without enough variety and change, but it was pretty good while it lasted. Deliveries were, with one exception, on time and even that one they took care of with credit. Their customer service is quite good.  When I first signed up, the cardboard that wrapped around meals had some interesting reading inside but that went away. Then breakfast options went away too but I hadn't used them much as they seemed overpriced for $10.  Meals like Steak Peppercorn, Buffalo Chicken with Butternut Mac & Cheese, and Salmon Teriyaki Cakes were good. The petite green beans got old...aren't there some other sides? Also not enough seafood options.  In a business like this I think you've gotta rotate through upwards of 100 meals to keep it interesting or at least swap out sides or something!  Meals were pretty healthy and reasonably sized. All under about 600 calories and without wheat, preservatives, and bs like that.  At the end of the day, while it is a bit of a pain, if you're in *any* way competent at cooking, your own freshly prepared meals will taste better than this shipped long distances stuff.

2Q0Z7JpksDCubLf1XbTfvw.text: Have ordered two weeks of Freshly and so has my Fiance. We both travel for work - he is a pilot and I work in consulting. We are trying to cut back on our spending on the road and the amount of fast food consumed. Freshly works great for me, as I am only home on the weekends and have zero desire to meal prep, and would much rather enjoy my time off.   Sure I could make healthier options at home, sure I would use less plastic, and it might cost a little less. However, the time saved is worth it to me.   The options don't change too dramatically week to week, but there are enough options to keep a decent rotation going. The portions are small by most people's standards - however - they are what most people should be consuming! I like that I can sort by sugar, fat, carbs, and many other options to pick my meals. So far there haven't been any I didn't like. I will avoid the sausage based dishes because the one I had was slightly greasy, but it's sausage! That's to be expected, still tasted great.   Since we both travel, we freeze our meals and throw them in lunch bags we fly with. Tsa flags our bags due to the fact that it's hard to see through being frozen. However, we never have problems getting our food on the plane! In my bag, I can travel for 4 hours, leave the meals in my car for another 3 and the meals are still frozen.   This is a great option for people on the road! They really should market it to road warriors!

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Buffalo Chicken and loaded cauliflower mash

mYy6npG5g9lLGbenayxWaw.text: I placed my order January 1st to receive my first order February 2, 2019. February 1, 2019, I received a CONFIRMATION email stating my food had shipped and should arrive the next day. February 2nd comes and I receive a refund email from PayPal and then an email from Freshly stating:   Dear Yessenia,   As you know, we always cook each meal fresh and every box is made to order. Recently, we experienced an unexpected delay in cooking some meals and will be unable to deliver your order for this week. We are refunding you in full for this order - and, as a thank you for your patience and understanding, we have given you $30 off your next order.   We're so very sorry to be reporting this news to you! All of us here depend on our Freshly meals just like our customers do and we know how frustrating and inconvenient it is to expect to get your meals and then have to make a new plan. We always want to be able to make your life easier, and this time, we couldn't deliver on that.   Your refund may take up to five business days to register on your account, and the discount will automatically apply the next time you're charged.   We appreciate your patience and pledge to do better by you.   Sincerely,  The Freshly Team  What good is $30 off my next order if getting a discounted rate for my first-time use didn't work? I was excited to have healthy meals and figured I'd go with more of "an established brand" than a local supplier but I was let all the way down. I should've read the yelp reviewed before trusting Freshly. If you're a smart consumer checking reviews do yourself a favor and skip Freshly. This is disappointing as a first-time buyer.

5gFICHbkmqU7JcP85_KEZw.text: Tasty, but very small meals and very bad top plastic cover - can't easily peel it + overpriced :-(

s5pyAkdvj0xqdLTXYxwL7A.text: I'm going to update my review to 3 stars because the customer service is exceptional. I was contacted by Freshly after my initial review and they showed appreciation for my feedback. It seems Freshly truly values their customers and they welcome any feedback to improve.

QWdU9cWLzM0VAw0KZeoFAQ.text: Freshly is great for busy people who want to eat healthier. The portion sizes are huge for one person, but maybe it's just all my years of eating crappy food which makes me think "damn, I still have more vegetables to eat?" I've liked everything except the berry porridge, which had a weird texture for me. Choosing meals for the week is easy, ingredient lists are comprehensive so I can check for allergens, portions are good, and shipping is reliable. Although, OnTrac never tells me when the delivery arrives. For roughly $7 a meal, it's a great alternative for eating lunch out (which gets pricey in a downtown office)!

icT3p4xquitodnjdrLz1Pg.text: We've only had it for a week now with 6 meals. Both my wife and I have been very positively surprised I must say.  Over the years, we tried all kinds of home-meal delivery services, out of a desire to eat fresh and healthy food at home. Usually we gave up with the first shipment already when we realized how much work it is to actually prepare a meal. It's just not something that we enjoy after both of us spend the whole day at work, so normally we would just order something from Doordash or Postmastes. We basically never cook at home.  Freshly is a perfect addition to that. It's a lot cheaper than getting food from Doordash and in many cases also cheaper than getting takeout from other places that we love, like Tender Greens or Sweetgreen. Sure, it's not the same thing, but it also has the convenience that it's already in the fridge and only takes about 3-5 minutes for a decent quality meal.  I also like the packaging, which seems very environmentally friendly and the whole philosophy of using natural, high quality ingredients. Wish they would offer organic as an upgrade.  My only complaint is portion size. 400-500 calories is just not enough for a dinner. Eating two meals doesn't seem to be a good solution because then it's too much. The price is really low at about $10 per meal, especially if you consider the cost of packaging and shipping, but honestly, we would happily pay more and have 30-40% larger portions. It would be awesome if they had a way to let you choose portion size.  Overall, very happy so far. I think we might stick with this service.

0oBJ9p97nFvDstPC46sNlA.text: I'm here to set the record straight. I've been using Freshly for about 2 years and they're great. Before Freshly I was using Snap and here's how Freshly beats Snap.   Convenience: Freshly saves me about 10-15 hours every week. I don't have to cook for 2 hours a day, nor do I have to go to the grocery store. That equates to almost $100,000 a year in saved time when multiplied time saved by my hourly pay rate. Hands down, a no-brainer.   Taste/Food: I cook professionally, dine at high-end restaurants, I'm a foodie that only eats at the highest rated restaurants regardless of the price. Freshly's food is good. It's usually not highly seasoned, which is OK because I can season it.  The food lasts over 7 days in the fridge and I can freeze and reheat the meals all the time and the taste is consistent. Snap's meals don't last for more than 1-2 days.  Portions are about right. Not a lot of small portions - just right.   Delivery: When I started the service the delivery was on Thursday but I was able to change my delivery to Mondays starting the next week. The deliveries are always on time, intact, and still cold.   Menu: They have a good menu and change selection. Of course, more selection would be nice, but they change it around often enough to make it OK.  Customer Service: Support is great about doing everything they can to take care of their customers which is rare these days. GREAT customer service.   Price:  Unlike a lot Yelper's, I'm not broke and don't make references to prices specifically. Value perhaps, but not price. Freshly is cheap. I order 12 meals every week and I pay around $9 per meal.   CONS:  They need organic meals, more beef meals (I'm Blood Type O), fresh salads and snacks would be nice, more breakfast options,

7NbOSIaMeDXKgmct9NgEuQ.text: Great food if it ever actually gets to your house on time. I'd say 90% of the time my food is more than 24 hours late. Last week it was too arrive Wednesday by 9pm (weekly)...it didn't arrive until Friday night around 10pm. OnTrac, their delivery partner, is a joke. Last week they said it was a flat tire. It's Wednesday evening and of course my order is not here. I called OnTrac and this week it's a road closure...LMAO. It is insulting to be told these clearly bogus lies.   Ordering these meals is a huge convenience for me. I'm a busy person and loathe fast food. I live alone and don't like to cook. Freshly is a great solution for me. But when your food doesn't arrive you have to figure something else out. It's a major pain and super inconvenient!   So it a disappointment to have to write this review....I've given them a couple dozen chances and today I'll be cancelling my subscription...which I've had for a very long time.   You've been warned.. if you want your food to be truly 'fresh'...don't count on it as long as Freshly is using OnTrac...a total joke of a company...to deliver your very expensive meals.

f-DoPKq2c1kfHVlrdVyEVQ.text: I was eager to try Freshly after taking a look at all the other food delivery services.  Most of them required that you had two buy two portions each time, and I needed a single portion.  The menu items looked good so I decided to give it a try.  After two nights of trying the food, I cancelled.  The main problem with the food is that it wouldn't cook in the microwave.  I followed the directions carefully, and still the food was ice cold when I took it out.  I had to try reheating; by that time, everything was awful.  The pepper steak was tough and the vegetables bland.   I had to toss everything and go pick up something else for dinner from the store.  I didn't want to try another one of the dinners.  I had tried a chicken dish the evening before, and it was just okay.  I use the microwave every day, and there is no problem with its heating anything else.  I have no idea what I will do with the unused dinners.  The dogs may enjoy them as they're not very discriminating.  I wish this would have worked out and that I could give Freshly a positive review.  It looks to me as though they need to reconfigure cooking times.

FGzO11sLE7OpB_UqLW1m0w.text: Quite possibly the worst food I have ever eaten. The pasta was way over cooked, the so called steak looked like " mystery meat" and the chicken had no taste. I am not one of those people who likes to hear himself complain. This is the first time I ever gave such a bad review of anything. I've had frozen dinners from the supermarket that were better. I would avoid it!

4rAU32KwKhhomJMKvxC19Q.text: Customer service saw my review. They made an effort to show they valued me as a customer. I got my delivery on time this week.

gUcjQzqsI8W8CNfcu7B07A.text: As with many complaints, my very first order NEVER showed up even though they have it as delivered as of 12:15. When calling the company they never contacted delivery service to locate instead quickly refunded and cancelled subscription. Makes me wonder if they even shipped and how legit this company truly is. Extremely disappointed

FUdJl_gTGKCS8Ae1ZoG1tw.text: My wife and I became violently ill after consuming. After reading some of the reviews here it looks like we aren't the only ones. Very disappointed. We were customers for a couple of months but I'm not in to playing Russian roulette with my meals.

xxw48e8yjUQoRl3k6Yn_Bw.text: I was recently given a few of these meals from my sister and they tasted delicious!!! Easy, convenient and filling! However, I was disappointed to find out my Denver omelette was worse than having a Big Mac.    I think, personally, this would be great for one or two emergency meals a week.

C_AgVGD_kwh1JkulPFW-Rw.text: Basically a $10 microwave meal. Every time I eat one, I think "would I be happy if I paid $10 for this at a restaurant?". I've had 18 meals so far and by now I feel like I have to finish them so I don't waste money, but I would rather eat a bowl of Cheerios.

BP8qSJSu4q-uXeNLZXWhAw.text: Their motto is " Freshly is your personal chef-no shopping, chopping, or cleanup." That sounds great if we were to receive our meals when promised. We were new to Freshly and our very first order never arrived. We gave them the benefit of the doubt, and have been using them for a month now.  Out of the four orders that we placed, we recieved only two of them. After reading through the reviews, I am not sure how they are still in business. It seems like this is a common occurrence with them. We are waiting for the refund to post to our account, then we will be cancelling service with them. If you are looking for a meal delivery service, I highly suggest you look elsewhere.

94JWTcAbRKcZuh_P5JsgKw.text: Food's been solid all around and delivery on time. Good service for people who don't like to cook

pIaHWWwhzWfOSM4s5tFoOQ.text: I've been eating Freshly as my primary food source for about six months, now, and overall it works for me.  The Good: I'm very happy with the quality of the food. I'm healthier, and have lost over 35 pounds since starting Freshly. When properly prepared, the portions are a good size for me. I think the price is fair ($9/meal on the 12 meal plan) especially when you factor in the time you saved not having to shop, cook, or clean up. The convenience keeps me from eating junk, and it's been really good for my health. Also, customer service has always been friendly and quick to credit me (even when they couldn't help with delivery issues, for example).  Where Freshly could improve: I had delivery issues early on, and they were super inconvenient. Since late deliveries get trashed, you're stuck having to come up with last-minute food plans for the next week.  Variety: When you're eating two Freshly meals a day, six days a week, you need more variety than Freshly provides. There are a few things I don't get tired of (buffalo chicken, risotto, SW chicken bowl) but I really try not to get more than two of any meal per week, so sometimes I'm ordering things I don't love just because I'm so tired of eating the things I do love. No bueno. Also, FYI Freshly, I don't want to "hack" my meal for variety. Meal prep is your job; I don't want to have to think about it. Portions: Sometimes I get a meal that's freakishly small, or they forgot to put the chicken in, or something, and that's frustrating. But, this hasn't happened in a couple of months, so maybe their QA/QC has improved.   Overall, Freshly is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. No &#39;stew&#39; in my beef stew- There&#39;s no liquid at all :(
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Livorno- No tomatoes, but still good. A little bit salty for my taste.
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken tikka masala- Delicious!

Jm7WB9yf8A21vISY8ZxFfg.text: Shipments were ALWAYS a day+ late and the food isn't very good. Not really worth paying for.

OeXL0oVUDI7CXpLVH_JhfQ.text: I wanted to search a little online today and see if I was the only one who experienced, this past week, a missed delivery. Turns out this seems to be a fairly regular occurrence, sadly.   First, I want to say I have received about 4 weeks of Freshly meals without a hitch. Having tried a couple of other pre-made meal delivery plans (e.g. trifecta) I found Freshly's meal quality and consistency to be head and shoulders above the rest, so I stuck with it. The meat is moist/tender, unlike others such as Trifecta (very dried out and tough beef and chicken became a chore to eat). I don't understand why some are complaining about one dish or another in reviews however - You're never going to be enjoy absolutely everything on a menu as diverse as this so I'd recommend anyone using the service tries multiple configurations - e.g. After experimenting with some dishes, I have finally been able to settle on a selection that myself and my wife really like and look forward to each week (hence the disappointment I'll get to in a moment), including the Beef Chili, Chicken Livorno and Spaghetti squash.  However, here is my BIG issue with Freshly and what happened this past week has me reconsidering my loyalty to the brand because I'm not sure I can trust them. In my instance (which seems to be what others have experienced), there is a lot of miscommunication going on and no stepping up to offer proper solutions. Here's the story...   Last Thursday I got the usual notification to say "Good News, your meals have shipped and will be delivered tomorrow". So Friday I expected them to land, as they have done in the past. No sign by 3pm (unusual for Fedex in my area) so I checked the tracking info to see it was still stuck on "Label Created, Pending", even though I'd got the email saying it'd already shipped. They must have their system set up that those emails go out as soon as a label is created, which is a tad naive and a poor choice (I work in the online marketing industry so am a bit more in tune with what is possible in this regard and they have it set up in a risky way that leads to this very type of issue).   Anyway, I left it for Friday as the delivery window does say delivery may occur up until 8pm. No sign though and then around 10pm I received an email saying "Sorry there's been a delay but the good news is your meals will arrive tomorrow (Saturday) and will be as fresh as always". Great I thought, 1 day isn't too bad and they've kept me in the loop which is nice of them. Turns out that this second automated email was another pre-emptive strike which shows the lack of sophistication with their service and distribution center, which is very concerning. By Saturday the tracking info still had not updated so I contacted Freshly support. When they went away to investigate it turned out there had been some mysterious 'issue' which I still do not know what it was (and which the rep could not explain, but promised it had been 'escalated to a manager'). Well, I've yet to hear anything from said distribution manager either (I think they hope this issue is just dealt with).   Next the rep said "I've refunded the full order and attached a $10 credit to your next deliver". Um, What about my meals for this entire week? "Oh sorry, because we make everything fresh you're out of luck" (basic gist). You will receive your next week's meals as normal. Well, my major issue with this is, you promised me a service, you should be going out of your way to deliver, whether it's creating the meals, getting leftover units (e.g. surely they don't make every single meal to order?) or in some other way ensuring you deliver on your promise. To leave a customer hanging is totally unacceptable, especially considering your market - e.g. busy professionals who rely on you as a company.  And here is my biggest problem with the service I've received. Convenience, taste and nutrition are key (and Freshly ticks all of those boxes). However, reliability and Customer service is even more important to create long-term business relationships. If I cannot rely on a service given my hectic business schedule, it's very unlikely I will continue the relationship with the business. The lack of info and, worse yet, positive confirmations which turned out to be lies (e.g. "sorry we're delayed, but your item will be with you tomorrow") leave me with a very bad taste in my mouth (pardon the pun, especially as I have nothing to eat this week lol).

3NeW7fAKPvJkdoxn7vRaHw.text: I originally gave them one star, my food was delivered  a week and a day late, and I was refunded my money without an explanation. I still received the meals. They were nicely packed and very flavorful. I ordered 6 meals, one meal wasn't complete. But it's a good option if you cook somedays and eat Freshly other day. There aren't many vegetarian options.  But overall, I was pleased with the food and the customer service is top notch

BKjbdXx2PV2XdAj2FIR3yQ.text: We really enjoyed the food but had to cancel our subscription bc the delivery is very unreliable. In the 2 months we subscribed, our food didn't show up 3 times. Very disappointing!!

u9-Nw6a-sfl4dAs7UrdXgQ.text: Why would I want to take delivery of my work lunches at the end of the week? Customer service told me to freeze them? Only Thursday, Friday, Saturday delivery options? According to reviews, this seems to be a common complaint. Glad to hear the feedback is resonating with Freshly...

TpfnyC4zWURtBJOwLjscxw.text: My first trial order has finished not being started yet. People used to order such food for lunch, so they are at work as well as me. I ordered in my office, so had only provided Saturdays as delivery option. Last Saturday Fedex delivered it "somewhere", so I had no idea as my office was closed. After the call we had to close issue by refunding. So my opinion: - more flexible schedules should be available - closer work with delivery service, as currently no clear view of what's going on (delivery is a black box for me and Freshly), it's better to integrate delivery in web site - $10 is quite high price for such meal as Downtown SF (expensive place) provides fresh food for the same price, and it's cooked right there without any deliveries

F149NhI8--7eVukuNKXkOA.text: Just got our first trial order.  It came nicely packaged, and it is very Easy to prepare.  They come packaged like a TV dinner.  We tried the meatloaf dinner and the roasted turkey dinner.    Taste was OK, not great.  It doesn't taste like a homemade meal, but it's not terrible. So, for a busy working single or couple that really has no time, it's better than a frozen grocery store entree, but we will not order again...cancelled.

CGZnFZ_k9qEL08mlTCvuIQ.text: My daughter and son-in-law *raved* about Freshly and I decided to give it a try. It has been a godsend for them during her first pregnancy. (Yay I'm going to be a grandma soon!!) They definitely give it 5 stars. Got my first order today and had my first meal. It was surprisingly good for a microwave steak, and very tender. The portion seemed quite large and I couldn't finish my veggies, though they were good. (Green beans were a bit crunchy for my personal taste but still very good.) The packaging was great, the meals were still ice cold even on my hot porch, and it feels so good to have 5 more days of healthy meals in my fridge for $39.
