uzVXwsDygRXM8t8h0gPhJw.text: I tried Freshly through one of their promotions so I could easily take prepared meals to work. I should have known better.  I love to cook, but figured I'd give it a try out of convenience and easy variety. It arrived nicely packaged and the packaging can be reused or recycled.  But let's face it. It is a glorified TV dinner that tastes, just ok. And, no matter what, there is common flavor across the board that is part of prepared meals, I can't describe it except to say, it's that "prepared meal" taste.  My biggest issue is that the amount of sodium is high. 700 to 1040 mg.  In this day and age it is not difficult to make a simple, good, fresh meal in little time. Let's cook.

Ccf6faTA5CBA4fcbwshh-A.text: So I tried this and am very disappointed they don't have more options for pescatarians/vegetarians. My Fiance and I split a 12 meal plan. He picked 6 meals (which include chicken, beef, turkey, etc) and I chose meals with fish. We have been incredibly surprised by the flavor. Very happy for the most part. It is a subscription so make sure to log back in every Monday before 3pm PST so you don't get charged. This wasn't very visible to me but Freshly associate made it right. If I can offer one advice is have more variety because I would love to order from them on a consistent basis but I also can't be eating the same 4-6 meals every week. My Fiance who has more options loves it.

iLwT_76k610FxUqBki8GOg.text: So today would have been my third delivery. I say "would be", because after I received a notification 2 days ago telling me my meals had shipped, late last night I received another email telling me I would actually NOT be receiving any meals this week. So apparently, even though I received a tracking number, they actually had not shipped anything. Seems deceptive to me, and the response I got to my email expressing my confusion around this was a canned, "we take delivery issues very seriously..." type of response. NOT helpful. Additionally, I never received my first week's delivery either due to "shipping problems" (which I was not informed of until late Saturday afternoon, when it was no longer possible for me to go grocery shopping that day). So I've been a member for 3 weeks and have only gotten to try one week's worth of meals.   The meals are good, and convenient. A few of them are a bit too big for a single serving, in my opinion, but I can always split one meal into 2. But these delivery issues may cause me to find another service, because I can't suddenly make plans on Friday night for grocery shopping on Saturday. I want a meal service that is consistent and reliable, and so far, Freshly is not that service.   They get 3 stars for the quality of the food, not for the delivery service.

li79vaRkMIdPPcC1f4dhcg.text: The food is very tasty although it doesn't look like the pictures. The packaging is done really well and it's very convenient to bring to work for lunch. The downside is that it's quite expensive if you don't order 6 or more per week and it's too much food per week. I paused my subscription for this reason. I would recommend it if you had two people eating it. It makes counting calories easy as all the nutritional facts are on the back!

DRmdSp45Ky-arO68o62cRg.text: This was my first time trying any kind of meal delivery service.  I love that these are whole meals, not a bunch of ingredients that I still have to put together.  The meals are quite tasty.  I've been getting six meals a week for about six weeks now, and there's only two I wouldn't order again (although I still finished them.  They weren't inedible.  Those were the southwest chicken bowl and the steak peppercorn.)  They heat well and are surprisingly fresh tasting.  When they're delivered, I usually have five days (including the day of delivery) to eat them.  I order two vegetarian meals a week, and I've noticed they often have sooner expiration dates.  I'm guessing the vegetarian stuff isn't as popular which is a shame.  I wish they offered more vegetarian stuff.  Tofu and tempeh reheat so easily!    I was prompted to finally write a review because I had a problem for the first time with my last delivery.  The meal had passed it's "use by" date.  I used the in app chat feature to lodge my complaint, and they immediately issued a refund of twice the meal's value.  So super duper easy to resolve.  I wish all companies had an app like this.  So much easier than making phone calls or waiting for return emails.  In all, I'm very happy with this service.  Pros: The food comes on time, it's tasty, it lasts a reasonable amount of time, I think there's a lot of overall variety, reasonable portion sizes (more than frozen meal for sure though less than a restaurant entree) customer service is good, and I think the price is reasonable for what you get.  Cons: Few vegetarian options and lots of packaging which just gets trashed.  Of course this last point would be True of any food delivery service.

0G5ZZ0PJRqJPAiAuBLWB0A.text: I've been using Freshly for about 2 months now. For the most part is is a great value and the meals are really good with fresh organic ingredients. Unlike other meal services, the meals are already prepared and ready to eat. You just pop them in the oven or microwave.  I currently use the 4 meals per week plan at $49.99/week with free shipping. Only one meal was bad out out of the many I have eaten. Not bad at all. I will keep using Freshly, but hope they keep updating their meal plans with different dinners from time to time. All in all a great company with really good food and worth the cost per week. The best part is you can skip a week or two if you are out of town or if you just want a break.

2HbzIx7QqKLS0mSj05CxRg.text: Just tried Freshly for the first time. Salmon cakes over brown rice and spicy green beans. I cooked it in the microwave according to the instructions.   The salmon cakes were mushy. Just mushy.  The brown rice.  What brown rice?  and the green beans were still frozen.  Yuck.  I'm open to food delivery services and have tried many.  Freshly is frozen microwavable food.  It tastes like frozen microwavable food.  There's no way around it.  We're cancelling our subscription and going back to what suits my family - buying fresh food and cooking it at home.

y0X4MJSy5xziqu6FlFUA7Q.text: I kept seeing ads, read reviews & gave Freshly a try.  I really like their customer service, they seem fair & the site is easy to use.  I'm just on my second week of 6 meals a week & I'm a fan!   I was tired of my cooking & Freshly is a nice change.  Everything I ordered tasted great.  The steak peppercorn has been my favorite so far & the chicken Parmesan is really good.  I tried one breakfast which wasn't my favorite but that's personal preference.   With Freshly meals I'm getting more protein than my normal, which is good.  These meals are very filling & I noticed I am snacking less.   I heat them in the oven instead of microwave b/c I don't think things, especially meats, taste as good from the microwave.  The flavor of everything I have tried has been great & they taste fresh to me.  Definitely better than my cooking.

pzoChtbjPv9ZsKdmZwEIVg.text: Ordered a subscription as an on going Christmas gift for my elderly in-laws in mid-December and deliveries were to commence Mid-January.  Even with a month of lead-time, Freshly has only come through with food once out of four scheduled dates.  Worse still, after notifying me yesterday that the meals our family needs to provide for my out of state octogenarian Mother and Father-in-law had shipped, Freshly sent us an email this morning cancelling today's shipment. A 75% fail rate is unacceptable and I will be cancelling as soon I can line up another service.

umSLKTbXzLh2Zkqo4zNKuQ.text: I'm definitely a fan. When I know I'm going to have a busy week or I just don't want to cook for a while (it's not something I enjoy), I order 6 meals for the week.   Taste: The meals are good for what you're getting. And what are you getting? A pre-packaged meal. Yes, yes, they're made fresh and all that, but if you're trying to make them last the week, you'll have to freeze at least some of them. For that reason, it'll never taste like a meal that you had just cooked yourself piping hot or ordered in a restaurant. But don't be disappointed, this is definitely not lean cuisine*. I genuinely enjoyed the taste and flavor of some of the meals and those are the ones I order again. The portion size is also really good (unlike lean cuisine*) and I say that as a bigger girl who likes to eat a lot. Basically, for a pre-prepared non-restaurant meal that you didn't buy frozen from the grocery store, this is as good as it gets.   *Despite the shade, I usually have lean cuisine for lunch.   Convenience: I come home from a 10 hour work day, and I'm exhausted. I used every ounce of my will power not to stop by Taco Bell because I'm trying to pretend I'm better than that. I pop the freshly meal into the microwave for a few minutes and I don't bother to plate it because nobody loves washing the dishes. Done. It's that easy. The packaging IS annoying, though. So much for helping the earth...  Health: Look, it depends on what kind of person you are. If you're kind of a piece of crap (like me) who eats a lot of fast/fast casual food or makes huge bowls of pasta or potatoes at home, this is great. I'm always the worst at dinner and these meals are usually healthier than whatever I end up making. In fact, I use the meals on the lower end of the calorie count for weight loss. However, if you're actually a pretty healthy person, these aren't the best. Some of the meals have a lot of sodium and they could probably go a little easier on the carbs. But look at the menu for yourselves.   Price: It's okay, not great. I do the 6 meals a week plan for $60. It doesn't break the budget but there's no doubt it's cheaper to cook at home. But like.... the convenience, though.... If you take too long of a break between weeks, they send out $20 off coupon so that's pretty cool.  Overall, I recommend.

oMAcHLbc0LBMYXrJq4eYFg.text: This is a long one...  I know that a referral and a good review is the best way to thank someone in the customer service industry. I know how much a good review means, especially after being threatened at work by the same lady multiple times that I HAD to give her a refund for the mistake she ordered on her sandwich or she would just "write a terrible review" about us.  I'd heard about Freshly for months on Michael Rosenbaum's podcast, and when I finally landed a job that paid more money I was really excited to try it. Well, I tried it and I LOVE IT (I'm literally eating their "Thanksgiving Turkey with Quinoa Stuffing" as I write this. Okay, now to the part that compelled me to refer Freshly to you...  After work today, I realized my payment for this week's meals didn't go through. I checked my bank account. No wonder, rent drained it. I thought I'd made enough in tips today to pay it but it was a slow day and I was a few bucks short. So I got onto Freshly live chat to see if maybe I could push the delivery date back a few days or split the payment onto two cards (p.s. I know it sounds like this must be a giant payment but it was only $59. My rent is just a lot and I really didn't make great tips today.). Live chat responded immediately with a lovely human being ready to help. The best part was that this chat was totally unscripted unlike other live chats.  While we were trying to figure out options for how to make the delivery work for me this week, I explained how much I was enjoying Freshly: How much I love the food; how I love not having to cook or swing by McDonalds when I get home so late from work that it's the only thing open; how much I love not spending up to $100 a week on crap fast food and groceries that I'm not even eating; how much I love that the food isn't even frozen, I just have to keep it in my fridge and heat it up for a couple minutes in the microwave; how much I love that none of their food has gluten, and you can let them know your dietary preferences; etc, etc, etc.  We talked about how I was embarrassed that I couldn't afford it after rent and a bad day at work. The lady (who I found out later was also named Jamie!!!) was awesome! She said she felt like I was describing her life and not to be embarrassed about rent. After chatting about this stuff for a bit, she told me she had great news! She was able to get me an in-store credit for this week's food. Completely on the house, just because I loved Freshly so much and they want me to continue having the best experience possible with them. I pretty much cried with gratitude..  I want Freshly to know how much it meant to me that they cared enough about me as a customer to help me out this week. I want them to know how big of a difference it makes to my bank account by getting that in-store credit for the week. It was the best customer service experience of my life. Imagine a world where all companies rewarded your love of their product instead of giving you free stuff because they are afraid you'll leave a bad yelp review. THANK YOU, Jamie, and THANK YOU, Freshly for your incredible food, service, and genuine kindness and generosity.  Give em' a try guys! And DEFINITELY try the "Chicken Risotto" and the "Shrimp and Andouille Paella".  Update: Just finished licking the plate. It's that good.

_KObwYPaK-e1YOnuki2S5g.text: I hope I am going to be able to add stars eventually. I am getting concern because like other people my first order was cancelled. I didn't get any notification until I contacted them. Today was supposed to be my first delivery but as of 5:22pm it's not here. I did get an email stating that if I don't receive it today I should throw the meals away. Your delivery service is not reliable. At this point I don't know if I will ever get to try it. Disappointing!

LSZwDPE7vJ7YkWDTI_GOGA.text: Kinda hooked on this stuff. I know it's not the cheapest without the discount codes, but it fits my lifestyle so well. I won't waste food, don't have time to cook, and track my nutrient intake. Freshly is a great option for someone like me, and the food has been so much better than I expected.   The meats have been cooked very carefully, and I was actually pretty blown away by the pork chop. I also loved the beef lasagna, bbq pulled pork (the squash cakes on the side are fantastic), chilis, and cod cakes. I froze some of the meals before eating and didn't notice any change in quality. At this point I've tried 24 different meals and there are only a few I wouldn't order again (not a huge fan of the egg or sausage dishes). I also completely forget that it's a gluten-free menu.   At one point I had some confusion with discount codes but the customer service team was very responsive, pleasant, and helpful.  It's hard trying to sound like a genuine advocate and not just a referral pusher but Freshly has truly been a game changer for me.

11peC4h1rnKIFAC4ZHEl4g.text: I got snagged by the Facebook promo '6 meals for $30', figured I'd try it out - worse case I would be out $30.  I'd probably recover.   Placed my 6 meal order, paid, etc.  I knew this was one of those automatic subscription sites, so I immediately went to cancel the subscription (so I'd just get the 6 meals and see if they were any good).  Turns out, you can't just immediately unsubscribe, you have to wait until the first delivery. If you cancel immediately , it cancels your first order and refunds your money.    As their support explained, it would be best to 'skip the upcoming weeks', then cancel. So they're betting that people will forget and let the deliveries continue. Really annoying. But it probably makes them money, at least in the short term.  So onto the food - And that's actually the bright spot here - almost everything I had was pretty good. However, I wish there was a 'less paleo' option, because mashed cauliflower is not a substitute for mashed potatoes, and 'veggie pasta' is not a substitute for pasta.  Not everyone is on a paleo/keto kick...I workout so I can eat decent food, and mashed cauliflower is terrible, I don't care what you put on it.   So, because of the forced paleo options and partially because of the price, I ended up canceling. The annoying 'gotcha' subscription model aside, this program would be good for someone who is watching their carbs. Just not me.  Three stars instead of two because the stuff I could eat was good.

jsLcyAUqTL_UMKf2WtfeaA.text: My overall experience dealing with Freshly is 4 stars. Signing up and choosing my initial meals was quite easy. The steak peppercorn meal was definitely our favorite. For our second delivery, we missed the selection time but was accommodated on changing our order later that night without hassle or questions. Deliveries were never later than Monday night as promised to us.   The only real issues we had with the meals was that we were never completely satisfied with an entire meal. My wife and I would like one part of the meal but then we wouldn't eat the other.   I'd say overall, if you aren't a terribly picky eater, this is a great option for people who do not like to cook or don't have time.   We canceled with ZERO HASSLE from our online chat rep. They refunded and canceled our upcoming order with a smile. Other food delivery services would have fought you tooth and nail and continued to send deliveries and charging your card until you threatened to sue them.   Customer Service: 5+ Stars Food: 3.5 Stars Freshness: 4 Stars

_3ysOh7Mg2_rrwEO0N3h4g.text: Freshly looked delicious, and the UI of the site is very easy to navigate. I placed an order several weeks ago as I planned on testing multiple meal delivery services with my family (part of a more free time, eat healthier New Year's Resolution). The first week was scheduled to arrive today, but instead I received an email stating: "...we experienced an unexpected delay in cooking some meals and will be unable to deliver your order for this week."  While I understand that businesses do experience an occasional issue with their supply chain, it seems to me they would have known prior to the day the food was to arrive that it was not coming.   It's very disappointing that Freshly elected to inform me the day of, especially as it is now Monday and I generally am not able to do the shopping during the week because of my work schedule.    I won't be giving them another chance as my first (and only) experience with them was so disappointing.

5t8WoA9DZg386lGkmQ3SMg.text: Don't waste your time with this service. They don't have a business model that will bother to actually get any food to you. They don't have service in my area and then customer service claimed that they do have service in my area but they just don't for new customers. I tried to point out that that is the definition of not having service in my area, which is the 8th largest city in the US by the way so I am not just some angry person in the middle of nowhere, but they claim that they do service my area, just they don't. Their double talk was beyond frustrating. Go to Home Chef or Hello Fresh if you actually want good food delivered.

Y3Yc4ac05VrhE47VXBnBjg.text: I ordered these meals in December 2018. The delivery date was supposed to be January 8th. I got an email saying the delivery would actually be January 12th. On January 10th, I received an email saying that they got overwhelmed with orders and my order was cancelled. On January 11th, I get another email saying that my meals were indeed on the way and to not worry about their freshness as they are prepped for 2-days of transit. Well I waited up till 8pm for a delivery that never arrived. The following Tuesday, I decided to check my credit card to ensure I was not charged. Well to my surprise I was billed for the meals. I contacted them immediately and was given a full refund. I was also promised that next order of meals would be at their cost. To be honest, I'm not sure I even want to be bothered.

UbEGymkJwXeg7NIgJuxk3w.text: The food was fine. I got one week's worth of meals and fully intended to stay a member.   The next three deliveries didn't happen.  I got a nonsensical email with a nonsensical apology the first two times. The third time the tracker pretty much said the label had been created and...that was it.  I unsubscribed. I consider "no meal" to be a pretty disappointing meal.

h7KWWTZVavSQ1XqSD40_zA.text: Decided to give this a try. The food is terrible. You can get more nutrition out of a hungry man TV dinner. Calorie count is super low and not enough to keep you alive as a Male. If you decide to cancel make sure that you accidentally don't click skip a week. Now I am forced to eat another week of this. Wayyyy overpriced.

vkyqWFKc5-TZlUS8PJYX3Q.text: Great idea for a meal delivery service. The con to these meals vs ones you prepare yourself is that there's no transparency on how they're made. This was great postpartum because who has the energy to cook? However, I noticed black specks in one of the dishes like it was from the coating of the skillet they used to prepared it. I picked through it and made a mental note of it and still ordered more. Last night, however, after consuming the baked vegetable penne dish, I got violently ill and have not been able to keep anything down all day. I called and reported this and all they've done is refund the meal. I'm too sick and weak to go to work and they also can't provide me with any information on health inspections or tell me whether or not they will be following up with me once this is investigated. If you order proceed with caution.  In response to the comment below, I now have a fever. I am a working new mom who doesn't have time to be ill! On top of that I'm nursing. Refunding my meals is NOTHING compared to taking sick days and endangering my child's health! As a former Food and Beverage Manager, I want to see something IN WRITING (not produced by your company) that speaks to the cleanliness of where the food is prepared. A comment made by you on Yelp in response to a bad review is not sufficient.

H0n9gDGRKwwMeGSfHPc4GA.text: Late delivery again and this time extremely rude customer service rep who hung up on me. Cancelled our membership and will spend our $4,680 a year elsewhere.

H9RMQNEHabcsdtAjvcRHKA.text: How does Freshly possibly have a 3 star rating?!   Honest to God, Freshly has changed my life. I'm a busy professional with a family, which means I workout at 4:30a, work 11hrs, then spend remaining time with my wife and kids before bed; little time for anything else. Now I can have an amazingly fresh and healthy meal first thing in the morning, and then another great meal at lunch, all with no effort on my part? That's a game changer.  No stopping work to run and get take-out. No late nights out grocery shopping or meal prepping. Seriously, it's improved every other facet of my life by freeing up precious time while also ensuring my nutrition is healthy. Oh, and they taste terrific, just a small bonus right there :)  But seriously, it's worth every penny. They honestly taste amazing, they show up on time, and they haven't made a mistake in over a year of having them. Plus, they keep things fresh (heh;) by constantly changing up the menu. I guess you could say I'm a True believer!

u41cSq8iksZLTva5xBbbUA.text: While I like the food and it is great if you have Celiac disease, the shipping services they use in Northern California are terrible. They get a 1-star review on YELP, why on Earth would you ever use them to deliver food is beyond me. My only conclusion is that they are probably dirt cheap, but like the old sang goes, you get what you pay for and in this case, you get pissed off customers, spoiled food, missed or late deliveries, and bad Yelp Reviews.  The food rarely arrives on the day it is supposed to arrive per the commitment between Freshly and the delivery service as stated on the website of the delivery company when looking at the tracking information.   We originally used Freshly last year, but decided to cancel since our food never came when it was supposed. There are a number of occasions when the food arrived so late that it was warm. Instead, of making sure that the deliveries actually arrive on time for their customers, I'm the one who has to contact the 3rd party delivery service to see where the meals are, how they have "magically" gone missing, how they are on some truck and will not make the delivery window etc.   Whenever we contact Freshly about our deliveries, we just get the run around. Seriously?! I'm paying close to $100 a week and now I have to be responsible for your shipping inadequacies in addition to doing my normal day job. We decided to give Freshly another chance this year, but the same issues are starting to creep up again and this situation isn't unique to just us. Our friend also experiences the same issues and had to change his delivery day because his food never arrived on time thus most of the food was spoiled. So now, we have changed our delivery day and I truly hope this works out because this is a great service, but if we continue to experience the same delivery issues over and over again and   I'm constantly calling On Trac to find out what happened to our food which then is spoiled by the time it reaches us or never reaches us, then we are just going to cancel again. We base our weekly meal plans around the delivery, so if no food arrives or if it arrives spoiled then we have to make alternative arrangements at the last minute, which is not easy if one of those people has severe Celiac Disease. Get your delivery services together for the love of G-D.

_ROdAE-ikP-ISWD6l8bx-g.text: I rarely write reviews, but when I do, it's for a very good or very bad reason. I am sitting here at my dining room table writing this review as I'm eating my meal (teriyaki salmon cakes), because I am totally loving Freshly!!  My husband travels a ton, leaving me with two kids, two dogs, home renovation projects, and a demanding full time career. My plate is always overflowing, but my dinner plate has been empty... or at least underwhelming and boring.  I am on my third week of Freshly, and I can't imagine life without it! The app is easy to navigate, the deliveries are packaged beautifully, and the food has been amazing! The price is reasonable for the quality of food and service.  Freshly, please don't change! Thank you for making this busy mama's evenings more simple and delicious, leaving me time to tend to all of the dependent and demanding creatures in my family.

CEfaOL7n_sc0c0o-Sc1htw.text: I have tried a couple different meal delivery services. Freshly is by far my favorite! They have so many meals to choose from, which I love because I get bored of eating the same thing every day like with standard meal prepping. All their meals are AMAZING! I honestly haven't found one I don't like. I'm not very picky, but still. That is huge!   They are a great deal! I get the 9 meal plan so I have lunch and dinner for the week (while my kitchen is under construction). These meals are only $10 a piece! Which is VERY cheap for meal delivery! That's the same as going out or somewhere fast! This is the cheapest delivery I have found with so many options and such good quality.  Ordering and reordering is super easy! Their app makes it simple and reminds you to finalize your meal selections. Also, the app connects to my health app on my iPhone so all the nutritional info is tracked for me!  Their customer service team is the best! I changed the day I wanted my meals to be delivered on and this caused some sort of glitch to happen where I was receiving twice the amount of meals in one week. I couldn't figure out how to cancel one delivery because I was nervous it would cancel both since it was obviously a mistake. So I contacted customer service. They were able to cancel one of the orders (even though it was past the cancel deadline) and they credited me $80 towards my next order! I was shocked! It was so unexpected but a very nice gesture that actually made me write this review.   So definitely go with this service if you're considering one! I am VERY happy ever since I found Freshly!

IByWgndCnAzpu2l5Al3jlw.text: Where do I start? First, their delivery system is bush league.  I was notified after my delivery was supposed to be delivered that it was not coming. They have had this issue before. The food is hit or miss. Don't order any thing with roasted potatoes. They taste like glue. Don't order fish because it will be fishy. Last note, these guys are not professionals and will leave you out in the cold. I tried to find out where my order was today and if I wouldn't have gone on to their website to track the order I would still be sitting here waiting for it. They canceled my order with no notice! They did not email me that my order was canceled. But now I have to figure out what I'm doing for dinner tonight. No only tonight but the rest of the week.   When you enter an agreement with a company there is an expectation of being respected and treated fairly. This is not the case with Freshly.   Thanks for nothing Freshly. My wish for you company is that it fails. You are way ahead of me on that one. Good luck going down in flames. My advice is to not use this company. They will fail you as they did me.

i8Ua8ktUWk-oPpg7G5_obw.text: The food is decent.  The delivery and customer service are terrible.   Often meals are not on time.  Often give you not what you ordered but  "substitute" meals because "they ran out."  They used to provide both good delivery and good service.  It appears now they have too many orders to properly manage.  Customer service is terrrible:  Was talking to a "Kameron' who offered no help nor an explanation as to why 6 of my 12-meal order was "replaced."   Further, when I asked "Kameron" to let me speak to his supervisor, he flat out refused.   Later that day, I made a separate customer service call and I spoke to a superviosr, Yves, who noted that Kameron's refusal was inappropriate, but refused to do anything about it other than "look into it."  And refused to say whether or not Kameron would be corrected.  If they delivered as promised or had decent customer service, I would recommend them.   As they are now, no way.  Order from another firm.

Y1KJhYchGkI8J6v07DNXIA.text: Freshly is a great service for busy people looking to eat healthy without spending time to prep. I have been using them for several months now. I have only had one delivery mistake which they rectified immediately by giving me $20 off my next order. The food tastes as good as expected for a meal delivery service. I think the reviews that are saying the food is subpar are people with unrealistic expectations. Food you reheat in the microwave will never taste like a 5 star restaurant or good home cooked meal no matter where you get it from. Overall they are reliable, convenient, use pretty good ingredients although some room for improvement, especially where sodium and lower carb options are concerned, and their packaging is pretty eco friendly considering. I am going to be trying another company because I am looking for more lower carb and dairy free options, but I have been overall pleased with Freshly and would try them again.

iahXk7HH6FVgN0oArA_pWw.text: incapable to deliver on date established, first order never arrived, second order was suppose to arrive today, follow tracking it says arriving late on Monday, unacceptable.  I am rating the delivery service and customer service as deplorable, can not rate food since I never tried it

z9vNo7_vwJJyj0XqkIpG6g.text: I subscribed to Freshly because of a hip replacement surgery and I could not shop or cook. Two orders were lost/late out of the 4 weeks that I ordered. Even though the food is good, it's not worth it if you don't receive or can't use the order. I have canceled.

aa8p8YFAXrTVz0E1-NnojQ.text: If I could give them 0 stars I would. Ordered food was promised delivery on a Saturday. Food never arrived, was told it would arrive on Sunday. Again no food arrived and was told it would arrive on Monday. Again no food arrived and when I reached out to Customer support I was told the food couldn't be safely sent to me and I was offered a $20 credit.

mxw3EXppxErNsbHORHzHpg.text: After reading the Yelp reviews, I hesitantly placed my first order.  Sure enough - I received an email saying it was shipped and 18 hours later an email saying it couldn't be fulfilled (and offering a $20 credit).  Very disappointing for a first time customer.  I've never experienced problems with HelloFresh, Daily Harvest, etc.  You'd think they'd especially invest in their new customers, but... nope.  Major bummer and last minute shopping needed now.  #worklifefail  Update:  Freshly social media contacted me promptly after my above review.  Professional, apologetic, and offered to make it right. I decided to give it a second attempt. A few days ago I received the "your order is on the way" confirmation. Alas, this morning I received the "We're so sorry we can't deliver this week" and another offer for a $20 discount on a future order.  Two weeks, two fails, poor coordination of communications (exception being social media).  Awful.

SAXMMDqB_T0roOQlrcazuA.text: I just wanted to try it a second time since they offered a good deal. I unsubscribed to everything after I got my meals. But still got charged the week after for meals I didnt want.

x7PDg5iQQikWsNKp0XUdBg.text: I am very disappointed with these meals and feel like it doesn't live up at all to its hype. I've tried quite a few meal subscription plans and opted to try Freshly to save time without suffering the quality of taste... but found that the food was super bland and comparable to cafeteria food. For example, we tried the Steak Peppercorn with "Sauteed" Carrots and Green Beans... and the steak came out dry and well-done, while the veggies tasted like it came out of a can (very soggy in texture and no salt, pepper or flavoring at all).   I had high hopes for Freshly and don't believe it's worth the price. The so-called "chef-cooked" meals are just glorified TV dinners.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dViuJo6iFUr_VGRBhata3g.text: Solid three stars from me. I tried Freshly because if their promotion for $40 for 6 meals. I got the pork carnitas, shrimp scampi, and beef stew.  The best of the three was definitely pork carnitas. It was filling and had great flavor. The shrimp scampi had too much liquid, although the flavor wasn't bad. The beef stew had no liquid...so not really a "stew."  The main issue I have was that I only had 3 days to eat the 6 items before it expired. So for those who say they got about a week expiration date, they probably get deliveries on Wednesdays (I had mine delivered on Friday).  I'm not going to be continuing this subscription. The full price is not worth it for me. I can see how this service can be useful to some, especially for the convenience...just can't imagine myself microwaving my meals on a consistent basis (I do love to cook).

ODGQYoxM7LtjDLhUDLglVg.text: Despite all the reviews stating that orders never arrived, I signed up with freshly. Was supposed to get my first delivery today and this evening received an email that delivery has been delayed. Not a good first sign. I'll update review when and if I get my first order.

-if8nB5Ogu-8OoO0tswL0w.text: I love Freshly and order it on the weeks that I know I won't have time to shop, prep, cook, clean up dinner, etc. I skip the weeks I don't need them. They have a good amount of variety and I love most of their dishes. If you are gluten free or Paleo and don't want to think too much about cooking your own food, this is a great service to use.

8YCgsaxrStynh1NBpi3P3g.text: I got the 6 meals for $39 mailer so we decided to give them a try.  With 2 picky teens the meals were a little too "fancy".  The BBQ pulled pork tasted weird, like cinnamon?  Squash Cakes were not appreciated.  Chicken Parm was pretty good.  Beef Lasagna wasn't bad, but needed to "hide" the vegetables better, also needs more cheese and overall flavor.    When looking for the next weeks meals to choose I was distressed that nothing had changed from the week before.  We had picked pretty much the only 6 meals that sounded ok, and now we knew 2 were eh.    I appreciate they are trying to be healthy.  I think the convenience is good, but I would hate to have to freeze them to make them last the week.

e0LWZhM4-Rxj_cCIb5YXjA.text: I've probably placed about 5 orders now and sadly I think I'm done. I was singing this company's praises for awhile. Convenience, definitely better quality than a typical TV dinner, and decent enough variety.   However, the ordering became cumbersome, I couldn't always eat the meals by the expiration dates 4 days after delivery of 6 meals, and after becoming sick for the third time, I know I can point it directly to this food. Once I got hit with an allergic reaction just an hour after consuming a meal, and twice they sent me running to the bathroom just a few minutes after eating. There is nothing in the ingredients list that should make my stomach upset, and I don't have any known food allergies, so I'm unsure what would trigger any type of reaction, but for $60/week, I can buy something else pretty easy to whip up at home that I know won't make me feel terrible.   I wanted to like the system, but each time I got ill, it was from a different type of meal, and it was also the only thing I ate that day. I'm sure of the cause, but I also can't attribute it to one specific food item. So unfortunately, good idea in theory, I just can't play the guessing game.

AYjTS3XRYXfe9UmaKY-BWg.text: I can't give any more stars then one star because the food doesn't really taste good. I am not sure how they made food taste so bland, I mean I cook with the same ingredients and certain things like butternut squash actually has a taste, theirs had no taste...  this mystifies me. Everything aside, this is food, no matter how convenient it is, if it doesn't taste good then what is the point? Ingredients are mostly pre-made quality like buying a huge bag of Tyson frozen pre-cooked chicken breast complete with fake grill marks. Is it edible, yes, but when a lean cuisine tastes better at 1/3 the cost (though amount of food is smaller in lean cuisine) then I don't see the benefit of a meal that costs about the same (when full price) or more then most take out meals and the take out meal tastes good.

Q13dZKoiA2Zv_Sjoxu3ofw.text: Love the convenience.  This is so much better than meal prepping. I thought the food was great. Added a little salt, pepper, and garlic but that's just my taste.  Haven't tried any breakfast options. I've been freezing a lot of my meals so they don't go bad. Overall I am very pleased with freshly and highly recommend it.  I've already got another $40 off for my friend signing up.  Also I think that it's a very good price.

GoOHcyTk9XdzteHH-u0UVg.text: My first meal order was delivered this morning! So I just ate a BLT omelette from freshly. The smell of it cooking in the microwave was mouthwatering and the  taste eating it was heavenly delicious! I can't wait to try dinner! So far I am extremely satisfied! It was chock-full of goodness! I could never make one like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beef Provencal with polenta and roasted vegetables. So delicious!
Photo of Freshly - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BLT Omelette

0KxtepyxBp5z1Fpweocc2g.text: WONDERFUL tasting food, well-prepared, arrived well packed and still ice cold ready for the refrigerator and freezer. The food for my taste is spiced perfectly and it is very easy to add spices if you want more salt, pepper, hot sauce, etc.   PEOPLE, PAY ATTENTION and READ what you sign up for, YES, it's a meal plan (subscription service), and you will be billed in advance for the next week's food.  I'm only using it for ONCE a month delivery for 6 meals and I'm freezing several like the pasta dishes because they freeze and thaw easily. You are notified by email BEFORE the week's food ships to ask you to SELECT your food/menu items and on that page you can SKIP weeks (up to 3 weeks at a time) so you won't receive any food until you're ready. Give it a try and I'm sure glad I did as it is an easy way to lose weight by eliminating the bad carbs since it is mostly a Paleo based menu.

aN17t6nEgKFVeJUxeOyStQ.text: Great food for meal delivery. Everything is tasty and their carbon print is low. Love that you can recycle everything.

YMnHLZnLgnGNHD1haJu2DQ.text: These Freshsly meals are so clutch! No preservatives and delicious. I had this steak peppercorn, mashed potatoes, carrots, and green beans for less than $8. I've paid $50+ for a similar meal. Use promo code EAT639 and we for yourself- $20 off.

sXVHbi2_1jjlsWmj1xUyjw.text: Horrible cancellation policy, allow you to skip weeks just so that you will forget , refuse to give money back , food is not that good Wouldn't recommend

VHKg2ya2hKKfwijovQcuyA.text: I tried the promotion for my first order. It was great and convenient and quick. I was really busy the week I got these so it was perfect, it saved a lot of time.   However, I will probably unsubscribe because 10 dollars for a microwave meal is too much. If it was 7 bucks I would stay probably all year.

yvpEEL3DCy2dJsTSyBWDIQ.text: I found a coupon online and tried out their service about two years ago I think. I liked the simplicity of FRESH food without having to cook it myself. I love to cook but I get busy and fast food is so unhealthy all the time so I wanted to try something different. These dishes are delicious and easy to prepare and I take them to work for lunch and use them for dinners. I wish they would let us choose the main course and sides as I loved their meatloaf meal until they substituted the mashed potatoes for cauliflower. Please give us more options and the freedom to assemble the meat and sides. I usually order every few months and it is easy to skip weeks at a time or you can simply cancel your orders altogether. If the delivery has a problem the staff is very responsive to emails and they make it right.

2mdfhOKIIkRExSxDUDRj9w.text: Overpriced TV dinners is right, I can eat out in my city for the price of this microwave special. Its amazing to me that they only cost $10 with the excessive amount of packaging that these come in. Sure, understand that the meals have to be delivered like that to stay "Fresh" but if thats what it requires then I cant consciously continue to buy this. When there is such an huge amount of trash that goes along with making my life easier it doesnt help me feel good about these meals.

2ODNgv4CDXxC0zrdomQb3Q.text: I had an experience with Freshly that was a bit frustrating in the moment, they were able to right the situation and I no longer have those frustrations. Appreciate the customer support.

tWv7GuIvD642Og_uOuOmPQ.text: The food is really good and packaged well. The delivery box is packaged well too. I have enjoyed every meal I have had so far (3 of them). The reason for the low rating is due to the their portions. I have to eat 1 1/2 to 2 meals per sitting to get full. That works out to roughly $18 - $24 dollars a sitting if you go with the 4 meal a week plan. Its unfortunate because I like the meals, but not worth it at that cost. I will be canceling after my two week discounted trial period since I doubt they will change their portions in that time.

llxVTDs_dYwAgalJ_RiWXA.text: Out of the nearly two dozen meals my husband and I tried from Freshly we found two or three acceptable and worth re-ordering. The rest were mediocre or unpleasant tasting or had strange components or fillers. Quinoa and mashed cauliflower seemed to take the place of, or supplement, nearly any of the usual starches....grains or potatoes, unacceptable substitutes for us.  Sadly their chili and the bolognese sauce for penne tasted almost identical - tomato and ground beef with carrots and celery. I mean, carrots in chili?  Oddly the best tasting meal I had was one sent to us by mistake - an omelet, for which customer service removed the charge. I had refused to order the breakfast items because $10 is outrageous to pay for a small helping of oatmeal or a 2 egg omelet with a few veggies.

1JIi2idxxV-J8K1F-Tze_g.text: I have been using Freshly since the beginning of 2018. I have lost over 15 pounds in just over a month. I receive 9 meals from Freshly weekly and while their have been a couple meals that are so so, all the others have been great and filling. My weekly faves are the meatloaf, sausage and peppers, and steak peppercorn.

KIDqs2L6YZHbWyzwThJHiQ.text: I thought this would be similar to Hello Fresh and Blue Apron where they send you the ingredients and you cook it. I do not know how I missed that, but these are prepackaged frozen meals that you heat up in the microwave. The quality is equivalent to any other frozen meal (maybe on the higher end of frozen meals?) but still, pretty bland and left much to be desired....I cancelled my subscription immediately.

_dftoCwbbmUkpTss0JA6sw.text: PROS:  Extremely convenient; no shopping; delivered right to your door; no prep time/just heat and eat.  CONS:  Meals are not always tasty; limited variety that becomes monotonous week after week; only a small step above the frozen TV dinners you get from a grocery store.  With a name like "Freshly" you get the image in your head of freshly made meals delivered right to your door.  However, these are still frozen dinners that you have to microwave, which is not my idea of fresh food.  Some of the meals are great, but not all.  After only 2 weeks, I realized this was just not for me and that I'd much prefer truly fresh (and not frozen) meals that were cooked (and not microwaved).    If you live a busy lifestyle with no time to make your own food, this might be a great option for you.  Or, you can go to the grocery store and buy (almost) the same frozen dinners at half the cost.  Otherwise, you can simply cook your own food to assure it's healthy, fresh, and delicious.

OMRCT3Hy-5TifkTm1GJTPg.text: Just cancelled my order after trying it out for a couple of weeks. I thought it might be a good option for my family since one kid is vegetarian and the rest of us are not so it would allow us to order specific meals for each family member instead of cooking one meal for the family but all of the food we tried ended up being bland and mushy.  Not only was the taste bland but the texture of the food and the look of it too.  Not impressed.  We will go back to Home Chef and take the time to cook our meals in order to get food that taste good and looks appealing.

-qXMLgsBjfm7uq20Dv9rhQ.text: Every meal I have had has been excellent.  Whoever says they are like tv dinners are crazy.  Quality food.  Have had my subscription for a month and love it.  Favorites are the peppercorn steak, chicken with rice pilaf, and homestyle meatloaf.  Portions are perfect.

Z-BpF2jXcKuVctpXFrb21Q.text: UPDATE. Freshly since has accommodated to my needs so I figure my review does need an update they promised they are working to fix the issues with the soggy water meals I have recently reviewed. They also have put value in their customers and I am i impressed with the customer service. Hopefully in the future when the product improves I will try freshly again to see what they have to offer.

JbP0XqQoaguwMKXiKzzJ_Q.text: Love this meal service. I've tried several in the past and this really suits my needs. Can't believe these can taste so good from the microwave. Delivers with taste, nutrition as well as portion control. And you seriously can not beat the convenience. Yah, I've read reviews complaining about the price tag but 12 meals with free shipping that you don't have to cook or mess with for $107? Come on guys, you pay for the luxury of not having to order food or meal prep and go to the grocery store. My job is demanding and some days I don't even get but maybe a few minutes to eat. This service is wonderful. The only thing that I think would make it better is if the menu would change a bit more or had a larger expansion of choices. I don't really mess with the breakfasts as I find they are a bit bland. Also love the suggestions on the sleeves for those who appreciate a bit more spice or flare to the dish.

xIxdwxq745F0MxE8YdThjQ.text: I have tried multiple prepared meal delivery services and so far Freshly is my favorite. The meals are delicious, made with fresh ingredients, and well packaged. I have no idea what some of these other peoples expectations could have been at around $10 a meal made fresh delivered to your door. Some of the meals could use a little salt and pepper is my greatest critique. All of their packing material is recyclable with recycling or reuse instructions printed on them. I am even saving the denim insulation packages to insulate my garage!!

_GLFbgvkskmFlEVm_2STpA.text: Food is good if a little overpriced but they use Fed-Ex for delivery and will not consider using another delivery service that does not support the NRA.

dMuIUO21xM6NOYy0CBLjFw.text: If I could give them negative stars I certainly would!  I was so excited to sign up for a healthy- food delivery service for my family's busy weekdays but I haven't even received my first delivery yet and I'm already disappointed!  After seeing their ad on Facebook, I went to their website and everything looked amazing so I proceeded to sign up.  The default delivery date showed this Friday and I discovered I was unable to change the delivery date to next week (as I know I will be out of town this weekend for Easter).  On this same screen it states, "You can change the day later,"  so I went on through the purchasing process.  I selected the $129 plan for 12 meals a week which I felt was worth it considering the time I would save during the week.  After completing my order I could not find anywhere that would let me change the date.  I searched all over the site and the Help section with no luck so I emailed customer service with my concerns immediately after placing the order.  Their reply was absolutely shocking.  Shocking because it's 2016 and Customer Service is key to the success of any business and Freshly could care less if they address my issue.  They basically told me that the order was already processed and suggested that I donate the food or give it to a friend if I don't want it.  I never said I did not want the delivery, it just needs to come next week because I will be out of town Fri-Sun so no one would be there to receive the order.    I cannot wrap my mind around how they believe this is an acceptable reply to my email.  I'm a brand new customer that expressed my concerns about the delivery date 4 days prior to delivery and literally as soon as I placed the order.

70m83Td9fwhWlZPHFqyXgw.text: I wish there was negative ratings, one star is too much for this business. They deleted my review off their facebook page, and blocked me from posting a new review, and deleted my review off their website.... no wonder, when you visit their website they have all 5 stars reviews.   Horrible customer service. Only after the money with extreme disregard to their customers.  I would definitely not recommend Freshly to anyone.  When a company decides that it is ok to ship perishable food to an empty house, despite me giving notice that I want to cancel the order if the week, 5 min after the deadline on Friday for a wednesday delivery, it just speaks loud to their extreme greed and unprofessionalism.

Bq_3QTla90BnJUegjjykYw.text: 1) Food was SUBPAR, mushy, and lacking flavor. Did not stay fresh by the 3rd day. Don't trust that expiration date.  2) I am a recycling advocate but the recycling process for this packaging was the biggest pain in my arse.   3) Customer Service thumbs down. Missed the skip deadline by just a few hours, wrote them right away (same day of deadline) and they told me they couldn't help me. Right! Somehow I doubt they were cooking my meals between when I wrote them and when they responded. It's clear my food hadn't been prepared yet or shipped. Money-grubbing. No sense of accommodation. Cancelled immediately afterward.  Would not recommend this service.  I'm sure they'll respond to this justifying their practice as they have with all the other reviews -- Your copied and pasted response is not going to change my mind about my experience.

zNwRAZwOFQLXQZoYmzg1QQ.text: This is a refrigerated version of a Lean Cuisine. It is pre-made and has zero taste. I had to cover it in cheese just to eat it. Low end of edible for sure. It's marketed as a make your own dinner box, like Blue Apron or Plated, but it is most definitely NOT that type of service.

kAi-vaHlpNVOYa7FJj6fmA.text: DO NOT subscribe to this food delivery service. The quality is terrible and the meals are bland. The customer service is also terrible. They just repeat the same scripted responses and do not answer legitimate questions.   Also, be aware that the policy for cancellation is bad. I signed up through a promotion and it was not clear that I was actually signing up for a subscription. I feel this is very sneaky.   They billed me for the second week of the delivery service even BEFORE the first weeks meal was delivered. But did not send me that receipt until AFTER they billed my credit card.They would not let me cancel the the order because they said the food has already been prepared even though it was 3 days before it was to be shipped.

RtkUEbRoFtktGbJOa54hGg.text: Do not subscribe!  I signed up for their promotion of 2 weeks for $39 per week.  There was snow the second week and the meals did not get delivered.  They delivered my second meal the third week and charged $59.99 to my credit card, but subsequently sent a message saying I would get a credit but it may take a couple of months before it would appear on my statement.  It's been 3 months and they never issued the credit, so I contacted them today and they said I waited too long to contact them about my credit and all they could offer was half off a future delivery!  Now I've had to dispute the charge with my cc company.  Also, food was mediocre at best.

CwETQ86MxV1yiB5b4h4-Tw.text: I checked out their website, but I decided it wasn't for me so I cancelled my subscription right away.  However my card was charged anyway even if I didn't get anything delivered.  Unfortunately, I didn't realize this till much later (a year later) when I looked at my bank statement.  I called them for refund and told me it's too late cuz they only have a 7 day window in their policy.  I even asked to at least send me the meals I paid for and consider this an exception to their policy (which  a lot of businesses do for customer satisfaction).  In the end, the supervisor could only give me 50% off credit from the regular price.  My card was charged $39 which was a first time special price, and the current regular price is $60.  You do the math.  It's too bad.  Both the customer rep and her supervisor were very nice to me though but their policy failed me.  Businesses should be better than this to their customers.

yckAiGLjNyVHhVudCtZ9rg.text: Got 6 meals, first time. Have eaten 4, accompanied by 4 stomach aches. Trashed the rest........

TymSwNE0dRzpdI5HkmUrCg.text: We just got our first set of meals this weekend. Right off the bat, I was impressed with the eco friendly package.  We tried our first meals last night. I had pork carnitas, hubby had peppercorn steak. Both meals were excellent. Tonight we had penne with sausage. Again, excellent. Prep is super fast. Add a salad, and dinner is ready in 10 minutes!!

zCy0FiycXsfuRSHyTaX_HA.text: I thought that these foods would be more fresh and healthy. Unfortunately the amount of sodium in some of these dishes are way too high for me.  It was a struggle to eat some of these precooked meals. The flavors were definitely a swing and miss for me. I cannot recommend this company, and I will be looking elsewhere for a healthier and more tasty option.

OOxkaisG8EMFWvs-9joH0Q.text: I'm extremely conscious of keeping refined sugar out of my meals, and minimizing dairy and gluten as best as I can. I watch sodium levels and review the protein and healthy fat levels. Overall, I'm very pleased with Freshly's nutritional values. I'm also enjoying very tasty and healthy meals, not to mention that I just plain feel better. The full nutritional and balanced ingredients make a difference. The bonus is having more time and energy to focus on what matters. Also, I don't make a lot of money, so my food budget is tight, a challenge for a health-conscious eater. But, I've crunched the numbers, and Freshly is worth it. You are free to use my code to try it out: friend6392x8ba60c6850366b   They let you skip weeks or stop at anytime.

70FHgxggijA_eSZgg2WGAQ.text: So very  disappointing our very first delivery was left at our door we live in Arizona it's extremely hot in Arizona when we discovered it had been left at our door all of the contents were very hot the meat was hot everything looked absolutely horrible hopefully the cancellation process won't be a bad experience as well

nA_2rNN_9phj6ua3IN9McQ.text: My husband and I are both personal trainers and we're trying out meal prep services because we have specific nutrition goals and no time to cook. I was pleasantly surprised when we got our first delivery. Everything is delicious!! Whenever we cook our meals at work, everyone comments on how good it smells. It fits in easily to our day because they are fairly reasonable with calories and super high in protein. I've been recommending Freshly to all my clients. It's also nice that you can skip weeks at a time if you are going on a vacation. Thumbs up for Freshly!

QSto5xg_zaETgtZtnLi00A.text: I got sick from the few meals I did eat. It was my first time using the service. I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because the online chat was helpful, Alex was nice and helped me get a refund and to cancel the next box that was ordered.

H5ojY-K-gTpx9cWGdcMisQ.text: I have mixed feeling about Freshly. Some of their options are delicious, others, not so much. The turkey dinner was gross, but the steak with mashed red potatoes was so tender and wonderful. Overall, the price is too much for what you get so I cancelled.

uLKGNjokb9Zjsi_Ok_PwlA.text: All of my 6 meals in my most recent delivery had the same expiration date which was 3 days after the delivery. Just like throwing money in the trash can.

BHuNqQ_iM3ACIMsG8-8CCg.text: I had previously cancelled Freshly when their delivery was way past it's delivery date and I was told not to eat the meals. I was also expected to be responsible for safely disposing of the unsafe food. Eventually, Freshly picked up their delivery. All was well, but I cancelled as I found the meals very average. I recently received an e mail offering a discount. So I gave Freshly another opportunity, in the hopes that their shipping and food quality had improved. But by accepting the 'special', I also re-activated my old subscription with knowing I had. There was no indication of what was about to happen. I received shipping notices that my meals were on their way, but no listing of what was shipped. What I received was two packages containing 12 meals. 6 from my order and another 6 from my old subscription that had been reactivated without my knowledge or request. This company has problems. I have cancelled my subscription yet again. My first impression was correct. Be careful when you order and don't expect them to correct their errors.

4cC70Bg7erqF4vo6u5leYQ.text: **Update**  they have offered to refund half what I paid so upping my review to 3 stars instead of one.  Since I couldn't return the meals outright I did end up eating them.  Overall the food was good tasting.  The steak did taste good as well as several other dishes.  There wasn't anything that was bad tasting so they're doing a good job on making their meals taste good.      Original review:  I really was hoping this would be a great experience but unfortunately it is not.  I just received my order today for the first time and the portion sizes are A LOT smaller than the portion sizes on their website.  When I called Freshly customer service, the guy said that it's not posted on their website but he said portion sizes vary because they outsource from several different places, and that they go by weight.  The problem is if they go by total weight, they can add more potatoes and beans and less steak and claim it's the same weight, even though their picture on the website shows different proportions.  A couple examples out of the 9 meals I ordered are the meatloaf and the steak.  Both portions were 1/3 the size of the website picture.  What I got even when you hold a fork up to the tray to compare scale like the website has a fork to compare scale.  I am highly disappointed and cancelled my service with the customer service rep only 10 minutes after opening the box, even before I tried a single meal.  I wish I could just send the 9 meals back as I feel it's False advertising and they don't state on their website that portion sizes vary.   You will only find that out if you call customer service.  I feel cheated, like this is False advertising not disclosing that to new customers.  Like I said, I sincerely want to just send the 9 meals back to them unopened and ask for a refund.  I'm very disappointed.
